Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: Adambe
Reviews.Content: Great location, great staff, stunning room. Big bathroom with molton brown products, complimentary soft drinks. Good quality breakfast. This hotel delivered in terms of all my expectations. It is difficult to find fault with anything really. If I have to be picky, I would say that the rooftop pool dissapointed because of noise, partly from the hotel airvents, but also due to an enormous construction site a block away. The pool itself is great but not really for relaxing by. I would definitely stay here again when visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Too expensive”
Reviews.Author: Maly0837
Reviews.Content: While the hotel rooms were nice and staff exceptionally friendly and helpful, the hotel itself wasn't worth the money we paid for at all being a very small boutique hotel with limited facilities. You're paying the prices of a 5 star hotel to stay at a very basic hotel. Breakfast was basic with the small breakfast room located in the foyer right next to the reception desk. The infinity pool was nothing spectacular but most disappointing was that it closed at 6pm which wasn't really convenient. Our rooms were nice, complete with a nespresso machine but the views were the back of some lane ways so at night when people were walking through or talking, you can hear everything. Most disturbing was we would hear some loud sounds of water?? within the walls constantly while sleeping or watching tv and our shower floors felt like they hadn't been cleaned for a while because it was slimy with orangy mold/soap scum. The only reason we stayed at this hotel was because of it's high ranking and positive reviews on trip advisor and that's because a day or two after check out I received an email from Naumi hotel asking me to review them hotel on Trip Advisor. Overall this hotel is more suitable if you were on a business trips and just need a place to sleep but definitely not if you are on holiday. I wouldn't come back or recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “10yr Anniversary”
Reviews.Author: Megan H
Reviews.Content: Naumi is in a great location, just behind the Raffles Hotel and close to Raffles City Shopping Centre, Suntec Centre and Chijmes (cool bars and restaurants). Stayed for 6 nights in April. Because there are only 40 rooms, there is no hustle and bustle and it is a very welcome place to return to after the heat and crowds of Singapore. The rooftop pool is deep and has great views. The rooms are very spacious and have everything you need (including unbrella for the odd afternoon rain storm). We took advantage of the full size fridge (duty free beer and bourbon from Changi Airport) and enjoyed the free daily supply of soft drinks and tea and coffee pods for the Nespresso. Very relaxing rooms with two free movie channels plus discovery, cnn etc. You will get to know the staff and they will know you by name. They were always looking for more to do for us. Even brought up complementary Chandon Champagne on arrival to celebrate our anniversary - an unexpected sweet touch. All the advice we received was sound. Breakfast (included) was very good and the buffet changes slightly everyday. The omelette is recommended, as are the chicken chipolatas. For an inexpensive bite, try Swee Kee's (Black and Gold sign) near the corner of Seah St and North Bridge Road. Cheap food and drinks and very nice. All in all, location, accommodation, service was exactly what we were looking for. Peace and Quiet. Only ever saw a max of 4 other guests by the pool. Plenty of room. Those looking for Bigger and Brassier / Hustle and Bustle = better, then perhaps you need to look towards Marina Bay Sands. We are very glad we chose Naumi and would certainly return. One small critique:- Perhaps look for a way to quiet the effect of the closing sliding doors on the bathrooms. You can hear and almost feel the shudder when guests next door or above close the sliding door too quickly / hard. Maybe a thick foam / rubber buffer between the wooden door and frames would do the trick??

Reviews.Title: “Great Rooftop View”
Reviews.Author: girlgtlondon
Reviews.Content: Stayed here at the tail end of our 3 week honeymoon. Was initially wooed by the spectacular views from rooftop infinity pool - did not disappoint on arrival. Overall, the hotel is very small/intimate which is part of it's draw. Centrally located, literally across the street from Raffles. Rooms are spacious and well stocked. GREAT beds, so big and comfy. Staff service is great - we were able to store some of our luggage there for 3 weeks prior to checking in which was a great service. Breakfast was superb - huge assortment. Only negative would be that some wear and tear is starting to show - areas like the pool are largely unsupervised so not tidied up regularly with lots of used towels all over the place. Washrooms on both the rooftop and in the lobby could do with a proper clean/update. Generally, seems like they are a tad understaffed at times which you wouldn't expect from a hotel of this standard, especially given the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Naumi is Great!”
Reviews.Author: Atlgardenlady
Reviews.Content: We recently spent several days at Naumi and found the staff and location excellent. We knew the only view was from the pool deck but chose the hotel for value and location -- across from Raffles. It is within walking distance of museums, shopping and restaurants. The breakfast buffet was very good and we liked the lobby location. "V" who is one of the staff members there knew by day two that I liked black tea with lemon and delivered as soon as he saw me. The mattress was the best of the trip of 5 star hotels. We liked the room configuration and the free wi-fi compared to Intercontinental in Hong Kong where they wanted $21 per day. The exercise room is small but adequate since we seemed to be the only ones using it. All in all we were very pleased with our choice.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent, bit noisey”
Reviews.Author: Dirttdog
Reviews.Content: Stayed for over for 2 stays in April, 2012. We had a trip to Indonesia from Singapore Had a corporate room Good: Staff lovely and helpful; Early arrival and room was ready (travel agent did this I think); Bed was comfortable; Beer downstairs was cold; Pool, though not large, it did the job and had a great view, Tea and coffee making facilities in the room which was great; Room was nice; Breakfast was great; Location was terrific, could walk everywhere, Lots of places to eat and drink around the area, Raffles city shopping complex ( and food hall down stairs), Chjimes complex ( has live music some nights), Bugis road markets and shopping mall ( and food hall particularly the Chinese steam dumpling place) Stored our luggage for a week whilst travelling in Indonesia) Late flight out to Oz, was allowed to use the pool shower to freshen up and change for the flight Bad. The noise from showers and toilets flushing next door and above was distracting. The room above us kept on banging chairs, so sound does travel a lot. The closing of the room doors echoes a lot Recommendation: Great, would stay there again but would have the top floor due to noise.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money. Dissapointing”
Reviews.Author: Mark C
Reviews.Content: For the amount of money we paid for this hotel (S$900 for two nights) I had expected more of this hotel. The rooms were large and nicely appointed, however this place lacked any wow factor. The view from my room was of the back end of restaurants in a neighbouring laneway, which meant that we kept the blinds closed most of the time. The hotel room furnishings were what you would expect of any five star hotel, but nothing exceptional. The infinity pool was small and unspectacular, and closed at 6pm which we found really inconvenient. The breakfast buffet was basic, and we found that on both mornings we had a second breakfast outside the hotel. Service from hotel staff was probably the highlight. In short I beleive you can get better value elsewhere, and we wished we had stayed at the Marina Bay Sands instead. This is an old building tarted up with new furnishings to create a "boutique" hotel, but lacks the polish to justify the price.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant stay”
Reviews.Author: hawaiienne
Reviews.Content: After a red-eye flight from Europe, I was relieved to arrive at Naumi at around 8 am. The staff kindly checked for an available room for early check-in. They were able to upgrade me to a suite, which was nice, but I had to pay an extra half-day fee for early check-in. This surprised me a little, since I have not been charged such a fee in the past if a room is available early. The lobby is indeed small, but very pleasant. Breakfast was tasty, although sometimes the hot food options ran out and they also ran out of drinking glasses?! Service is still a little spotty, it seemed there was no system to make sure that all guests were asked about a beverage and eggs. But they were always responsive if approached. The suite was very comfortable and large for being in the middle of the city. The bathroom was HUGE, even bigger than necessary. The bed was very comfortable. Air conditioning was a bit unresponsive, leaving me chilled after walking in from the very warm temperatures outside. The pool was really nice, water was the perfect temperature and great views.

Reviews.Title: “Tiny details make a difference”
Reviews.Author: Elderlytraveller
Reviews.Content: Beautiful little hotel with a vertical garden outside and lots of tiny details which are fun for the experienced traveller, such as the tiny handle to open the sliding door to close off the bathroom, and the lovely moulded sun-lounges by the swimming pool. The breakfast was wonderful (porridge!) and the dearest fruit salad with tinned lychees (yum!) combined with tiny diced fresh fruit. Strangely, nobody seems to eat there for lunch or dinner, but that is possibly because Seah STreet is full of cheap Singaporean eating places (some with added MSG, so look out!) Very high quality teabags are provided in the room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: David C
Reviews.Content: A fantastic hotel!! Excellent facilities, great location and very helpful staff. N gestation in recommending this hotel!! Recommend having a cocktail by the roof top pool, there is a wonderful view of the city. The barman Sugar makes a mean cocktail indeed!!!M

Reviews.Title: “Superb!”
Reviews.Author: Chris_and_Peter
Reviews.Content: We received a very friendly welcome and the staff went out of their way to be helpful throughout our stay. The room was spacious and fully equipped with everything we could possibly need, even an espresso coffee maker and a microwave oven. The bed and pillows were exceptionally comfortable and the shower was the best hotel shower we've ever had. The location, right next to the Raffles Hotel, was ideal for getting about, and the rooftop infinity pool was great for relaxing in when we returned. Thank you Naumi for a wonderful stay!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Mark B
Reviews.Content: Stayed here on a business trip to Singapore in 2011 and was amazed at the quality of the hotel, there was nothing that was too difficult for the staff and the service was friendly and professional. The roof top infinity pool was a beautiful place to take in the city lights at night. The location is central and travelling around is easy in the city. Would stay here again if I ever visit Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Memorable Experience!”
Reviews.Author: Hamood-Alam
Reviews.Content: It was really an enjoyable and memorable experience to stay at Naumi. Beautiful decor of the rooms, complimentary Wi-Fi, roof-top infinity pool, Wii for the kids, good location, and above all the extremely courteous and helpful staff made our stay a truly enjoyable one. Highly recommend it to anyone coming to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Super staff”
Reviews.Author: _TL_68
Reviews.Content: Excellent, friendly and helpful staff. Nice breakfast. Comfortable rooms. Minimal traffic noise. A stone's throw from Raffles.The noise insulation could be better - we could hear the lift and footsteps and plumbing from the room above.

Reviews.Title: “Pleasant hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: Ashley2801
Reviews.Content: Stayed in naumi previously and was upgraded to luxury suite with a late check out at 4pm. But this time round, occupancy level was very high so we were not ungraded but to the honest the deluxe room we had booked was equally good too. And we were given a late check out at 2pm. Staff were attentive and friendly and they provided turn down services at about 6pm. Everything in the room was perfect. The bed was really comfy and they even provided bolster! Overall the hotel was excellent in terms of service, room and breakfast. Just two little feedbacks, cleanliness of the room could be a little better as the kitchenette area wasn't thoroughly clean and there were stains in the bathtub too, some amenities in the bathroom was beginning to show some age. Another thing is, we borrowed the wii set and DVD from the receptionist. Same as before the wii set was a bit faulty and they had to change the controller and wii set a few times before it worked. The DVD was faulty too. But these didn't affect our stay just that cleanliness could be improved further.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: mekanoid
Reviews.Content: Large rooms with workspace, lounge area, bar and oversized bathroom with separate bath/shower and luxury amenities from molton brown. Staff were wonderful, providing a homely feel as you see the same faces each day. Nothing was a problem. Rooftop has excellent views, lounges and a decent sized pool to do a few laps. Gym is split into 2 small rooms over 2 floors and is probably the only thing I was unimpressed by. They do however have a third floor/room for yoga which is a nice touch for those inclined. Wifi is free, breakfast is basic but satisfactory and the location is great right next to raffles hotel and raffles city shopping centre. Overall a great experience, I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “A jewel of a hotel”
Reviews.Author: russell t
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our stay here. A large 2 section room with the ability to make it very dark and very cold. Good room facilities include a small kitchen section and a decent coffee machine plus selection of tea and coffee. A good location with an easy walk to the local MRT or bus routes. Breakfast is of good quality with enough choice. Check in is easy and customer service is excellent. One gripe is that check out could be better - having a cool room to change clothes in, rather than the pool area would be good.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the money”
Reviews.Author: koroua
Reviews.Content: Mixed emotions about this hotel. The staff are fantastic personality wise but unabel to deliver a consistent 5 star/luxury experience. * Breakfast - best description is "herding cats" and I am talking about the way the staff work. Sometimes you get five offers of coffee before you get the one you ordered and other days you cannot get anyone to take an order. The same applies to the eggs request. * Smoke-free hotel - the hotel pushes this however guests seem to be able to smoke around the pool to the smothering level for those of us that do not smoke. Saw guests smoking there while staff were showing potential guests around and nothing was said.Had to leave the pool area at least once due to the smoke level. And also do not sit next to the windows in the restaurant as the smoke from the guests who smoke out the front wafts through the gaps. * Ladies only floor - it isn't. I had requested it but noticed quite a few couples also staying ont he floor (it is a total of five rooms out of 40 in the hotel). Please do not advertise something you cannot deliver. * Bed Linen - attached is a photo of the lovely hole in one of the bed linen (duvet cover) also small holes in the pillows were noticed. * Bathroom - bring your own bleach - see photos of the silicon around the shower. The mould is outstanding. However, great location to get around from, staff are lovely if ineffectual, rooms are a really good layout, TV channels not great, the spa and nail places they recommend are really good (had to test drive them), breakfast is well cooked (strange options though …lol). It is sad, it is like they have a really good base and NO PROCESSES to support the infrastructure.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel”
Reviews.Author: SofiaG10_Lis
Reviews.Content: Great hotel! Really cozy, beautiful decoration. Great location, right next to Raffles Hotel and close to the marine and subway. Very pleasant staff and the breakfast really good. Spacious and really nice room! And the pool on the top really cool!

Reviews.Title: “Naumi Hotel - March 2012”
Reviews.Author: jwystand
Reviews.Content: Really good stay, nice comfortable hotel, with some joie de vivre. Staff were very attentive, nice infinity pool on the roof. Handily located for central Singapore particularly Chimes and Raffles Plaza. Recommeded.

Reviews.Title: “Another Perfect Experience”
Reviews.Author: viperrider03
Reviews.Content: Having reviewed this hotel twice before, it would be easy to skip a review here. However, having taken other reviewer comments on board previously, and having had successful stays as a result, I offer this as reassurance if you are thinking about the Naumi hotel but can't make up your mind. I think I have stayed here six times over the years. On arrival, the check in clerk knew my name, knew that I had stayed before and immediately upgraded my room free of charge. Immediate good impression. The room is meticulously clean. The bed is very comfortable, the bathroom is spacious with a tub and shower, and the Nespresso machine is welcome the morning after a long flight. With a LCD scree that swivels between sitting room and bedroom, an iPod dock should you require background music and very comfortable chairs, it is difficult to see what else you could require. I often keep an eye on the reviews of this hotel and frankly, some of the mealy-mouthed comments are completely unwarranted. This hotel consistently lives up to and exceeds expectations and the staff are always courteous and polite. The pool is the defining moment in most peoples stay. Get up there when it opens and enjoy the peace and tranquility of early morning Singapore (unless I'm staying, of course, in which case you'll have to share the pool with me). I stay for business, but I am sure that if were thinking of this as a honeymoon destination, I'm sure it wouldn't disappoint. Singapore is a city waiting to be discovered and the Naumi hotel puts you right in the centre of that mix, with a location opposite Raffles hotel if you want to live it up, but close enough to Orchard Road if the credit card needs and outing. My booking is already fixed for November and I'm looking forward to returning.

Reviews.Title: “Staff go that bit further to make guests welcome”
Reviews.Author: Nigel R
Reviews.Content: Stayed from 19/3 - 22/3/12. Very much enjoyed stay. Great location. Rooms very comfortable and all staff very helpful and welcoming. All seem to cover a multitude of different jobs and nothing was too much trouble. Our room on 9th Floor needs some minor cosmetic refurbishment but room spacious & facilities very good including free internet and very comfortable bed. Breakfast was also included along with coffee & tea making facilities and soft drinks and bottled water were topped up free on a daily basis. Great views of city from infinity pool on top floor. Will definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect intimate boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: dabby44
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 2 nights at the Naumi, before emabarking on a cruise. It was perfect. Attentive and helpful staff and the accommodation was excellent. I had spoken to a number of people about the hotel before staying and nobody had ever heard of it despite the fact that Trip Advisor rates it as #4. However after our stay we will most certainly put the word out!

Reviews.Title: “Problem with cancelation was resolved eventually”
Reviews.Author: T R
Reviews.Content: Note to readers: This review only addresses one particular aspect of the hotel, namely that of how cancelations are handled. In case you are 100% sure that you will be staying at the hotel and that your reservation will never need to be canceled, you can skip this review; otherwise, I hope you will find it useful in some way or another. Here is what happened: I made a reservation at Naumi Hotel Singapore for staying four nights during February 2012 at the normal full-price rate (S$400.18 per night, not the discounted "Advance Purchase" rate) through the hotel's own webpage. Unfortunately, I had to cancel the reservation. I canceled it two months in advance (Dec. 1, 2011), immediately received a confirmation e-mail from the hotel, and assumed that everything was ok. However, on Feb. 11, the hotel charged my credit card one night's room fee of S$400.18 anyway. I e-mailed the hotel about it on Feb. 16, and apparently, the information about my cancelation had not been transferred from the hotel's online booking partner to the hotel. The front office manager of Naumi Hotel, Mr. S.T., was very polite and helpful, and assured me that this was an isolated incident. After several rounds of e-mails and waiting patiently for one month, most of the fee was finally refunded to my bank account on March 16. For the record, no future room fee discounts, offers of free upgrades, etc. were given as compensation for the inconvenience caused. Also, I only received about S$385 of the S$400.18 that I had paid because even when the foreign exchange rate remains constant, every bank's buying and selling rates differ so that the bank can make a profit, i.e., if I buy S$400.18 from the bank and then immediately sell S$400.18 back to the bank then I will end up with slightly less money (anyway, that is not the hotel's fault so it's not important for this review). In short, the problem was resolved but it took a long time and it was not done as smoothly as it could have been. I hope that the hotel will improve their booking routines and communication protocols with their online booking partner so that this kind of problem can be avoided in the future.

Reviews.Title: “Could do better”
Reviews.Author: philippeenrique
Reviews.Content: We have been twice to the Naumi hotel, once in February 2012 and on our way back from Asia, in March 2012. This hotel is a puzzle to me. It is well situated, the staff is friendly, the rooms are good, but the service could improve much. There is a great potential for it to become a fantastic hotel but it is not for the time being. The good things about the hotel: location, people, decoration, quiet, good beds The things that can be improved: sense of initiative (you can stay one hour sitting in the lobby with friends and none would even offer a glass of water), issues with early check-in:late check-out, the service at the swimming pool (there is no-one there, you have to dial reception if you want water or a drink), the tiny gym and most of all, the breakfast buffet is really really bad: at a level of a 2* hotel. Choice is very limited (no all bran, no soy milk, no ham every day, etc...), fruits are not fresh, bread is not good, juice is not freshly squeezed, etc... So maybe people going to boutique hotels are not supposed to eat much at breakfast, but come on... Seriously? Also, the internet connection gave me a lot of frustrating problems, which is not acceptable. So once again, there is a great potential for this hotel to be excellent, but things need to be thought again for a better result and for better ultimate service to the customers, even if, once again, the staff is nice and friendly.

Reviews.Title: “Very Comfortable Business Suite”
Reviews.Author: MingBG
Reviews.Content: We booked the "luxury suite" for a day-long business meeting, and were very pleased with the facilities. We didn't use the bedroom area at all nor the bathroom much, however the meeting area (big enough to fit a conference table for 10) was just right for us. The furnishings were luxurious (Molten Brown toiletries!), although I dont know if they furnish the normal guest rooms similarly. The Naumi (pronounced "No-mi") is a 2 year old boutique hotel with some 40+ rooms and a great location. It is on a small street directly opposite the stately Raffles Hotel, close to the business district and shopping areas, and an easy 8-10 min walk from the MRT subway station. he side streets around it (especially Purvis St.) are full of good dining options, from casual eateries - many of them well-known, such as Chin Chin, Yet Con chicken rice, First Thai etc, to the upmarket Garibaldi and Ying Thai. While the hotel appears to have few staff, all were very professional, responsive and friendly. Our meeting package included a set lunch in the lobby cafe/bar, and I have to say the lunch while simple was excellent. We also had drinks in the same area at the end of the day, and in the evening the lobby bar turns into a pretty funky lounge with a cool vibe, attracting a well-dressed business crowd. I'm guessing the room costs are relatively high (accomodation costs in Singapore have just become ridiculously expensive in the past couple of years!), no wonder that the hotel's patrons look to be largely a business clientele, likely frequent travellers (both men and women, as the hotel has a woman-only floor) in search of something out of the ordinary instead from the usual big name 5-star chains. I did not take any photos however the photos on the hotel's website are pretty accurate.

Reviews.Title: “Courteous staff and great location”
Reviews.Author: Kluiver C
Reviews.Content: All is perfect in this hotel.We chose this hotel for its condition , which was spotless, and the professionalism of the staff, which was indeed the case. great hotel

Reviews.Title: “My fav hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dentcheung
Reviews.Content: We have been staying at Naumi Hotel before the recent years. After baby break it was the first time to travel with our baby boy to Singapore. Staff was great and our son loved the staff. They let him play with their ipad and more than one time gave us some break for breakfast or a drink. Staying there almost for 3 weeks Andrew loved the girls and boys ;). Hey, he misses all of you guys. Service was excellent again, people were always very helpful, Yes, it is your personal luxury hotel in SG. We will come back for sure. Location is great near Raffles and Bugis. You are close enough to the major attractions. Pool on rooftop gives you break from the rush. Our son loved it to take a swim there. For a bite try the restaurants next door, yummie chicken rice...or head for Raffles City Mall for the food court downstairs. See you next time again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: BeeYee298298
Reviews.Content: Good location, clean rooms, friendly staff. The rooftop infinity pool is the best place to relax & the view is wonderful. The breakfast served is healthy & taste delicious.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Singapore?”
Reviews.Author: jimsquirrel
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a Deluxe room over new year 2011/12. The room was beautiful, separated bedroom and living space by a rotating TV. Little kitchen area with complimentary Nespresso. Nice bathroom with sepaarte rain shower and giant twin tub. Really stylish and friendly hotel, breakfast was amazing, especailly if you wait for it to quieten down after the ealy rush - champagne for breakfast always sets the day up well! Rooftop pool is really small but is stunning in the evening as the lights come up. Well located for town - not too close to Orchard road madness, and taxis are really cheap in Singapore so anywhere is in easy reach. Easy walk to the Lau-pa-sat market for great food from loads of hawker stalls and the best satay ever!

Reviews.Title: “The Best in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Globegallop
Reviews.Content: This is an oasis in Singapore, where everything is bigger and better its nice to find somewhere that is calm and a true home away from home, the best hard working staff look after your needs, the best little roof top pool in Singapore,, the room i had was a Deluxe and it was Deluxe, cannot wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Sampan24
Reviews.Content: I really like this hotel both for business and for pleasure. It is small and intimate yet the room size is generous, the facilities and restaurant is sleek and everything is new and very clean. Above all the staff are extremely pleasant, friendly and helpful. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “Nice little oasis of calm in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: elgintraveller
Reviews.Content: Very nice little hotel in Singapore with all of the little luxuries that you would want, from Molten Brown toiletries, and welcome biscuits, and also free soft drinks in the minibar, which I think is pretty rare nowadays. Staff are helpful, rooms are clean and have good views. Pool area is fine, small, but this hotel is predominantly for business travellers I think, so perhaps it doesn't need to be bigger. A very good breakfast is offered in the lobby, with a lot of choice. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Unsure visit turns into a brilliant experience........”
Reviews.Author: Looknfeel
Reviews.Content: Had heard about Naumi from friends (but when it comes to comfort and living habits, even the best of friends differ) so was not 100% sure. Scanned the site of the hotel thrice over, but then they all say the best things about the worst accommodation (who would not blow their own trumpet and showcase themselves in the best light) so was not 100% sure. Spoke to a few locals about it , some heard of it some not , some were vague, so the unsure element remained. decided to take a chance and go ahead with booking the room started the interaction experience with the Naumi Singapore....................... Starting with the phone call for reservation (not naming you here S*****I,) but the promptness and quick assistance and ability to suggest and help set in a feeling of "being in the right hands" arrival experience and the already clued on check in staff (hello P**L) was like a fresh soothing feel after a long long flight. (the other two ladies at the check in time who were around , thank you too). Was so intrigued by the "differentness" of the hotel and the personal touch (that you will never find in a 100, 200, 700 room one) that made request to see the entire property. The request was promptly heard and looked after and (of course all room were not vacant for a see) was executed as if it was an order. Little things like , tried the room order, just for trying that is the only front desk facade good (like in many many hotels) but was happy to be wrong, what amazing promptness and service. same way necessarily tried to be clueless about getting a singtel sim, and there came prompt assistance with a personal feel that one felt looked after (not like other hotels where attempts are to suggest something over the top or out of budget, where one feels taken for a ride). same way to step out inquired about the train and way about it (although used taxis all the way) but was explained so well and in a nice assistance , that i can guide some one wanting to use the train without actually having used one. ordered room service in wee hours to again check how it lives up to the claims of 24X7 availability, and was pleasantly surprised without having to wait as one would expect when ordering in wee hours of night. Morning break fast service was good, although it was usual breakfast but service by the staff (all on their toes and personally taking care of each guest) was commendable and worth remembering. very small things like checking out experience, leaving baggage after check out for the day, assistance with dlosing a baggage tag, hailing a cab to the airport (the girl who insisted on seating me into the cab and say bye would have been lighter than my bag, but she insisted) making sure what terminal and all goes well. seeing off a guest as if seeing off a member of a family........i mean many many little things that make all the difference and go a loooong mile. over all a FANTASTIC and worth remembering every minute of it experience...... and makes me more than 200% SURE great job team NAUMI keep it up!!! do not not not let the great praise and recommendation make you slip , hold your head high and be just the way you are . Hoping to see you all soon. CHEERS

Reviews.Title: “Good city hotels in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: broovegarry
Reviews.Content: I stayed in Naumi Hotel that is the best city hotels in Singapore. Last month, I went for an official tour in Singapore. I must say that their staff is so caring that I was not given any chance to complaint. They perfectly understand various requirements of different clients. I am completely speechless as far as the atmosphere, arrangement of services and location is concerned.

Reviews.Title: “like naumi much”
Reviews.Author: anita_pangaribuan
Reviews.Content: Like it from the day i made reservation, the staffs replied fast, then enjoying the pick up ride from the airport to the hotel when we arrived, warm and friendly staff from checking in until out. We stayed at the family room and we love the room (two separate sleeping room, one is smaller and has its own telly, the other telly, bigger, is at the living room) and the amenities, they have TWG tea series, Nespresso coffee machine and capsules (oh, how the smell of the newly made coffee really made our day), toaster, electric stove, plates, bowl, glasses, cup varies for coffee, tea etc, happy with our breakfast menu, great view from the top, and enjoy it while relaxing on the swimming pool. Located near esplanade MRT station, lots of place to eat, well, we like naumi much :)

Reviews.Title: “lovely boutique hotel near Raffles”
Reviews.Author: Brandon228
Reviews.Content: i love boutique hotels & Naumi is definitely one worth checking. Great location and decor . Free drinks from the mini fridge and the little pantry is stocked with TWG teas & Nespresso capsules. The property is surrounded by good restaurants such as Garibaldi's , Yhing Thai as well as local heritage Yet Con. Two thumbs up for this cosy little hotel

Reviews.Title: “naumi hotel”
Reviews.Author: stephanie_vanegas
Reviews.Content: The staff is friendly, the location is great and the view oer the city from the top roof pool is amazing. I deffinitely recommend this hotel ofr a confortable and enjoyable stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “loved it all”
Reviews.Author: suzanneDH r
Reviews.Content: we had a very pleasant stay in this hotel. Location is very nice, staff very friendly en swimmingpool amazing! next trip to singapore we'll surely like to stay in this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: Rachel S
Reviews.Content: This hotel is well worth the money. The location is great, the staff are friendly and the rooms are nicely appointed - although the standard rooms are small. The roof terrace with pool and bar is one of the nicest that I've come across in Singapore. Again this It's small, but so is the hotel so I've never stayed here and felt myself tripping over other guests which gives it a boutique feel. Nothing is too difficult for the staff at Naumi which is what makes it feel like a 5 star hotel, albeit some of the decor is starting to look a little worn. Really, I have no complaints about this place, it's a lovely hotel and it's my preferred choice when visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: DanFirther
Reviews.Content: Clean, excellent service, rooms with wow factor! Will stay again next time for sure

Reviews.Title: “not worth the money!”
Reviews.Author: _Betty_Sue_1108
Reviews.Content: I really would like to rate this hotel with zero points, but the one point is for one lady at the breakfast and for the view from the rooftop pool. If Naumi Hotel was a hostel and cost like SGD 80 per night I would like this hotel, but about SGD 400 per night for the cheapest room is too much for what they offer (or is it the Nespresso machine which makes the room so pricy??) Now let's begin.. When we arrived i had to push my suitcase myself the small ramp into the hotel. Since we checked in before 2 p.m. we had to wait a little for the room, but that was no problem, we could store our luggage and went shopping meanwhile. Staff at check in was friendly. About the room: very dark with 1960s style furniture... If you look for decoration, you won't find much. I'm still wondering why the hotel won an design award and is part of the small luxury boutique hotel group, because it's not very luxurious!! The bed is comfortable, but you can't get no rest if the housekeeping staff talks loud at 8 am and you hear everything from the outside.. Minibar is for free (Soda, Sprite and Coke, that's it). Room is very dark and if you want light at the wardrobe you have to go to the bedroom to switch it on. If you open the door of the wardrobe, you can't get into the bathroom. In the shower there was black mold... Breakfast: ok... first day we were asked if we want coffee, and the lady offered us cappuccino, caffe latte, moccha etc, another waiter asked us if we want an egg, any style. I offered scrambled egg, got an omelet (which was good). Next day we got just a cup of coffee with no milk, which i had to get from the buffett and we weren't even asked if we want an egg. Bread is under an infraded lamp (?), so the bread is always warm, but the cheese is right next to the bread, so the cheese was nearly melted! Poor service that day! The swimming pool is small, there are only a few sunchairs and due to an construction site near the hotel it was very very noisy. So, since we weren't satisfied at all we checked out after 2 nights and booked another hotel at Scotts Road, which was defenitely better than the Naumi! Would I stay there again or recommend it? NO!

Reviews.Title: “Really Great!”
Reviews.Author: Marc D
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Naumi for 4 nights in a deluxe room. I felt immediately comfortable. Rooms are rather large, modern, with all the attention to details that make a stay in a hotel different (Ipod deck, Nespresso coffee machine, large flat screen TV, free wireless internet connection, ...). Though some may consider the choice at the breakfast buffet limited, it was more than enough varied for me with every thing fresh, tasty and choice of omelettes served at your table, good coffee,... But what really stands out is the personnel and the service! One slight advice though to the management, there starts to be some very tiny signs of need for maintenance and it would be too bad to let the property aging to rapidly. I will stay again at Naumi hotel!

Reviews.Title: “A good choice”
Reviews.Author: LindaNZ
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Naumi Hotel in early February for two nights. I chose the hotel based on its location and price, and we were very pleased with it. The rooms are large, comfortable, with good bathrooms, and - on the Ladies' Floor at least - excellent amenities. The hair-straightener, for example, was very welcome. Wi-fi was good - though it wasn't turned on the first night we arrived (despite being told it would be) and we had to ask the next day. It wasn't a problem - if it had been, I'd have just visited reception again. Breakfast was good, but the egg-ordering system seems a little chaotic. A group was there whilst we were, and there was a bit of a mix-up with orders, including mine. But no-one seemed upset, and the rest of the service was good. The entrance to the hotel is quite unassuming, but it is the location that we liked. It is easy to walk to nearby places, including Marina Bay, and there is an MRT station (or two) nearby. We arrived after a long flight, both of us exhausted, so ended up eating a room service pizza (which was tasty and all we needed). We kicked ourselves though when the next morning we walked out and found the street is lined with casual eating places, including places with my favourite chicken rice, and lots of other options. As always in Singapore, I wished we had longer simply to eat! The pool looked appealing, and the view is great, though it is a small area. We didn't have time to use it. We were very happy with the Naumi. It's not a big/name five-star hotel, and so lacks some of the polish that you might find there. But the rooms are excellent, and so it turns out to be excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Mix review of Naumi”
Reviews.Author: stosito
Reviews.Content: Naumi is very clean and is located relatively well in the heart of the city. The problem is that is located in a small side street which many of the taxi drivers we experienced did not know the street name, which made for arriving to our hotel at night a bit of a challenge. We had a small problem getting a taxi to the main sea port on the day we checked out of which the receptionist was NOT successful in getting us a taxi on time like she told us previously, and which I had to run down the end of a block and get a taxi myself. Very strange circumstance.??

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location”
Reviews.Author: Angela D
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Naumi hotel for three nights over Christmas and it was just perfect. Its a corner of tranquility in a bustling city. The staff could not have been more attentive, the rooms were spacious, comfortable and clean - with the best pillows we have ever had!! The location, just around the corner from Raffles, means you are close to the main attractions and shopping centres. I have already recommended this hotel to a number of people and will certainly stay here again next time we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT!!! Defo staying there again”
Reviews.Author: iamavip
Reviews.Content: The rooms were spacious, we didn't get a good view, but we were planning on staying in much, we were there with 2 kids. The Staff were very helpful with providing us with a cot and turning the living sofa into a bed for our other child. Most important the rooms were clean, the hotel was clean. The staff were nice always smiling, and always ready to help. I loved the fact that we were only walking distance from the shopping and the train. We were there during christmas, there was some rain. But offcourse the hotel had umbrellas we could use. We enjoyed our stay, THANK YOU NAUMI!

Reviews.Title: “quaint boutique hotel, perfect location , very accomodating staff”
Reviews.Author: fufucruz
Reviews.Content: Naumi Hotel , highly recommended hotel.along seah street, just beside Raffles hotel on Beach road, very near raffles city, raffles hospital. small boutique hotel with very very spacious rooms. staff are always ready to help. either to get a taxi, book a tour ,they even upgraded my room as this is my third stay in this hotel. the ref is stocked with drinks for free, replinished everyday.bathroom very huge. very nice ammenities, very clean room, quiet room , you can get a good sleep, very personalized service and treatment! Highly recommended. price commensurate to the quality and service of this hotel. only positive things I can say. am really satisfied with my stay.my 12 year old son enjoyed using the wii, x-box.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing experience”
Reviews.Author: AlexandrosSem
Reviews.Content: I have never seen anything like this. The staff, the deco, the interior, the room facilities, the view from the roof was absolutely amazing. It must have been the best stay ever in a hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Personal Luxury”
Reviews.Author: Taural
Reviews.Content: Singapore is a city bursting with luxurius hotels and shops, most of them large, loud and impersonal. The Naumi Hotel takes all the cues of a designer boutique hotel, and brings it to a presonal level. We booked out stay through a club of small luxury hotels that we belong to, and were offered a complimentary upgrade, upon arrival...this did, in fact, influece our perception of the stay! Our suite was lovely, despite a bit of concern we had the state of the floors outside the elevator, which are stained. We fully enjoyed our room, the pool area and the location where the Naumi is situated. The staff was always friendly and helptful, and this makes a big difference to our experiences in other Singapore luxury hotels. We did not breakfast or eat at the hotel. With all of Singapore's wonderful resteraunts and street food stalls, it really did not seem necessary. We would love to come back to this very fine hotel and stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Oasis in city”
Reviews.Author: PhilpotsBrunei
Reviews.Content: Our 2nd stay at Naumi just for 1 night this time on route from Perth to Brunei. The staff are so professional & courteous & the 1st thing that hits you as you walk in to the lobby is the lovely smell - very calming & pleasant. Room facilities are excellent & well thought out more like a small apartment. We were upgraded to patio suite this time so had decked patio area outside. whilst extra space was nice it was very uninspiring looking at a high concrete wall all around. Would have been better to have some coloured paint or pot plants. Also there was a lot of noise coming through the airconditioning vent in ceiling from upstairs pipes each time water was run or toilet flushed. This was away from bed so was not a problem but some insulation might help. Breakfast is good choice buffet style. Seating is not the most comfortable being modern & contemporary but suits the hotel style. Location is great being close to Raffles City shopping centre, Raffles complex & Chimes (fabulous bar & restaurant complex), MRT closeby too. Would stay there again without a doubt.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff and Great Location”
Reviews.Author: westraveler
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Naumi Hotel in Dec 2010 and Jan 2011 for a week with our daughters and we decided to stay in Jan this year for 3 nights. We were just as impressed with the staff, the location, the space and the facilities included in this Hotel. It's right next to (or behind depending on where you are) the Raffles Hotel and close to Raffles City Shopping Centre and City Hall station. The chicken rice restaurant about 3 doors up was a great find and it has not changed in 12 months. The staff at Naumi were always polite, friendly and helpful. Each room has it's own Nespresso machine and the bathroom has Molton Brown products. It's very spacious with a separate lounge/dining/study area the bedroom next to it. The infinity pool on the top floor has amazing views to die for especially on NYE for the fireworks. Will definitely stay again when we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Understated Luxury”
Reviews.Author: gin_neko
Reviews.Content: Beautifully appointed hotel with modern facilities and attentive staff. Excellent location - right behind Raffle City and City Hall SMRT - and excellent baggage minding service for those with late flights out of Singapore. For those reviewers disgruntled over the lack of Resturant in the Hotel, firstly, they do provide a in room menu with meals and snack and secondly you are in Singapore, food is everywhere in the city, infact there are several (good) resturants and bars just next door and across the street, get out of the hotel and explore the city! Hotel of choice when in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Understated chic”
Reviews.Author: Aeparker81
Reviews.Content: If you want the best pool view near some amazing bars and restaurants in a hotel that is small enough to never feel crowded and is certainly not pretentious like some more well known ones... Look no further! We had 2 nights in a patio room after a business trip and were really able to relax, the hotel is a little oasis of calm just minutes from many major sites!! Next time we're in Sing we won't need to look further for a place to stay!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: HannaJEspoo_Finland
Reviews.Content: A small boutique hotel with a good location. We stayed at 1+3 nights, and the first night we were upgraded to Corporate Suite. This corporate suite was nice, but we loved our Deluxe room (405) what we had when we returned for 3 nights, room was spacious and cosy but still upscale. Both rooms had a bath tub and a separate shower booth, bath rooms were good sized and clean. Beds were comfortable and we slept well. Wireless internet in rooms worked, but isn't as fast as it could be. Breakfast was very basic hotel breakfast, our favourite was home made kiwi youghurt. Rooftop infinity pool has good views over the Marina bay area but the pool is definitely smaller than it seems in hotel pictures. Staff is friendly and helpful and made us feel very welcome. Our stay was enjoyable and we certainly would stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “You wouldn't find better service anywhere else.”
Reviews.Author: Fredex
Reviews.Content: We have now stayed in the Naumi Hotel four times and the most impressive thing was that they remembered our names from the second visit onwards. This hotel is shold be in the "Best Small Hotels of the World", if it isn't in there yet. The staff are great and the attitude that no request is beneath them is refreshing and welcome. It's handy for the centre and is right next door to the Raffles and the Raffles Shopping Centre.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel great location”
Reviews.Author: Weldge
Reviews.Content: Great hotel not many rooms so no stampede at breakfast. Great location for train system restaurants and bars. Great staff can't do enough for you. We tried to book into raffles but was full so glad it was after going there for a meal or would not have found this gem Very good value for money in a city that is extremely expensive. Tip for wine lovers don't come ( joke ) an average bottle of wine 60 bucks

Reviews.Title: “Just Good, not great”
Reviews.Author: phatsinoz
Reviews.Content: The pros: massive rooms that are tastefully decorated, high quality linens, amenities and gadgets. Charming staff that were very helpful and diligent, though the same can be said for most Asian hotel staff. They truly understand the notion of service. Wonderful quiet location that is very accessible for short walks if you can bear the humidity. The cons: the rooms are getting shabby and really need some touching up. The wifi logs out constantly, though this was a minor irritation as it was free and reliable. The quality of the breakfast can be hit or miss, with large variances in whats on offer. Not the most inviting public areas (non-existent actually) and I have to say, the infinity pool is much smaller than expected and overrated. Summary: would I stay here again? Probably. But wouldn't pay the same rate and would book the lowest end room as they are still huge when compared to the norm. This hotel deserves a 'Good' rating, but in the absence of this option (are you listening TripAdvisor?) I have rated them a Very Good as despite everything, it was an enjoyable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Ebyrne
Reviews.Content: Great little hotel, nice quite street, lovely, professional and friendly staff, large rooms (unusual in Singapore) roof top pool area is fantastic views to the city and marina bay sands. Suga the bar tender makes the best slings in town, much better than raffles! If you need to be surrounded by crowds and have a buzzing hotel scene go elsewhere but this is my favourite Singapore hotel. Convenient to mrt, taxis, shopping malls, restaurants.... Excellent.

Reviews.Title: “If you demand a high standard of care, do not stay here”
Reviews.Author: Charlotte P
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel because it is a smart boutique hotel in a great location. My choice was also guided by the fabulous-looking infinity pool on the rooftop, I prefer small intimate places and this seemed right. The rooms are spacious and have quite good amenities (nespresso machine, Molton Brown toiletries, large flat screen TV with international channels, The bathroom has been badly designed (sloppy tiling and toilet roll holder installed by someone with no brain) but most people would be satisfied. However, the hotel refuses to understand that most international visitors to Singapore are going to be leaving on flights in the evening. My "Small Luxury Hotel" membership should have allowed me to keep the room to 4pm but this was "not possible". In fact none of the SLH benefits I should have enjoyed was offered. I wasn't too worried as I had specifically chosen the hotel for its rooftop infinity pool. I told the staff I'd go there on the final evening before showering and changing to my travelling clothes. BUT at 2 pm on the day of departure I learned that the rooftop - the ONLY outside space for guests - would be closed for a private party given by GeRe company. I was very upset but the reception staff really couldn't have cared less. No apology. Nothing. Not even a soft drink offered. So, in net, I cannot recommends the hotel. If the management is so greedy that it puts the income from a small drinks party ahead of the comfort of its guests, then I dread to think what they would do if there were some real crisis. If you have high standards, then do not stay here. This is an expensive hotel. There are plenty of other choices in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Sami O
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights, and enjoyed it very much. Hotel was really nice and staff was very friendly and helpful. Rooms were really nice, and the infinity pool was great experience with excellent view to the city.

Reviews.Title: “Great for couple visiting S'pore with no kids...”
Reviews.Author: jediplay
Reviews.Content: Naumi hotel is a small compared to most hotels in Singapore and you can even see the hotel when you walk nearby street. However, this hotel is new, clean, decent price, great features. It is small hotel and more suitable for couples with no children on romantic getaway. Room – I was upgraded to a next best class available and it was great on first impression. The overall impression does not change much as you stay longer and find some things may need touchup, fix, or clean. Regardless, I’ve paid and had a lot worse than Naumi so it does meet my expectation. Rooms are decent sized and comfortable. It has nice working desk along with great coffee machine that takes fresh capsule if you like coffee. The bedroom and living room is somewhat separated but no door available. Instead, there is sort of entertainment center with LCD TV that can be rotated if you want to watch TV from bed. Bathroom – It has nice tub and also separate shower booth. Water flow is good and towels are good quality. The bathroom toiletries are good quality as well so if you do not pack your own, you can survive during your stay without having to visit Watsons. Internet – It is wireless and it is about average for Singapore meaning it is acceptable but not fast. It is more than adequate for internet surfing or e-mail use. Don’t expect to download your favorite soap and watch when you get tired of walking around nearby shopping more. Food – Since it is small hotel, you can’t expect to have a great restaurant. It serves breakfast and I’ve tried it once and it is okay but there are much better ones outside. Some rooms have included breakfast with the room and some does not so it really is up to you. Location/Concierge/parking – Location wise, it is very close to Raffles Hotel so you can get an idea where this hotel is. Hotel has concierge but since the hotel lobby is so small, it is difficult to call them that. Also, the parking is very difficult for this hotel since space is very limited. If you have friends driving a car and need to pick you up at the hotel, I would just walk outside of the hotel to nearby Main Street and meet them. Technically, there is no driveway like most hotels so during the weekend; it gets packed with pedestrians and cars with no space to wait for you. Pool- There is a nice poor on the top of the building and it is highlight of this hotel. Occasionally, there is a pool party reserved for entire evening so if you are into pool and must visit every day and night, make sure ask for availability. Overall, I would visit Naumi again. Staff is very friendly and try their best to make you feel like welcomed. It could be a great hotel if it was built as a separate building with some space available. However, still is a good hotel nonetheless.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend - it's the little things”
Reviews.Author: Craig A
Reviews.Content: A fanatastic hotel in a great loaction. Very modern rooms that are very well equipped and make you feel like you are at home. It's the little things like the Nespresso machine, the complimentary minibar that has several soft drinks and water that are replaced every day. Not that I drank the softdrink, it is the fact that it is there if you want it. Other little things like, well equipped bathroom with toothbrushes and toothpaste just incase you forgot yours, the complimentary interntet & the free printing if you need it. Breakfast was included in the rate and good range of chaices. They even offered to make me a breakfast pack because I was leaving before breakfast started on the last day. The service was very friendly but not over bearing. I'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Good but can better”
Reviews.Author: Saagarika_Banerjee
Reviews.Content: The Naumi hotel is a great place to stay in Spore. Location is great, being right behind the Rafffles hotel and a short walk to the City Hall MRT. Being on Seah street, there are eateries all around which is really convenient. Service is pretty good though not of the same standard depending on who your aide will be. The overall design is really nice and unlike most boutique hotels manage to be both nice aesthetically and yet practical. What is great about the rooms is that it makes you feel like home rather than yet another standard hotel room. The colors, the lay out, everything is done to give a warm feeling to the room while being cool and up to the latest trends. Overall this is certainly one of the best places to stay in Spore. Great location, great rooms, good service and reasonable rates. We ll certainly stay there again during our next stay in Spore and just hope that it will not be fully booked due to its increasing popularity.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: rajkumarjeyaraj
Reviews.Content: Beautiful rooms, great location, friendly and understanding staffs! Naumi provided the perfect staycation for me in Singapore for a weekend. The staffs were understanding and very friendly. The room provided was absolutely state of the art and gorgeous. Personal thanks to Stuart at the front desk for upgrading me and my partner to a suite :) I'll definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable rooms in an otherwise Dull Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ardnetij
Reviews.Content: My Stay was comfortable but utterly forgettable. The free Minibar element is advertised a lot but the selection was a tad too underwhelming; only soft drinks were provided! I had expected snacks, a few cans of beer and instead found an almost empty fridge! Wifi connectivity was annoying because I had to connect by re-entering the password every 45 minutes! Even then, the connection was slow. The lobby was particularly dull, with barely any people at all. And don't even bother with the breakfast... the choices are very standard and not worth the price. Overall, if you're looking for a comfortable, slightly large room, this is the place for you! The infinity pool was probably the highlight of my stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Inner City Boutique”
Reviews.Author: Kmara
Reviews.Content: If you are looking for a boutique hotel in Singapore, then don't look any further. This is an excellent place to stay. 5 minutes away from everything by cab!!

Reviews.Title: “great room”
Reviews.Author: gjholidayz
Reviews.Content: had a great stay at Naumi, the lovely spacious rooms, excellent service, loved the infinity pool. The location was good - close to Raffles, bus stops etc. Really enjoyed our stay and would definitely go back if we stay in Singapore again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent small design hotel”
Reviews.Author: JohanLudvigsson
Reviews.Content: I stayed in on of the corporate suites, the room is perfect. A separate lounge section with a 50 inch tv, bose sound system, large desk and lounger. Nespresso machine and complementary soft drinks. Nice designed bath and shower. The hotel itself might not look too much from the outside but has got a fabulous roof top pool area which during my stay was empty, all to myself... I would recommend this hotel anytime and am already looking forward to coming back.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish and Comfortable”
Reviews.Author: YYoo
Reviews.Content: This hotel has a beautiful pool atop the building with a glorious view in the evenings.The rooms are large and well appointed although the couch in my room was splitting. The staff are very helpful and the restaurant/bar in the foyer is stylish. It is well located and an easy comfortable stay. Te only drawback is the slamming doors of the surrounding rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury all the way”
Reviews.Author: Emma1509
Reviews.Content: This hotel was a great end to a fantastic holiday. We stayed for three nights, and barely wanted to leave the hotel it was such a great place to relax. Our room was marvelous and the staff were even better; nothing was too much trouble. The hotel is also in a fantastic location, close to everything, including the MRT.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Experience”
Reviews.Author: John A
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the Naumi for two days on our way from Australia to the UK.; this was our first time in Singapore. We chose the Naumi because it was relaively small - we prefer the intimacy and quiet of smaller places. We were not disappointed. The staff were immediately attentive and helpful, even though we arrived late and probably looking a bit the worse for wear. The room (almost two rooms) was stylish and well equipped, with the best bed either of us has ever slept in. The breakfast was extensive, offering every option you could want. The infinity pool was glorious at the end of a hot and sweaty day trekking 'round the millions of shops. The location was perfect for everything we needed. With free wi-fi and those little extras that make the difference, it was a joy to stay there. It is not cheap for UK visitors, but it is nevertheless very good value for money. John and Judy. Uk

Reviews.Title: “Rather good hotel, stylish reception, eclectic breakfast”
Reviews.Author: RobinArdern
Reviews.Content: We spent one night, 13th Jan, at this very nice hotel. The staff were extra friendly and helpful. On the eigth floor you can see the skyscrapers and feel the buzz of Singapore. It is right next to Raffles so very central and easy to find, except if your taxi driver does not know it has changed its name from Metropole. The room was spaceous and the bed good and firm. Free wifi and minibar. Roof top infinity pool, where we waited for the evening flight, free, even after checking out. The two smallish negative points were the slightly seedy shower and toilet with stained silicone and the drips from the aircon in the ceiling in the lounge.

Reviews.Title: “It's a great boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: MelbourneJeff
Reviews.Content: Stayed here ealy August to break up a flight from Europe. We selected this hotel because my wife and I prefer the smaller hotel experience and it was listed on Trip advisor as the number 1 hotel when we booked. The staff were excellent and well trained, breakfast good and the room very modern and clean. The free softdrinks and water in mini bar a great idea. It is in a top location and I would stay there again if travelling to or through Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great service, great location”
Reviews.Author: Esther H
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay in Naumi. It is set apart from a plethora of Hotel options in Singapore as a smaller, boutique hotel with very personal service and it was without doubt the most comfortable bed we have ever slept in!! We would definitely recommend the hotel as it offers great value for money and a chic elegance.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!”
Reviews.Author: Canuck1980
Reviews.Content: This is our second time staying at Naumi and we will definitely be back next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great and not??”
Reviews.Author: Ari H
Reviews.Content: We were really disapointed at first when we arrived to hotel. Some furnitures has worned out even a little mould in shower corner, broken sheets and the pool wasnt so fabulous like it was in pictures. Of course that is common that pictures are taken when hotel was new ..and we understand it. BUT...we didnt care any small problems after the beginning because the staff was so kind in hotel that we feel happy there. We had really spacious room!! Nice breakfast and free internet The hotel would be great after a just small repairing. I would love to give 5 "excellent" points but ..Naumi...i cannot now..sorry. But i warmly recommend it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: SandyCaroline
Reviews.Content: Rooms are very comfortable, bordering on opulent. Loved the Nespresso and the free minibar but could someone please explain about fresh milk for tea and coffee? Front desk staff were both intelligent and helpful and managed an unusual request to find a prescritpion medication excellently. A lot of money has gone into fitting out this hotel which mostly works but lacks some attention to finishes, especially in public areas, which is perhaps surprising for the price. Nowhere comfortable to sit in the lobby. Breakfast OK if somewhat disorganised. I left without a feeling of knowing what this hotel is really about.

Reviews.Title: “My second stay at Naumi Hotel. A 2nd total satisfaction.”
Reviews.Author: duende222
Reviews.Content: Impecable service. No better location and perfect rooms. Nothing else to say, Naumi Hotel is the perfect place to stay while in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding superior services, staff and facilities”
Reviews.Author: brewsl
Reviews.Content: The rooms are extremely spacious and comfortable. All of the staff, specifically Jasmine and Shuga were superb, very friendly, professional and helpful. The bar staff, specifically Shuga makes outstanding drinks. He did a great job with the Singapore Sling. Better than the Raffles. The bed is the most comfortable bed I have ever sleep in, I literally got lost in the bed, did not want to get out of the bed. The breakfast buffet is superior with many choices and eggs make to order. The location was perfect allowing quick access to all major venues. The separate bedrooms and living room area made the stay extremely comfortable, more like a home than a hotel. By far my stay at the Naumi was one of my my best hotel experience. I highly recommended it for travelers than don't want the big hotel chain feel and want to experience something more personal and unique. Thanks to the staff and Naumi for a wonderful experience in Singapore

Reviews.Title: “Great location and very exclusive”
Reviews.Author: Alfaman2001
Reviews.Content: My wife and I visited the hotel recently. We were hugely impressed with the standard of the rroms, both in terms of size but also quality of fit out and accommodations. You are very well provided for gadgets, with two large tvs and a bose music system. The bedroom is separated from the living area by a very cool electric blind. The roof pool is small but very pleasant with very nice views of the city.The water is cold though so be ready! The only small gripe is that in the room we stayed, there was a fair bit of noise from plumbing down pipes. disappointing in this standard of hotel. Overall though, a great hotel in a great location (adjacent to Raffles) If you can get it I would recommend you give it a try

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: 8pairs
Reviews.Content: Although we had to wait a little while at check-in, we were well looked after. We were amazed at the size of our room and thought it was magnificent. The bed was the biggest and most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. The sheets were so luxurious - I bought something similar as soon as I got back home. Being jet-lagged, my son joined us in bed and the three of us fitted comfortably. The two bathrooms were amazing and the shower was the best I've ever had. We had a very special moment at Naumi. At breakfast, my 8 year old son was interested in the waffles being cooked to order. So, he went over and placed his order and stayed talking to the person cooking them. We had no idea that the waffle cooker, was the hotel manager Peter Wong! As soon as our son finished his waffles, we went up to our room to squeeze in a quick swim before checking out. We had just got back to our room, when there was a knock at the door and there was Peter and several of his staff with a cake and candles! Our son had told him it was almost his birthday, so they very thoughtfully brought him a birthday cake. We were very touched by this gesture and it was a highlight of our stay in Singapore. It is something my son will never forget. Things like that make a stay memorable and personal and Peter certainly knows how to do it well! We were able to leave our cases after check out, as we had a much later flight back to Australia. They organised a taxi to the airport and could not have been more helpful - even offering a shower room to freshen up in after our day traipsing round Singapore. We wanted a smaller hotel, not high rise, and we got that and more. Yes, the pool is small but it is wonderful and the view is great. The location is great - across the road from Raffles and there are many shops and restaurants nearby. This was to be the icing on the cake after a 6 week trip around Europe and the UK and it was everything we had hoped for and more. Thanks to Peter and his staff for a wonderful stay.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel Singapore”
Reviews.Author: crispinjustin
Reviews.Content: Boutique Hotel Singapore met the unmatched quality of services offered by Naumihotel. Their rooms and suites are designed by many awards winning designers. We found them presenting with the selection of 40 elegant furnished rooms with the contemporary approach.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning just what you would expect a boutique hotel to be”
Reviews.Author: 2few
Reviews.Content: Efficient clean amazing beds amazing breakfast with bucks fizz if required the only small drawback was the slightly noisy air conditioning in our room Would definitely go back

Reviews.Title: “It's all about the service!”
Reviews.Author: Ruchenko
Reviews.Content: Stayed 2 nights during the Xmas lead-up at the Naumi after reading other glowing TA reviews. We arrived at 9am after flying all night and were shown straight to our rooms (even though check-in time is listed as 2pm) for no extra charge. The staff were unfailingly pleasant and eager to help with restaurant recommendations, dinner bookings and complimentary champagne when they noticed we were on our honeymoon. Our deluxe room was very well-appointed (huge tv, hair straightener, complimentary mini-bar), but we did notice a bit of noise from the corridor and adjoining rooms; we were on level 6. The location is excellent; you are literally across the road from Raffles Hotel and a few minutes walk from the MRT, shopping centres and a variety of dining spots. Being a smaller hotel, some of the taxi drivers aren't sure of exactly where it is; it used to be named the Metropol which most ppl seemed to know. Room service was also reasonably good value and prompt. Overall, we were very impressed by this boutique hotel and will definitely be staying there the next time we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Butique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kaganc
Reviews.Content: Location, location, location:) Every detail is very well thought- like bose sound system, samsung tv etc. Bathroom is another perfect point to mention- large and style. Room doors should be more sound isolated. And as a honeymoon couple we thought more treats is a must.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: Ariane1986
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel.Location is perfect:close to the train station,walking distance to Orchard road.Small hotel ,staff helpful and smiling. If you want a view, forget it, except from the top floor where the pool is located you won't have one.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: Steve_Brussels
Reviews.Content: Hard to fault. Beautiful room, super terrace, very trendy. Staff very helpful and professional. More than professional. Loved the breakfast room.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service and great location”
Reviews.Author: jessica_general
Reviews.Content: Decor is wonderful! Clean and beutiful views! Would love to stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Mixed Feelings; not a five but four stay experience”
Reviews.Author: DelonixR
Reviews.Content: Mixed feelings of our three night stay at Naumi Hotel. We plunked down for a Corporate Suite at about SGD430 including taxes and such per night. Here’s the quick run-down of what we felt worked, and what didn’t work for us. Starting off with the former: Very friendly staff. No doubts there. Everywhere, we were greeted warmly. Staff was very responsive too, from the point in which we made the reservation, all the way till check-out. Very spacious room. So big it almost felt a little empty! The most comfortable hotel bed we've slept in - ever. Very small hotel of just 40 rooms. No screaming kids, no local families pushing and shoving at the buffet spread, no long check-in’s like a new condo-launch queue. We took our time at breakfast, enjoying its wonderful spread and the wait staff’s amazing hospitality. Someone pointed out too that the the check-in staff was the same person who’d help you with the luggage and the same person who waited your table at the restaurant. We liked it – true multitaskers. We recognized many staff by face (though did not learn their names) by the end of our stay. Infinity pool all to ourselves! On the other hand: Furniture and setting really looks worn. This was noted in many reviews, but I didn’t expect it to be this bad. The furniture really looked tired, and truth be told, our Corporate Suite’s setting looked drab and almost depressing with those shades of brown. More ambient lighting and wall fixtures would had really spruced the place up. Problematic soundproofing. This was also noted in many reviews, and it’s bad. We can hear persons along the corridor, and on several other occasions, sounds of doors slamming, what sounded like furniture moving about, water rushing down pipes etc. No view. Maybe it was that our Suite was the third floor. But right outside our room was one of those 1940s back alley where we can spot shirtless uncles going about their business of the day. We took one look on the first day and saw enough. The curtains remained closed for the rest of our stay. Missing a few amenities, e.g. no welcome fruit basket (the wife expected it), no newspaper delivery to the room, no baby toiletries (our previous stay at Capella Sentosa had a full suite of these and even a baby bathrobe laid out for our baby girl). Complimentary mini-bar had gassy drinks; a couple of juices would had been great. Housekeeping was inconsistent. This was the wife's biggest gripe. Firstly, we’d expected an extra towel to be in the room as we’d indicated that we had a third guest in the room (our baby girl), but this wasn’t there when we checked in, so we had to call housekeeping for one. On the third day, we returned to discover that housekeeping had removed her used towel without replacing it. Handtowels were also not replaced on the third day. Used cups weren’t cleaned properly. The bed cover was removed and haphazardly thrown into the wardrobe. Right behind the long sofa in the about 20cm gap between its back and the curtains was a lost sofa cushion (all dusty now), and the gap area was terrifically dusty. And one final incident really struck in our mind. On the third afternoon, a staff member rang our door bell twice fairly briskly, waking up our girl from her afternoon nap. Before we could get to the door, the staff had already opened it. Emergency? You could call it that; the staff asked if she could come in to spray the room with insecticide! Oh my. If you were at a hotel where a staff member had to come in to spray insecticide, something is seriously amiss. We declined the offer, only because we were still in the room. In all; if it wasn’t for the friendly staff and that we had a generally laid-back stay, Naumi Hotel would have rated a three star experience. Some of the problems are going to be hard to rectify (e.g. depressing back alley view, sound proofing) but hotel management might want to consider others, e.g. refreshing furniture, housekeeping. We really did expect better for this room rate, but this was really not anywhere near a luxurious five star experience. We both agree that this was a four-stay at best.

Reviews.Title: “Excellente surprise au coeur de Singapour”
Reviews.Author: flavio t
Reviews.Content: super emplacement au milieu de 3 stations de métros (city hall - buggis et marina) ! Petit hôtel personnalisé et au petits soins pour toute notre belle petite famille ( 2 enfants de 30 et 11 mois + papa / maman et belle-maman) ! Accueillante suite pour tout le monde avec petite cuisine bien équipée très pratique pour toute la tribu ! Piscine avec vue inégalée et privative sur le coeur de Singapour ! Connaissant Singapour depuis plus de 20 ans et y ayant séjournés à maintes reprises - nous pouvons recommandé tranquillement cette adresse ! rapport qualité / prix très correct ! Personnel débrouille et toujours à l'écoute !

Reviews.Title: “Value for money and excellent service”
Reviews.Author: LBBL_Linda
Reviews.Content: My colleague recommended this hotel to stay and this is my first time to stay. I was put in the lady floor with Molton Brown amenities. They also offer free soda drinks and you can have free champagne at breakfast time. The view from the pool is also awesome. It is also centrally located. It is a superb hotel, excellent service, good location, good facilities.

Reviews.Title: “nice staff but aged "hardware"”
Reviews.Author: cmh1979
Reviews.Content: good things first: -the hotel staff members are super helpful and friendly -rooms are very big for singapore standards -very "private" overall hotel experience (only 40 rooms) -cute little pool on the rooftop - which i had all for myself due to low season - awesome things who made that stay average: -hotel needs a renovation ASAP (design AND hardware in general looked VERY (!) aged) -not well maintenanced -not 5* standard at all -no complimentary late check out after noon possible (even hotel didnt seem fully booked) -weird strong smell in the bathroom (leeking sewer pipe??) couldnt get fixed after complaint after all an ok stay, but without the very nice staff it wouldnt have been worth the money. (SGD 447.-/night incl tax)

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced for what I got.”
Reviews.Author: dabawing
Reviews.Content: Last hotel for my recent Singapore trip was Naumi Hotel which I had quite high expectation with its rank at 5th of Singapore hotels in TripAdvisor. Location was very good, just 5 min from City Hall MRT station and right behind Raffles Hotel. We arrived at the hotel around noon time.
