We were fine that the room was not ready so we went out for a walk. Later we returned to hotel and was about to check in. Guess the front desk agent would like to show up to the room while no other colleague was there, we waited for a while sitting at the counter. While waiting, the agent asked us to choose the DVD on iPad which was quite a good idea. However, the movie titles were not interesting to us so we did not choose any. Again, we were pleased to have been upgraded to deluxe room (around 55 sqm). Room was quite spacious and nicely done, though it's more "hotel-like" and lacks the surprising elements from New Majestic Hotel. When showing the room, the agent told me that we could not control the air conditioning directly. If we needed to adjust the temperature, we had to call the front desk. This was a bit awkward to me. For the rest, it looked quite fine to me. I was happy to have the cookies and a note from manager on the coffee table as a gesture to welcome us. Later we returned to the hotel, I could not find any slippers in the room thinking maybe they were just hidden. Surprisingly, when I called the front desk, they told me that they were running out of slippers in the hotel...I was paying SGD340++ but not even got a pair of slippers. While looking around the room, I found two personal city guides on the coffee table. The content was quite comprehensive, but I found some of the content were crossed out by ballpen and replaced by handwritten notes. I did understand the hotel might try to save some papers and hence the environment. This handwritten modification just did not look very presentable consider they claimed to be a luxury hotel. What bothered me during the stay was the login of WIFI. Whenever I needed to reconnect to the internet, I had to first open the browser with the login page and key in the passwords. This was not necessary in Wangz Hotel nor New Majestic. It should be necessary only for the first time login. The next morning, I was planning to have a coffee with a local friend. However, the service was not attentive, no waiter/waitress approached us even after sitting down for almost 10 minutes. I could hardly justify the personal luxury the hotel was claiming to provide. Breakfast was among the best compared with the other two hotels, with room for improvement to service. Nevertheless, the rooftop pool did add a credit to this hotel. Though we had tried the infinity pool of Marina Bay Sands last Dec, this pool was also recommended to have a quick swim with the sunny weather we enjoyed. We later checked out and kept the luggage in the hotel. Upon returning, we walked into the hotel and sit down, however, no one acknowledged our presence, didn't expect to have someone to offer any assistance. So we left the hotel without a warm feeling. Overall, I would say this hotel was a bit disappointing in terms of service and overpriced for its offering. If someone would like to stay, location and pool would be two of the very few reasons given other alternatives like Mandarin Oriental and St Regis with little premium in price only.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Stephanie S
Reviews.Content: From the decor to the service - couldn't have asked for more. We loved the 'boutique' style, the room was well appointed and serviced, and the breakfast had everything available from champagne to pancakes. We checked out and headed to the airport and left our camera equipment in the taxi. The hotel staff tracked it down for us and held it until we came back a week later. Impeccable service. We will be definitely staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel and service.”
Reviews.Author: filifilo
Reviews.Content: Naomi hotel is located in the centre, near to any city attractions. Very spacious room, provide with Nespresso machine and mini bar for free. I got free upgrade to suite composed of living room with 40" Tv and bedroom with an other 40"Tv. Very clean. High accuracy to perfection. Fantastic swimming pool on top floor. Nice and kind staff as usual in Far East countries.

Reviews.Title: “What a unique, special, wonderful find in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Aron M
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel this is! I've spent a bit of time working in Singapore, so I know that most hotels here are impersonal, big chain hotels, or are inordinately expensive luxury hotels. I wanted to find a smaller, more intimate boutique hotel for my husband's first visit to Singapore, since we tend to like such hotels for our holidays together. I had high expectations for the Naumi hotel, based on a lot of internet research (including TripAdvisor) and recommendations from friends and colleagues. I must say, those expectations were exceeded. The staff is incredibly friendly, attentive, and helpful in ways that would be impossible at the larger hotels. The rooms are wonderful, modern, in very good shape, and very tastefully decorated. And the location is fairly good. (I agree with a past poster's comment that most taxi drivers didn't know the hotel by name, and some had trouble finding the address, but you can always tell taxi drivers to drop you off at the Raffles Hotel and then guide them to the hotel at the last minute or just cross the street yourself if it's not raining too hard!) Singapore doesn't have many boutique hotels, but the Naumi is certainly among the best we've stayed in, anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Staff”
Reviews.Author: Hayley X
Reviews.Content: Wow what a great hotel, my husband and I stayed for 3 nights in early November 2011 and loved it. The hotel was in prime position next to raffles (although our taxi driver didn’t know where it was) and close to the MRT station. The rooftop pool is great after a long day shopping. Hotel staff were so friendly and helpful, very professional. Breaky was good however if it’s not included you would find better value elsewhere. Would definitely stay here again and would highly recommend this hotel!!

Reviews.Title: “Splendid stay in Singapore at Naumi”
Reviews.Author: DDgolfs
Reviews.Content: My 5 friends and I ("The Six Singapore Slingers!") stayed at the Naumi for 4 nights en route to Bliss in Bali. The Naumi Hotel truly exceeded our expectations. Staff was friendly and rooms were awesome. The beds were so comfortable we all wanted to buy the pillows! The breakfast buffet was lovely and fresh. Our cappuccinos were a perfect way to start each day. I would highly recommend this boutique hotel. We were lucky enough to secure a room on the "Ladies Only Floor" and were please to find both a hairdryer and hair straightening iron in our room. Thank you for a wonderful stay. Hope to be back with my husband one day soon. Cheers.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: blaine X
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights. Our room had a sitting area with huge flat screen and kitchenette,the bathroom had a bath and separate rain shower.The overall ambience was fab. A visit to the roof terrace is a must; where you will find a fantastic infinity pool with a backdrop of the Singapore skyline and a great gym! The breakfast was fresh and well presented. Staff were great and helped us easily discover and find things all around Singapore. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel with Excellent Service”
Reviews.Author: Dhari Q
Reviews.Content: In Fact I used to stay in Naumi Hotel since 2008 and I found it is the best hotel I ever stayed in Singapore in terms of cleanness, furniture and service. The staff was always smiling and so friendly

Reviews.Title: “An excellent small but perfectly formed hotel.”
Reviews.Author: Bill P
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Naumi for 4 nights and could not have picked a better hotel, the location was good, close to City Hall MRT, and right next door to Raffles Hotel. Clarke Quay, Boat Quay and Marina Bay are all a short walk away. The staff in the hotel couldn't have been more helpful no problem too small, breakfast was good and the room clean and spacious. We would have no hesitation in recommending the Naumi to friends and relatives.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect solution for novices to Singapore”
Reviews.Author: waltzingmatilda13
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 days at Naumi. It really is a charming hotel. The staff are superb, room and service excellent. It is well situated to get about Singapore easily, and I certainly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in a great location”
Reviews.Author: MrsP187056
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Naumi Hotel for 3 nights on the way back from Sydney as the last part of our honeymoon. We opted for a deluxe room for the extra space, free wifi and mini-bar. We were not disappointed, the room was bigger than I had expected, with a desk area, sofa, TV which could be turned around to be watched from the sofa or bed, king size bed and wonderful bathroom including bathrobes and molton brown. Please note the minibar consisted of non alcoholic drinks but was very useful given the heat in Singapore. Location was excellent just behind Raffles hotel. Eternity swimming pool was very nice too, small but plenty big enough do some laps and had a great view out over the flyer and marina bay. Breakfast selection was smaller than some large to mid range hotels, but there was plenty to chose from and the freshly cooked eggs were very good. The hotel staff were very helpful. We checked in very late at night and reception were prompt and efficient. Reception were helpful on advising how to get places and organising taxi's (which are surprising cheap given how expensive everything else in Singapore is) and even after we had checked out, let us use the shower up by the swimming pool to freshen up before our late night long flight home. Would definitely recommend this hotel to others.

Reviews.Title: “Superior accommodation and service”
Reviews.Author: Lawrence H
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent 6 wonderful nights at Naumi. The hotel is located within an easy stroll of city shopping, restaurants and bars. Our deluxe room was comfortable, spacious and very well appointed. The service provided by staff was exceptional. Our decision to stay at Naumi was based on positive feedback of other travellers and we were not disappointed. We believe that Naumi was the right choice for us as we appreciate personalised service and do not wish to compete for the attention of staff which seems to be the norm at the majority of the larger hotels. My wife and I have already decided to stay at Naumi when we next visit Singapore. We highly recommend this hotel to other travellers seeking superior accommodation and service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff & Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Shauna S
Reviews.Content: We had 5 nights at the Naumi and it was a great experience. What a great find. Small Boutique hotel but big on service and friendliness. The staff go out of their way to make you feel special and the location is also great. Good healthy breakfast selection and very well sized rooms and great bed. Full size fridge and Nespresso machine - Love that!! Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “the right choice”
Reviews.Author: Fritz4711
Reviews.Content: We stayed 3 nights and enjoyed very much the comfort and the excellent service.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: danilo28
Reviews.Content: What a pleasant surprise this was! Speaking about a perfect hotel experience: this was it! Extremely helpful and competent reception; Friendly personnel in all functions; the food we had in the bar was very good even though it might have been catered. We liked the happy hour in the bar. The rooms are very modern, comfortable and luxurious. The rooftop pool on the 10th floor is awesome with a fantastic view! I am a rather critical business traveller who stays in top luxury hotels. But I have to admit that I cannot think of any negative critics! Congratulation to the team. We had a wonderful stay at your place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Comfortable Stay”
Reviews.Author: Rockruby
Reviews.Content: We stayed 5 nights at the Naumi and found it a comfortable, stylish hotel in a great location. The room was large and well appointed. The location with proxomity to Raffles, malls, transport, restaurants and shops was excellent. Only minor let downs were at check in, where we arrived from another hotel at 1:30pm and weren't checked in until 2:30pm, depsite advertised check in of 2:00pm, and the breakfasts which were okay, but nothing special (in particular eggs were always undercooked). View from the rooftop pool was amazing, especially at night. It would be good if the pool was open later than 6pm so you could enjoy the nighttime view from the pool. I would recommenc the Naumi and consider staying there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: 69HummingbirdKent
Reviews.Content: After a week on the deserted island of Pulau Tioman, the Naumi hotel is just what we needed, and deserved!!! The warm and friendly reception on arrival was excellent. The staff were helpful and very informative. Our 2 bedroom apartment was spotlessly clean, well equipped and tastefully decorated. The view from the roof top bar is amazing and the children absolutely loved the infinity pool. Breakfast was superb! A very wide choice and all fresh, no need for lunch! Only you are in Singapore and must! We left very early on our last day and the staff were extremely helpful, even opened the breakfast facilities early for us. Would recommend to anyone!! And hope to go back - someday!!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend, lovely staff”
Reviews.Author: Louise4473
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for a quick stopover en route to Australia was very pleased we did, everything we had previously requested (check in ASAP,sofa being made up for child etc) had been done and the staff were lovely and very accommodating. We stayed in the executive suite and it was lovely, as was the pool area and location. Staying here again on our return journey and looking forward to it!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great location, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Bryan_889
Reviews.Content: We had a suite, massive king size bed, great service and breakfast buffet good too. See you back there soon! Thanks

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: philljan
Reviews.Content: Just completed a 5 night stay in deluxe room with breakfast. Could not fault the hotel. Room like a two room studio apartment with stylish marble bathroom with rain shower. Trendy up to date decor. Great having a Nespresso machine and free can drinks and water. Infinity pool had a great view. Breakfast quite adequate. Staff were superb. My only suggestion- a guest laundry room would be a plus. But I highly recommend this place. It was really a hidden gem!

Reviews.Title: “Naumi hotel, Singapore”
Reviews.Author: David T
Reviews.Content: Very expensive for what we got ($341.00 Australian dollars for one night). Have stayed in accomodation with similar quality or better for a lot less cost. Small size of hotel appealed. Staff very friendly. Location quite central to eating places and transport. Decor trendy and hip but not tasteful or comfortable both in our room and in reception area. Bed was comfortable and shower good but lights tricky to adjust (could not turn off back lighting of bedhead) and orange lighting not appealing. Room very poorly soundproofed - lift noise, people talking in corridor, doors opening and closing and people walking around in the room above us were clearly audible and made for an interrupted night's sleep. TV unnecessarily large and big orange chair uncomfortable to sit in.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing, luxurious stay!”
Reviews.Author: Angeline Y
Reviews.Content: This is basically my favorite hotel, I had a one night stay with my boyfriend for his birthday celebration. Room looked almost identical from the one viewed via website. Staff were very welcoming and friendly. When we first checked in, we had to wait for about 10mins before someone came to attend to us, probably because the lobby was filled with a group of people waiting to check in. Again, after checking in, we had to wait for close to 30mins for the room to be ready which was close to 3pm. Was feeling a little upset with the wait, however when I'm being showed to the room I was really satisfied. At first, the lobby looks a little shabby and dark which made me thought that I may have been scammed via the website. My room was a Deluxe room but was amazing spacious with more than enough space for just the two of us. The room was welcoming and so was the staff that showed us around our room. Love it! The bed was so comfy and I almost wanted to extend my stay there. The bathroom was huge and love the bath tube which was clean. We had an amazing night and will definitely be back again! We didn't manage to jump into the pool, as it was pretty small but still a beauty.

Reviews.Title: “Perhaps our expectations were a little over inflated by everyone else's reviews..that said it was very good”
Reviews.Author: SusieV33
Reviews.Content: More detailed feedback as follows: Pool-stunning views-especially at night. A tad smaller than photos would suggest - but I do appreciate that the same goes for most photos of swimming pools! Lovely recliners. Service-excellent-extremely willing at all times Breakfast-OK. When we arrived 15 minutes before close-see later as was extremely sleep deprived - fruit platter was down to 3 grapes and 2 strawberries, no offers to replenish. Was also told at 1025 that breakfast buffet was due to close at 1030-no offer to accommodate us any later. Room-I traveled with my twin boys aged 13-had a room with a sumptuous double bed that slept one boy and I-bed I have to say was one of the most comfy ever; other boy had a cute single room. Lovely décor-no complaints. Main gripe-which is a appreciably symptomatic of Naomi’s success as they were full, was access to our room. We arrived at the hotel from a European flight at 0615 and was only given a room at 1300 hrs (I had stated months ago that I was arriving early); and had to vacate same room at 1300 hrs the following day for a flight at 2100 hrs. Consequently felt like a bit of a vagrant in the hotel lobby and pool area during the times we were not in our room. Interestingly another traveler commented when she saw us at the pool area-looking suitably “vagrantish“-that she had had the same problem on arrival from France (she was staying at the hotel for 29 days on business and that because of this lack of early room availability, she wouldn’t be back). Maybe the hotel should have one room it has available for people like us, where we can change and shower (we were offered a shower at the pool, but there was no hair drier so this wasn’t ideal, and certainly wouldn’t be ideal if one was on business). All in all, I probably would go back if the early check in/late check out situation was to be improved

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in the middle of chaos”
Reviews.Author: Pat N
Reviews.Content: This was the best hotel so far on our 63 day Asian tour! Fantastic rooms, service, and staff. It's the little things, like stocking the in-room refrigerator with the kind of soda we like - and NOT charging us for every can we drank. Compared to the price of the room, it is a little thing, but indicative of the service. No one in Asia seems to understand that we'd like the eggs and toast/waffles hot at the same time, including this one with great service! The mattress was THE most comfortable I've slept on since my own bed a month ago! I might have to buy one.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful stay...two thumbs up!”
Reviews.Author: PennyDitchfield
Reviews.Content: We had a 3 night stopover in Singapore after a 3 week trip away in South Africa. Staying at Naumi put the icing on the cake for us! Our deluxe room was spacious and comfortable and the service was impeccable! To be able to "pop upstairs" to level 10 and enjoy the view from the pool area was fantastic. We were so glad we chose Naumi over one of the larger hotels and enjoyed that personal service that a boutique hotel can offer. It was close enough to walk to Orchard Road and even pop across the road to Raffles for (an expensive!) Singapore Sling! The only downside was that our room lacked a view but we would certainly stay at Naumi again and recommend it to others. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Nice and friendly staff. Rooms could be better.”
Reviews.Author: hellowworld
Reviews.Content: Was highly recommended by a friend and read good reviews but disappointed by overall stay at hotel. The room was noisy. A/C was loud and making buzzing sounds all night. Could hear telephone ring next door as well as neighbor talking on the phone. Piping wad bad and made a lot of noise. Room was smaller than what was shown in pictures and had been very used. Staff was kind and welcoming. Although lobby entrance could be more luggage friendly and could use a bellboy. They could probably do more to keep this quaint hotel in better shape and it would be a pleasant stay.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel at the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Shangers308272
Reviews.Content: Very good hotel, excellent location. Couple of steps to Raffles long bar and original Singapore Slings! The pool on top floor is really nice.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, great service and the top roof pool !!”
Reviews.Author: ying l
Reviews.Content: I feel very happy when I stay in this boutique hotel, and value all SLH recommendation

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay whilst in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Astrid909
Reviews.Content: This place was a real gem to find! Nothing bad to say about our stay here, would recommend it to anyone wishing to stay somewhere close to all the action! Staff were very pleasant and welcoming, great bed and amenities to use. Will choose Naumi next time we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A stylish boutique hotel in the hear of Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Intlnabers
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Naumi Boutique Hotel for a mixed business/personal 4 day trip. I would say right off the bat that this is a more of a personal use hotel, not as business friendly as some larger chains, etc. but that being said, we thoroughly enjoyed our stay here! The hotel is chic, modern, and the rooms spacious. We did get a corner room on a mid-level floor, but it was the handicapped room so although we loved our room, we can't really speak for how it compared to the non-handicap rooms, but I am sure those were great too. The roof-top pool was unbelievable!! It was not manned by staff 24/7 but all you had to do was call downstairs for a drink/food order. As far as the staff, they were very friendly. We did eat lunch one day in the lobby restaurant and it took forever to get the food (and we were the only people in there) but otherwise, no complaints on the quality of the meal. There was a workout room, but it was tiny and hot. Overall, great boutique hotel worthy of a second stay!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Cowrakid
Reviews.Content: Tucked in just next door to Raffles, giving you access to nearly everything Singapore has to offer, Naumi is a rare find. Absolutely beautiful rooms with no detail missed and with one of the nicest hotel bathrooms you'd ever hope to find.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel rooms with lovely people!!!”
Reviews.Author: Hetai
Reviews.Content: Check out their luxury suites if you are lookin for venues to hold your very private function..! I had my solemnization in there...it was superb! The room was fantastic! The food was good! The stay was memorable! The people at Naumi was very helpful & friendly! My guests all loved the room lots...!!!!! & not forgetting that they have a lovely view from the rooftop swimming top...!!!! Would defintely be back there for a stay someday...!!!

Reviews.Title: “Would stay again”
Reviews.Author: CandR8
Reviews.Content: Everything you would expect from a top class hotel. The only negative was that our room was on the top floor (9) just below the swimming pool where they hold functions which was noisy one night. Very child friendly hotel. Location is excellent, only $15 in a cab to airport.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Abdan
Reviews.Content: The first thing that you notice about this hotel is the service from the reception staff. We arrived early in the morning and were immediately greeted by smiling staff helping us with our bags and offering chairs and fresh coffee as we checked in. Our room was fantastic, very big with a huge very comfortable bed and large windows making it very light and airy. Even the flat screen TV was huge. The mini bar has complimentary soft drinks and water and there is also a pool deck at this hotel on the 10th floor with an infinity pool and a fantastic view of Singapore. Great after a tiring day of sightseeing. The breakfast was definitely the best we have experienced, there was even smoked salmon! A visit to Singapore is definitely enhanced by a stay at this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Modern Chic Boutique At It's Best”
Reviews.Author: N0rwichTraveller
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Naumi (pronounced know-me apparently) for 3 nights at the end of a trip to Australia and absolutely loved it. The internal décor is beautifully finished, rooms are well appointed and fully equipped with all the mod-cons and little touches like the lovely floral fragrance that meets you as you walk through the reception doorway makes it a truly memorable hotel experience. The roof top infinity pool, whilst not very functional with more than two people using it, offers fantastic views of the city skyline. We found the breakfast buffet to be of equally high standard with a very good selection of hot and cold items. The staff were also very friendly and helpful. The hotel is located within walking distance of the Suntec City shopping centre, the metro and the hippo open top tourist bus tour route stops very near by which we found to be a very good way of getting around the city sights. Next time I'm in Singapore I won't be staying anywhere else.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy, quiet great hotel”
Reviews.Author: sandb4
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed 3 nights at this fabulous hotel. The staff were efficient, helpful and caring from check in to check out. The breakfast is one of the healthiest and enjoyable we have ever had. Location is fabulous and you can walk to everything easily. So nice to be treated as an individual not a number. Thanks Naumi we would recommend you to everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, Hip, and Cool - Just like Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: SweetKell
Reviews.Content: Singapore was the last stop of my Asia tour this summer, and Naumi was the perfect place to wrap up the trip. I arrived late in the evening, but the front desk crew were very friendly and welcomed me. We stayed in the two bed room/two bath room suite, and the room was very spacious. Rooms are very clean, well decorated, and well maintained. Being a coffee lover, to see the nespresso machine, made my day and fueled me in a right way before my adventure in Singapore. The breakfast is pretty good - tasty food and great service!! One of the best features of this property is its staff. They seem like they really enjoy working there and provide great hospitality! This great hotel is in the shadow of the Raffles Hotel.. which is very unfortunate. Not many cab drivers know this hotel, so you have to tell them that it's nearby the Raffles Hotel. Two things about the hotel, which I thought was..so..strange.. were the infinity pool and staff's outfit. Infinity pool is much much better looking in the photos posted on the website. It is a tub-size pool overlooking roofs of ugly buildings in the neighborhood. So, don't bother brining your bikini. Secondly, the friendly staff at the hotel do not wear uniform. It is really not a big deal in terms of professional look (because most of them wore suits and looked professional), but when you have to draw their attention, it becomes problematic. There are a lot of business guests in the hotel, so it is not too easy to identify the hotel staff..when they are mixed with the guests. My suggestion? At least wear name tag or something.. Overall, we've really enjoyed staying at the Naumi, and I think we will chose to stay with Naumi again on our next upcoming trip to Singapore. Can't wait to stay with Naumi again. :)

Reviews.Title: “Great place”
Reviews.Author: BWHJhb
Reviews.Content: Loved the hotel, location, great rooom, loveed the view from the roof top pool brekfast great Noisy plumbing though

Reviews.Title: “Great location and friendly staff”
Reviews.Author: Caitlin H
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for two nights as part of our honeymoon in September 2011. The view from our bedroom was fantastic - looking onto Raffles Hotel! The staff were friendly and helpful when suggesting where to visit. We loved the infinity pool. Very useful was the iron - who would've thought I would be doing ironingon my honeymoon - but it needed to be done. Also loved the Nespresso machine and complimentary soft drinks in the minibar. Also offered to us was a glass of champange to celebrate on the pool deck. Even though check out time was 11am our flight was only at 2am. The staff set up the pool showers and molton brown goodies for us to refresh at 10pm before our flight. Only down side I would have to mention was the shower. The shower rose wasn't completely functional and the plumbing was quite noisy - it was actually quite amusing! Thank you for a wonderful stay in a wonderful city!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and location!”
Reviews.Author: Taz42
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our 3 night stay at the Naumi Hotel in June, 2011. The hotel staff had upgraded our suite. It was very nicely laid out, with everything we needed for our stay. The bathroom was spacious and quite luxurious. We enjoyed the breakfast buffet ... especially the cappuccinos which were carefully crafted for us each morning. We liked the location opposite the historic Raffles Hotel, walking distance to plenty of shopping, and for us, walking distance to the Marina Bay Sands and the Art and Science Museum. It was a fairly long walk, but we strolled over and enjoyed the atmosphere and sights as we went. I would like to thank the staff for all the attention to detail while we were there. We loved our stay for our first visit to Singapore. We will definitely be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: lcyeap
Reviews.Content: Stayed based on all the positive reviews. Stayed in a deluxe room which was comfortable but starting to look a little worn around the edges (dirty marks on walls, moldy grout etc). Free mini bar is a nice touch as was the nespresso machine. Nice big comfy bed. Breakfast was reasonable with a decent range on offer. Rooftop infinity pool is great with a stunning view Hotel is in a great central location close to raffles city and Bugis St. Lots of hawker food nearby. Overall enjoyed our stay. Not quite the standard of a big 5star hotel but a unique boutique hotel

Reviews.Title: “Great experience. City chic. Would absolutely recommend.”
Reviews.Author: goodison78
Reviews.Content: Spent three nights at Naumi hotel in September 2011 on a stopover in Singapore. Location - ideal if you have a short time in the city. Pretty much all must-see sights are within walking distance, some closer than others. Perfect for the Colonial District and a pleant stroll back from Clarke/Boat Quay after dinner. Esplanade MRT stop is 150 yards away. Raffles Hotel next door is a very handy landmark for reference. Bar on the rooftop terrace 3 doors down above the toy store is well worth a visit Room - Stayed in a Deluxe double on the 8th floor. Incredibly spacious for a city centre hotel in any country. Bed the comfiest I've experienced in any hotel. Large freestanding bath and separate rain shower as well as plenty of space around the sink. View over terracotta low lying buildings towards the high rise developments to the North (I think). 50" plasma TV on a 360* swivel so that it can be views at the foot of the bed, or turned 180* and be seen from the 2-person sofa. didn't watch any TV, but would be useful. International news, plus a sports and movie channel for those interested! Pool - The signature landmark of the hotel. The view frim the rooftop terrace is incredible, overlooking the terracotta tiles of Raffles out towards the CBD skyscrapers. Was quite most of the time, with 4-5 people pre-breakfast and even fewer late afternoon. Room service can be delivered and eaten up there. Pool modest in size, but it's there to cool you off whilst enjoying the view, not to do serious laps. Food - Breakfast a mix of traditional Asian savoury and American-Euorpean pancakes/eggs. Plenty to set you up for the day. Staff - Very accommodating and helpful. Service always with a smile. Language sometimes a slight barrier, but the message is understood and they really do try hard to help whoever possible. Overall - a very enjoyable stay and would recommend wholeheartedly is you want a boutique hotel experience with the luxury quirks. Not for those that need sterile US-big brand feel. I'm delighted I trusted the Trip Adviser reviews and booked here. the alternative Goliath-sized Pan Pacific/Mand Oriental/Shangri-Ls's just wouldn't have cut it for me here.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant Service”
Reviews.Author: Mudee1
Reviews.Content: Quality hotel that maintains a high level of customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Leaking window and ants on the table”
Reviews.Author: ok_xin
Reviews.Content: When we spent 3 days 2 nights celebrating my son 3 years old in Singapore, we had chosen Naumi. They offered us with a family 2 bedrooms suite which the design is good with 2 bath rooms and separate living area. But the day we checked in the rained heavily. When we came back from lunch, the master bedroom was FLOODED! The water came from the leaking window just 2 steps away from the bed! We immediately contacted the hotel, they sent a housekeeping staff to wipe the water then guess what he did? He used 2 bathrobes, 1 put on the floor to absorb the water and the other 1 on the leaking window! This was not rectified for our 2 nights stay! When we called to ask for more drinking water, the housekeeping told us they could not give us more than 4 bottles daily! How could 4 of us survive with that 4 bottle of water some more we have to boil water for making my son's milk? And ended up we asked them to stop replenishing the complimentary mini bar stocked with soft drinks and replaced with drinking water! So shameful that Naumi is one of the world's Small Luxury Hotel! Although after complained to the General Manager via email (at that time he was overseas), he asked the duty manager to give us 1st night complimentary stay and 2nd night 50% discount, our birthday celebration mode was all gone! Basically, good design, extremely poor maintenance with good location (opposite is Raffle Hotel and DO NOT MISS the famous Sinji Restaurant!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!”
Reviews.Author: Nicholas S
Reviews.Content: Wow - this place is great. It's not a huge hotel - which is nice - and it has everything we needed for a short stop over. On check-in the staff were falling over themselves (not literally) to look after us and this was the case throughout the stay. The room was fantastic although we did have one minor incident in that our safe wasn't working. But while we were out walking the streets they replaced it quickly and even put our passports in there for us. The bed was the most comfortable on our trip and the bathroom was incredible! Our check out was at midday but our flight wasn't until nearly midnight. We stored our baggage with the hotel and when we came back they prepared the shower by the pool area for us to freshen up before our trip home. Location wise, it seemed great. Lot's of little restaurants on the same street (mmm Chicken Rice...) and Ruffles over the road which really is worth a visit for the experience. One little tip - after you have been over the road for a Sling, come back to the hotel bar and ask Suga to make you up a cocktail! He is a friendly chap and makes a great drink.

Reviews.Title: “A fine hotel, smooth surroundings and atmosphere, elegant and chic, just right.”
Reviews.Author: dais62
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 2 nights with a late check out. Room was accommodating and well laid out. Rooftop pool with style. Breakfast is just what is needed, although staff didn't seem to know what poached eggs were. Relaxing and laid back, I'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “LOVED IT”
Reviews.Author: Joanne L
Reviews.Content: I visited Naumi for my anniversary w my bf and i have to say, the room we had was well done. It was spacious, clean, trendy and there was soft music playing in the background which was very very thoughtful as it immediately releases stress n felt as though we werent in the city. Biscuits were served in the room, a nice gesture indeed. Pantry was awesome. What's more awesome was the heat slab to cook food with, towelettes provided in the cupboard, toasters, full set of cutlery, various types of cups, wine glasses, champagne glasses etc.. The TWG teas were aplenty, made me spoilt for choice. Bed, needless to say, was ABSOLUTELY comfy. Not too hard, not too soft. A curtain separates the living space n bedroom. Pool was okay, given the fact that it was kindaaaaa small, will be crowded if around 10 people were in it but the day i went there, there was zero people, akin to having my own private pool. Alas, it was too cold so i only spent like 10mins before freezing my skin off. The things they could have improved however, was that the breakfast selection was indeed quite minimal. Could do with more selections of fruits n stuff. The pool was lacking a "gradient" slope, which means either u are on land or immediately 1.3M into the pool which is VERY difficult for me to be suddenly submerged into a total different temperature. I swear my heart stopped for a minute. Other than that, I really liked the room n the way they utilized the space. OH, not to mention the HUGE tub that made me fall into slumberland whilst enjoying my TWG tea n listening to the music. Ethereal. Will be back!

Reviews.Title: “"excellent time at Naumi”
Reviews.Author: Isabelle C
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at Naumi and enjoyed every bit of it: good location, excellent rooms, excellent rooftop and pool and excellent service. The hotel is really of high quality, and at the same time, due to its size, you feel at home. I do recommend Naumi to everyone! (although, on the other hand I would like to keep it confidential.....)

Reviews.Title: “An outstanding experience from the minute we arrived”
Reviews.Author: Rachel H
Reviews.Content: Hotel Naumi was recommended to us by two of our friends who had stayed there in the last few years primarily as it has facilities which as a family we needed in a setting that was beautiful. It is in an excellent location (next to Raffles) within walking distance of most attractions and MRT stations. From the moment we arrived the staff at the Naumi could not do enough for us and really treated us like we were their only guests. We were given a room before check in time as we were travelling with children and they provided us with a fabulous executive suite with an outdoor terrace. The rooms are beautiful and every little detail is thought through. Room service and housekeeping were excellent and very quick to respond to our requests. The breakfast was lovely and a great start to our days in Singapore. All in all we could not fault the Naumi and will definitely stay again next time we visit Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Everything you want From a hotel”
Reviews.Author: rmsl
Reviews.Content: Naumi hotel is An. Excellent choice in Singapore. Its location is excellent, near every attraction you will want to visit in Singapore. City hall metro station is just two blocks from the hotel, but I think you should consider taking a taxi wherever you go, since they are inexpensive (6-8 SD) for almost any destination. But you should be aware that on certain places at specific times, just like on orchad street , taxi line can be enormous. So the cleanest metro possible is a good option. Since the hotel is new, a good reference is Seah street near raffles hotel. Take a hotel card with you. Hotel staff is amazing. Extremely professional and polite. Be aware that there is a credit card authorization charge when you arrive. Do not worry about this. Just remember when checking out to ask the staff about it, though you won't have any problem. The hotel region is safe and you cam easily walk around. Do not miss the five blocks distance Funan mall for computers, cameras and electronics . On the last floor there is an amazing electronics mega store with good prices. Coming back to Naumi, it is a beautiful boutique hotel. Hotel staff will take good care of you and are prompt to help you with anything you want. It is completely different from the huge Singaporean hotels with dozens of people trying to check in. Breakfast is good, with good and health options. Breakfast staff are also very polite. The rooms are modern, stylish, and you will get everything you want. I have stayed on the simplest room kind and I don't think I would need more than what I had. Roof swimming pool is very charming and a nice place for watching the beautiful Singapore skyline. I would definitely stay there again if I return to Singapore

Reviews.Title: “A great place for singles.”
Reviews.Author: candjss
Reviews.Content: Very nicely appointed rooms. I liked the sitting area separated from the bedroom. The spacious bathroom. The staff were most attentive and very friendly: one felt an individual and was treated as such right up the the point of getting into my car for the airport. The breakfast was very good - a wide variety of choices, even vegemite! I took a glass of wine each evening and the service was attentive and as a single I was made to feel very welcome . It was easy to organise an additional half day stay; helpful as my departure from Changi was very late. I have already recommended the hotel to friends.

Reviews.Title: “Just a step from Raffles”
Reviews.Author: Luxexplorer1
Reviews.Content: Excellent location for luxe and local- steps from the luxury of Raffles and local hawker food. Attentive and knowledgeable staff - organised several private drivers for us without hesitation, even when plans changed. Breakfast is good, adequate selection, get in early for full selection. Rooms comfortable, full selection of teas and free soft drink mini bar. Only downside was pool unclean - ? due to even the night before, so not appealing to swim in. Would go back there for a city getaway, but not so good for relaxing beside the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Was Nice But Something Felt Off”
Reviews.Author: jrosslin
Reviews.Content: Stayed her for 3 nights with my partner and both felt that something was missing with this hotel. The hotel was in a good location with an easy walk to transport but cabs found it almost impossible to find. Staff were nice but they felt insincere. Rooms are very modern, clean and a good size however for a 5 star hotel didn't expect cracks in the walls and damaged fixtures in the bathroom. I understand that the hotel is trying to be green but didn't like the whole lack of towels. Breakfast was not huge on variety but ok we were offered tea or coffee when first sitting down but if you wanted more, you would have to flag someone down. Ordering eggs or waffles was unclear, and they were never offered when first sitting. Even though we never used the pool it was stunning and the views were amazing a big plus for this hotel. It was a nice hotel but felt cold and not all that welcoming I think this hotel is better suited for business people not young couples and defiantly not for families.

Reviews.Title: “Cute hotel, very peaceful and gorgeous decor”
Reviews.Author: SineadR79
Reviews.Content: We stopped here for one night en route back to Australia and were really happy with the service- smiles & nothing could be any trouble. The hotel had a lovely interior and I just loved the roof top pool, very cute. There was no alcahol in the room but I am told that's pretty standard in Sing, I am new to this and got excited when the sign said 'free mini bar' my interpretation of this was 'great where's the wine!". The breakfast was bizarre for a UK tourist expecting sausages, bacon etc - they had a large spread of continental choices and then various curries- interesting and very nice I loved the fact that it was different. Our bedroom was spacious and very clean and the bathroom was gorgeous. The bed was massive, I think I lost my partner in the night :0) If we are stopping over again I would definatley book again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Room - very Modern, Friendly, only one minor issue”
Reviews.Author: Raynboz
Reviews.Content: Great position - right opposite the Raffles Hotel. Very modern. Huge room (suite) with a large TV as the divider between the bedroom and lounge. Fabulous bathroom with free standing bath. Staff were very friendly and helpful. Okay, the minor issue. The entrance to the Hotel. A couple of steps, and a narrow ramp. The ramp was useless. No automatic doors, so it was quite difficult getting your bags up the stairs and inside the doors. Crazy that this has not been fixed by the Hotel. Otherwise a good choice - especially with the infinity pool on the top floor. Fabulous view of the city from up there. We can recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Really like the place, very cozy”
Reviews.Author: LoveFoodAddict
Reviews.Content: We really enjoy the place. The bed is marvelous. We slept like a baby. Will come back again definitely.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel and interesting design”
Reviews.Author: Mel S
Reviews.Content: What a great find. stayed here based on the Trip Advisor reviews and was delighted. rooms a little small, but well equipped. breakfast could have been a little more interesting. but service was great.

Reviews.Title: “Modern, spacious hotel in a great part of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: NuNu1980
Reviews.Content: Naumi is a modern hotel that provided us an exclusive city stay for our stopover in Singapore. The rooms were spacious, clean and modern. The nespresso machine was great for a quick morning coffee. The hotel is next to the luxury raffles hotel and close to good shopping and restaurants. The rooftop pool is a lovely way to relax after a busy morning of shopping and has a great view across the water and skyline. This is easily the best hotel we've stayed at in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel with modern design and nice atmosphere”
Reviews.Author: HBParis
Reviews.Content: We stayed for one night at the Naumi and we had a great time, either at the swimming pool on the roof top with nice views on the city skyscrapers or at the bar with its lounge atmosphere. In-room dining was also good. Pillows and bed are great, the room is quiet and well-equiped, a kitchen with things to cook and dine (fridge, heater, boiler, nespresso machine, cutlery, plates, sink, toaster...). Free wifi, TV and radio. Nice staff and great services. Everything you need!

Reviews.Title: “Private Retreat in the center of town”
Reviews.Author: Blufugue
Reviews.Content: I visited Naumi with a friend to celebrate our joint birthdays. While we only stayed for a night, we were really happy with the general boutique vibe of the hotel. The rooms were very spacious and well equipped, with a kitchenette area complete with nespresso machine and full fledged fridge. The room has a DVD player - you can rent movies from the reception for free, though the collection isn't extensive or very updated. Bring your own shows! The bed was awesome too - one of the very best beds i have ever slept in. The rooftop infinity pool, while small, boasted a great city view. The best thing was - it was mostly empty, which meant we could have the entire area to ourselves. This was where we had the best part of our staycation - chilling by the pool late into the night. We brought up our own bottle of wine and wine glasses from our room - it was like having our own private pool party. Very nice. The hotel even gave us a free cake upon knowing that it was our birthday. So that lent a personal touch to the experience. Don't expect this to feel like a five-star chain hotel experience, the hotel only has 40 rooms and what seems like a limited number of staff - but it functioned smoothly. I had a great stay.

Reviews.Title: “Dissapointing and overpriced.”
Reviews.Author: Dag M
Reviews.Content: I booked Naumi based on Tripadvisor reviews. Ohh, was I let down. Stayed four nights, and was very underwhelmed. The lobby and entry from the street is non-existant. The breakfast buffet is very small, and the area for breakfast is the same as the bar at night. Needless to say, there is no restaurant at the hotel, nor other facilities. The only thing I found nice, was the pool at the roof. The room and bathroom was clean and of good size, and the location was also good. With so many hotels in the same price range nearby with more services, I'd never go back to Naumi. Naumi does not make the cut, stay at Raffles for a little extra, Pan Pacific, Fairmont or Mandarin Oriental for less.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: Giacomo V
Reviews.Content: We sadly just keft the Naumi, one of the most interesting venues in Singapore. I already have been to Singapore several times, but this time I switched to a small boutique hotel. This is the key point, maybe too small for that kind of city. But otherwise if you prefer a personalized service in an excellent central location this is your choice. We had a De Luxe room on the 9 th floor that was just an apartmnet, very well organized with a small kitchenette a full fridge and a Nespresso machine. Breakfast was included in our fare, is excellent. So if you don't want the big or biggest ( as The Sands ) hotel this is your choice but maybe keep in mind that there are no doormans to greet you. Also you have a small fitting center on different floors and no SPA inside.

Reviews.Title: “Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: jdr27
Reviews.Content: We booked a large, expensive suite at the Naumi based on its strong TA reviews and number one ranking in Singapore. Arrived at the hotel after an overseas flight to check in only to be escorted to our room at the non-smoking property which reeked of cigarette smoke. Not just a single cigarette mind you, but it seemed as if the previous guest smoked heavily in the room for days. We immediately pointed this out to front desk personnel, who asked us to stay in the hot, smoky room until they sorted it all out. Fifteen minutes later with no apparent progress we went down to the lobby to see what was happening and I basically drew the conclusion that the hotel was likely sold out, there wasn't another room they could give us, hence they wanted to keep us reasonably happy and comfortable until they could figure out how to get the smoke out of the room. Figuring this was likely to be later rather than sooner, and we had just arrived from overseas, we really didn't want to hang around so we departed without staying. I did inform the front desk staff, and they were very understanding. Conclusions: the hotel staff, which was extraordinarily kind, caring and apologetic should have never checked a guest into a room in that condition. Either they were fully aware of the smoke, and should've resolved before letting us into the room or they were completely unaware in which case is evidence of a poorly run hotel. Regardless, hard to believe this place is the #1 ranked property in TA for Singapore. The smoke issue aside, the hotel (apparently previously The Metropole) seemed a bit shabby, and very far from a five star property. Other than extremely nice staff, which is quite common in Singapore, I can't really say anything positive or encouraging about the Naumi and will unlikely give it another shot.

Reviews.Title: “Good........but”
Reviews.Author: emstar21
Reviews.Content: Checked in at 7am after a overnight flight with our two year old daughter had no choice but to pay the requested $176 to check in early. Bedroom and Living was clean and tidy and the bed was one of the best we have slept on. Large fridge was great, as was the microwave. Bathroom was mouldy in the hard to clean corners which really let the room down. Breakfast was not huge on variety but nice. Was offered tea or coffee when first sitting down but if you wanted more, you would have to flag someone down. Ordering eggs or waffles was unclear, and they were never offered when first sitting, you had to discover the small sigh near the toast. Excellent location within walking distance to Bugis (which we found to be the best shopping) and Raffles City. Great hawker food in the little places right next door that was so cheap.

Reviews.Title: “Service is impeccable.”
Reviews.Author: Gohszeying
Reviews.Content: There isn't a toothbrush kit in the room though you can actually request it from the hotel and they will send it up. In my opinion, such stuffs are by default.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique hotel in the midst of the highrisers..well worth it!!”
Reviews.Author: Zeeva21
Reviews.Content: We thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the slick modern Naumi hotel. It's location is fantastic right behind the Raffles Hotel. Especially we loved the room with the wonderful modern touches, comfortable big king size bed and fabulous bathroom. It's a very spacious room with lounge and kitchenette as well. The service was fantastic and as soon as we'd request something i could barely turn around and our request would arrive so quickly to our room. The roof top infinity pool is gorgeous and the views wonderful. Overall, the service was great and the staff at reception gave us some lovely tips for touring around. We even managed to get a last minute dinner booking at the restaurant on the roof of the Marina Bay Sands Hotel! Wow it was special, though not cheap at all, but we loved it. The breakfast was ok, would have been nice to have more variety but being a small hotel i suppose there is an issue of waste if buffet breakfast is too big. Thank you for a wonderful couple of nights, we will definitely come back.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous bed but don't stay for the ladies floor”
Reviews.Author: atgkc
Reviews.Content: The hotel is lovely. The bed is the most comfortable I've ever experienced. Staff were friendly and helpful. I travel alone for work and always book a ladies floor if it is available. There were no rooms available during my stay but it would not have mattered anyway. There were couples staying on that floor and this is where the weights room is located (!) so it is not in any sense a private or protected space. When I asked, staff admitted that when the hotel is busy they can't block off rooms to keep the ladies floor exclusive. So, Naumi: you are good enough already. Don't pretend to offer something you can't deliver. It spoils what is otherwise a very good image.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely and personal”
Reviews.Author: Swissphilw
Reviews.Content: Writing this review from the small but charming infinity pool on the tenth floor of the Naumi hotel I've got nothing but praise for it. The staff is very forthcoming and always up to give good advice for getting around without being intrusive. Our room - a deluxe single - was what we've hoped it would be; having an espresso after three weeks of filter coffee is nice! Thanks for the nice stay and hope to be back sometime soon.

Reviews.Title: “Geat Location & room”
Reviews.Author: Jusro
Reviews.Content: Great location with an easy walk to transport, shopping food etc. Rooms are very modern and clean, and a good size for Singapore. They also have a womans only floor if you are travelling alone. Great for the price compared to the big boys

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: Trinityh1976
Reviews.Content: The staff were great and as for the bed, it is the best I ever slept in. I really like the coffee machine as well. Thanks for the great service.

Reviews.Title: “Not what we expected”
Reviews.Author: review10
Reviews.Content: Staff were helpful and welcoming. But not a hotel we will be returning to. Very impersonal and not suited for children. When we asked for towels we were told we could only have hand towels!!! We were asked for a $900 deposit upon checking in, we were amazed. We have travelled the world and this is the first time we have paid this level of deposit. The internet was dreadful and when we complained we were told someone would look into it and it never happened. We arrived at the hotel very late and when we asked to keep the room till 2pm we were just told it is not possible. It was obvious the hotel was not full. But we were ok in the end as we had business class flights and used the lounge at the airport. Overall experience at the hotel was disappointing.

Reviews.Title: “Great find!”
Reviews.Author: Ryan3
Reviews.Content: We spent 2 nights at this lovely little hotel and really enjoyed the friendly service, comfortable rooms and fab infinity rooftop pool. Naumi is in a great location, 2 mins from Raffles - but offers twice the service for half the price!! A great option for a short stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “A true gem that sadly lets itself down on a couple of important fronts”
Reviews.Author: sydneyph
Reviews.Content: I'll say up front that I'm fussy so, readers, consider my comments in that light. The first impression of this place is 'wow'. It really does say 'boutique' from the moment you step through the front door. Cool furniture, lighting, funky music and a genuinely warm greeting from the Naumi 'aides' all contribute to the positive vibe. 'Twas off to a great start until we walked into the room (#601) which had a very strong musty, mould-like odour. For perspective: I wasn't imagining it; my partner agreed. Allergic as I am to mould, I went downstairs and asked to be moved, which, after waiting a short while for an adjacent room of the same type to be cleaned after the last guests had just left, was done with a smile. The second room (#603) was a marked improvement but there was a feint odor of mould in it also which lingered for the duration of our stay.The other disappointment is the service standards at breakfast on Saturdays and Sundays. Let me begin with breakfast on Friday was out of this world - excellent buffet, well-stocked with fresh food and what seemed like the hotel's entire management team very attentively 'working the room' actually serving guests and chatting, offering travel tips and so on. Quelle surprise on Saturday morning - it was as if we were in a different hotel. The buffet looked like a plague of locusts had stripped it bare. All but one of the four juice containers was empty. Both the buffet and the juice containers remained so untill the buffet closed. The manned eggs-to-order station of the day before had been replaced by a sign obscured among the baskets of a few slices of bread and scattered pastries. I noticed other guests were - like me - lost trying to work out whether eggs to order were available at all. Other disappointments included the elegant cloth table napkins of the day before having been replaced by two small paper cocktail napkins on both Saturday and Sunday! I just didn't get it - surely it's not about not wanting to do the laundry. Also, without their batallion of sartorially elegant collegues from the day before, the two staff who worked the room, seriously struggled to keep up. Instead of being offered coffee or tea when being seated - as had been the case the day before - you had to wave your arms repeatedly to get the attention of the staff who walked around the room with purpose - just not that purpose. Thakfully, Sunday morning was a marginal improvement but still exposed a cavernous service and image gap from the Friday. Truly great service is about consistency and not disappointing - in this respect the Naumi was a massive fail. On the plus-side, the pool is amazing and definitely not to be missed - it's a real oasis on the roof level. The staff - from Peter the hotel manager al the way down - have great service 'bones' and genuinely seem to enjoy their jobs. The location on Seah Street is perfect; chicken rice and other authentic local tastes right outside the door. So, all in all, a real gem and clearly very popular (especially with French-speakers) But would I stay there again? Probably not. Or for people like me who have a sensitive nose and don't expect this at the price.

Reviews.Title: “A very different pace to the rest of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: PeteFromAustralia
Reviews.Content: It came as a welcome surprise when Naumi not only met, but exceeded the expectations that I’d built up after reading the glowing reviews on Tripadvisor. I loved: * the style – five star facilities with the heart and soul of a B&B * the service – with stars like Mel and Daphne going beyond the call to make you feel welcome, plan your sight-seeing travels, hail a cab and de-brief after a day of shopping * the bathrooms – the perfect place to soak * the bed - everything written about this in earlier Tripadvisor posts rings true * the pool – small but magic Small things, but I was more luke-warm about: * the DVD player whose cord didn’t actually reach the TV * the cost of the chauffer-driven car – at $80 per airport trip, it’s a steep increase from the sub $20 charge for a regular taxi (though there was a charming driver) * the views – put in a request for something facing the main street (or find yourself looking out to a pretty average laneway) * a little wear to the bathrooms – there was some staining around the shower area that could do with a good bleach That said, the pros most certainly outweighed the cons – and I challenge you to find anything else in Singapore that compares.

Reviews.Title: “Service and comfort are outstanding!”
Reviews.Author: IanSh
Reviews.Content: The two highlights of the Naumi are the friendly, helpful approach of the staff, and the comfort and presentation of the rooms. From the vivacious greeting (at 4 am when we were bleary and travel-worn) by the check-in staff, to the personal attention at breakfast, to the dedication in finding a taxi FAST, to the enthusiasm of the room-servicing staff, and just the cheery greetings every time we passed through the lobby... there was not a single staff member or a single interaction that we had ANY complaint about at all, and in fact very much the opposite. I think this would go down as perhaps the "most friendly and genuinely helpful hotel staff" in the entire world, heh heh! Likewise, the room was well presented, very clean, and carefully tidied daily. The bed was of first-class comfort and all of the other facilities were just as you would want them. The buffet breakfast each morming had a great variety of offerings, and again, the personal attention of staff was impeccable. The manager kept us personally informed of any special information we should know. It is not at all surprising to me that the Naumi is currently ranked the #1 hotel in Singapore (when we made our reservation it was at #4). Sincere congratulations to all the management and staff - you have found the right formula, just keep up the great work. Hope to see you again soon!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel, Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: AlexandreaF
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at Naumi for our short honeymoon after a round the world wedding trip. We arrived very early at Naumi hotel a little worse for wear after such a long flight and lost luggage, however the staff a the hotel were fantastic. They looked after us in every way! We were welcomed with champagne, a complimentary snack and we were able to get onto the internet right away before even checking in. Our room was not ready, as it was 7am in the morning, however after a very short wait (filled with coffee and a snack) in the bright dining area, we were upgraded to the corporate suite and provided with everything we needed (toothbrush, toothpaste, hair brush etc) before our bags showed up. The staff went above and beyond, as they liaised with the airline to organise our luggage and delivery. The room was absolutely fabulous, clean and well stocked with complimentary drinks refilled everyday. We particularly loved the Nespresso machine! The roof top infinity pool was so relaxing, it was hard to leave and explore the city. The hotels location made it easy to explore everywhere though- Raffles is right next door, the hop on hop off bus stops close by, Orchard road is a short walk away, and the Flyer was a 10 min walk. We went for a romantic dinner 2 minutes away at Chijmes- there was an excellent Japanese! We were given a late checkout of 3pm- and we stayed up by the pool with a complimentary glass of champagne until 5:30. Thank you Naumi for making our short honeymoon an amazing experience! We already have plans to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet with great service”
Reviews.Author: richard255315
Reviews.Content: Stayed for 3 nights in a suite on 3rd floor, didn't have a view but that was OK, very comfortable bed and seperate living area with huge TV. Had some noise from plumbing next door and from aircon system, no noise at all from outside. The light switches took some time to figure out, as one touch pad will control a number of different lights. Great bathroom with rain shower and huge, deep bath. Free soft drinks in the fridge was nice, restocked during the stay. Breakfast was included in our room price and while not an expansive spread like big hotels, quality was good with real coffee. Pool on roof has a good view, however needs another couple of steps under the water to make it easier to climb out, at the moment it's difficult to exit the water. Staff were the best, every request quickly done, there were not a large number but the ones there seemed to be everywhere if needed. The location near Raffles is good too, easy walking to shops, lots of taxis cruising past. I'd suggest keeping a hotel card with the address on it, with you as some taxi drivers we found to be unfamiliar with the Naumi and the address. If you want to stay away from the mega hotels and get the same service, stay at Naumi.

Reviews.Title: “New in town?”
Reviews.Author: CynWorldTraveller
Reviews.Content: I live in Singapore now, so staying in a hotel here is not a regular occurance - however, when I first arrived 4 years ago, I wish the Naumi had been around! A friend and I decided to have a 'staycation' - and we booked an Executive Suite for a weekend. The room was perfect, well laid out, with a kitchenette (complete with wine fridge!!), a huge bathroom with separate bath and shower, cleverly designed living / bedroom area and an amazing private patio. It quite simply would be perfect for a longer term stay, when you want to have the flexibility of doing some light meal preparation in the room. It certainly feels more like an apartment than a hotel room. A real plus for longer stay travellers. The staff were highly engaged and very solicitous. The location is quite central, near everything (well, it is Singapore, most things are near most other things). Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Best boutique hotel stay ever!”
Reviews.Author: Krimie
Reviews.Content: I'm a local Singaporean and I have staycations from time to time just to relax and un-wind. It's my first time in Naumi and I'm beyond impressed with the service they have. Upon quick check-in, the hotel staff (I didn't really catch her name but I think it's Sharon; she's Pinoy =)) gave us a tour around the room. It was room 305. We were lucky to be upgraded to a suite room and I really appreciate that cos the room is huge!!! Initially I had problems with the complimentary wifi connection but a quick phonecall to the hotel frontdesk solved it. The ipod docker wasn't able to charge my iPhone 3GS but since it's only one night stay for me, i wouldnt think that would be a problem for me. Also, while taking a shower in the gorgeous bathroom, the handle of shower tap came loose. On our way out, met up with housekeeping and they were quick to attend to the matter. After we came back from dinner (hotel is located conveniently around shopping areas) we were pleasantly surprised that the room was made up despite us just checked in 4hours ago. It's like going into a brand new room! Late night, I decided to borrow some DVDs to watch. There wasn't a wide variety of movies to choose from. I was looking forward to the much-raved about infinity swimming pool on the rooftop and I wasn't disappointed. The view is amazing! There wasn't anyone there as I went on a Saturday morning and I had the luxury to enjoy the whole pool to myself. =) Stayed for only a night but the whole experience has been a memorable one. I would definitely come back again to this hotel! The great service by all the hotel staffs truly makes a difference in how pleasant the whole stay is. Well done, Naumi! =)

Reviews.Title: “Impeccable Service, Family Friendly and Great Value”
Reviews.Author: fans_of_burnham
Reviews.Content: We recently had a 5nt stay in Jun'11 in a Corporate Suite at the end of a European holiday on our way back to Sydney. The staff are very efficient, extreemly professional and go out of their way to help you (perhaps they could teach their French collegues a thing or two). The room was well appointed and had plenty of room for a family of four. The free mini bar and complementary breakfast were great and the pool is spectacular. Fantastic location, across the road from Raffels and 5min to the MRT...better than Orchard Rd by a long shot. 11 out of 10 for this property and we will be going back to stay the next time we are in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Great all round experience”
Reviews.Author: BoscoBritish
Reviews.Content: Stopped here at the end of June for a few days en route to Sydney. The staff were wonderful and could not have been more efficient, welcoming and helpful. Dinner in the room and complementary massage helped ward off the jet lag. Location very central and right next door to Raffles. The rooftop pool has good city views and though small is a nice spot to relax. The breakfast was superb with lots of choice and cooked food to order. Would not hesitate to stay again as they really look after you here. Singapore a great place to stopover with so many attractions that we will just have to come back for.

Reviews.Title: “As good as trip advisor reviews said”
Reviews.Author: MaryroseI
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Naumi for four days in early July on the basis of recommendations from reviews in Trip Advisor. In the past we had many business trips to Asia staying in souless five star hotels. This was a leisure trip for my husband and I and I was looking for a boutique hotel where we could get friendly personal service and feel relaxed. Naumi Hotel more than delivered the goods. We had a corporate suite on the second floor which meet every expectation . But the best part about Naumi is their staff. From top to bottom they anticipate your every need and go out of their way to ensure your stay is great. Thank you Naumi staff, you made our Singapore stay so special we are returning next July and it will only be the Naumi Hotel for us.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel, very helpful and friendly Staff!”
Reviews.Author: Lizzy1980
Reviews.Content: We were in Singpaore on honeymoon and this was our last stop, it was a perfect way to end our travels. The hotel was lovely, we were welcomed with a glass of champagne, a bowl of fruit and an upgrade. The staff on the front desk were very helpful and assisted us with maps, getting around and printing tickets etc. The room was lovely, clean and with great bathroom toiletries!

Reviews.Title: “We loved it and we'll be back”
Reviews.Author: BharatSharmaNewDelhi
Reviews.Content: Everything about Naumi was exceptional. The location is fab. 3 nights we actually walked back from Charles Quay, enjoying many historical sights on the way like the Armenian Church etc. The service was exemplary. Simon and Zamir spared no pain in sorting out any of our queries - be it regarding local travel or culture or whatever. For vegetarians and Indians, the hotel offered many food options - we ordered room service two nights and food was very good. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Sophisticated, stylish & friendly”
Reviews.Author: Woody12340
Reviews.Content: My family stayed at the lovely Naumi Boutique Hotel in Singapore at the end of June 2011. I was travelling with my husband and two 16 year old girls so opted for this exquisite centrally located small Hotel right next to Raffles. The two double rooms were beautifully decorated & our room #405 contained a very large and modern lounge area with kitchen, full size refrigerator, coffee machine, internet, flat screen TV, massive marble bathroom including gowns & slippers and everything you need for a business trip or holiday. The rooms were absolutely pristine with no sign of 'wear' on any of the furnishings. The kichen area had expensive crockery and glasses, a wide range of teas & interesting blends of coffees for the expresso machine. A delicious breakfast is served in the small foyer area & we even enjoyed a glass of champagne with our freshly cooked eggs. The pool area on the roof has a magnificent 180 degree view over to the Marina section and the city & drinks from the bar can be served in this intimate area of the hotel. The reception staff (especially Emmy) could not do enough to help. Nothing we asked for or needed was too much trouble. They were friendly, efficient & knowledgeable about the hotel and things to do in Singapore. My husband left his computer in the foyer by mistake and they organised a car to drop it to us at Singapore airport to save us the long journey back to the Hotel. Daphne in the Restaurant was a lovely warm person & extremely efficient. I only drink english breakfast tea and she went to so much trouble to organise this tea for the room and to enjoy over breakfast. Everything about our 3 night stay at Naumi was excellent and we will not hesitate to recommend the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Alexwong17
Reviews.Content: I had a night stay in naumi hotel, the location is very convenient to town area such as bugis, city hall... the ambience's is nice for chilling... room is very clean and tidy... staff is very approachable and efficient .. etc spencer's is very helpful and friendly, he brought me around and introduce me to my room upon checked in-- overall a nice stay over at NAUMI hotel... would stay there again in future (= Well done!

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels I've ever stayed in!”
Reviews.Author: sirtrev
Reviews.Content: Service: On my arrival, TWO staff RAN out to my taxi, took my bags, offered us drinks and seats and checked me, my wife and 19 month old into a room early at 8am at no extra cost. Very much appreciated after a long flight. The taxi ride from the airport was 25 minutes in rush hour and only S$25. We were upgraded to a Corporate Suite purely because I booked through Small Luxury Hotels online (for no cost to join and a cheaper rate!) and were given late check out too. Nothing was too much trouble for the friendly, professional staff. I borrowed their check in computer to print off my SIA boarding passes. Taxis were called for us, maps provided, public transport recommendations and directions to the nearest 7/11 (100m away) which stocked fresh cows milk for my toddler, were all given kindly. Room: HUGE, very modern, VERY CLEAN and beautifully decorated. You could live in this place! Twice/Three times the size of your average Tokyo or Hong Kong 4/5 star room! The aircon was fully adjustable and there were good curtains to keep out daylight when we needed to catch up on sleep. The rooms were very quiet too and we heard no street noise or noise from corridors or other rooms. We therefore didn't mind that the view was only of a quiet back lane, nor did we have a desire to look outside! There were electric sockets above the desk for both English/Singapore plugs and Australian plugs which suited me as I had stuff that needed each! There was a large lounge with a long couch, several guidebooks, a 50 inch Samsung LCD showing 14 channels (CNN, BBC, Australia news/kids shows, HBO movies, Malay, Bloomberg, CNBC etc) and BOSE DVD/speaker set, relaxing chair, a desk and chair and multiple choices of lighting that were good for not waking up our toddler whose cot we put in here. The good sized bedroom had a VERY comfortable and slightly firm, king (maybe emperor?) sized bed with lowish soft pillows and toddler cries in the night aside, we slept very well. In the bedroom was a 40 inch LCD. radio alarm clock with ipod/iphone dock, many sets/shades of lights and 3 wardrobes with plenty of hanging space. There was a long, snuggly pillow in one wardrobe which is popular in Asia and for pregnant sleepers. The very large bathroom was as big as the bedroom and had a large rain shower, large bath which was great for both the adults and bathing the toddler. Hair dryer, robes and toiletries were provided as expected from this class of hotel. There was a 5m mirrored hall leading from the lounge to the front door. Near the door were the kitchenette that had a table, 2 chairs, a wine fridge for about 20 bottles should you feel the need!, a large normal fridge and freezer, sink, kettle, 'George Clooney' Nescafe Espresso machine with 3 choices of coffee, and microwave. Cans of Coke, Coke light (diet), sprite, bottled water, diet coke, ginger ale were free and replaced the next day on request. Room service of a couple of free glasses of wine and a fruit platter were given to us due to joining Small Luxury Hotels. There were plates, cutlery, glasses etc which were great as we got takeaway from a popular locals Chinese restaurant a couple of doors down the road. My toddler loved roasted chicken and steamed rice for S$3.80. Also near the front door was a store room where the iron and ironing board were kept and a golf umbrella. We were able to keep our pram in here the room was so big. All in all, the kitchenette, store room and hall alone were the size of some Tokyo hotel rooms! Breakfast: For us was fantastic. Imagine a Hilton breakfast with slightly less hot choices but still so much that you're stuffed for the day but still wish you had room for something else that you saw on your third visit of getting food! There was still more than enough though. 5 hot choices that were changed a little daily (Chinese vegies, sausages in herbs, bacon, hash browns, mushrooms, baked beans etc), eggs freshly cooked on request any way including lovely omlettes, on request hot waffles cooked in front of you, about 5 tropical fruits plus Euro fare of bananas/apples etc, yogurts, mueslis, cereals (no kellogs), Jacobs Creek sparkling wine!, brewed to order pots of tea or coffees, 4 fruit juices, cheeses, hams, salmon, about 6 breads, about 6 Danishes, croissants, a few different muffins, waldorf salad, potato salad and more! The rooftop pool is a great feeling to swim in as you look at the amazing panoramic view of the city, perfect temperature and young kids not allowed. There was a few people sunbathing. It closes at about 6pm and there are sometimes functions there that we saw people arriving for in the lifts but never heard any noise from.
