Negatives: Despite my glowing review there a few nitpicking things that some people may not like but probably can't be helped and are worth including in case it turns someone off: - Pronunciation of the name! I just got a free map from the Arrivals desk at Singapore airport and pointed to it to show my cabbie. It's one block away from Raffles Hotel. - No washing up detergent provided to wash up with. This was essential for washing my toddlers' milk bottles. However, on asking house keeping, they gave us some. - Aircon resets to 22C each time you take out the keycard to leave the room. This is personal preference but for us, 22C was a little too cool in the lounge and we had to always remember to put it up to 23 or 24. - Wireless internet was free and fast however the instructions on how to use it seemed to be wrong/I didn't comprehend. A quick call to reception had me online in seconds though! - Cost. S$450 a night. It was well worth it but it isn't a price many people are able to pay. - Occasional clunking sound of the aircon getting rid of ice. This was heard about once every 6 hours. If that is the worse we found in a tropical, foreign country, this place should be Tripadvisor No. 1! Sorry for how long this is but I spent days looking at reviews on Tripadvisor before deciding on booking so personally I appreciate more rather than less and maybe some of you do too!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel - One of the BEST. WELL DONE Naumi. VERY Impressed”
Reviews.Author: cwliew
Reviews.Content: Recently had a 20 hour stopover in Singapore on the way from Adelaide to Kota Kinabalu. We chose to stay at Naumi because the first time we stayed there in 2009, we experienced probably one of the nicest hotel rooms we had stayed in. So we thought we’d give them another go. Also, because they are rated in the Small Luxury Hotels of the World. Check-in/Lobby: The hotel itself is a boutique hotel. It isn’t a Hyatt or Westin – but that is what we love about it. It is located on Seah Street, and if you catch the MRT from the airport, the best station to get off from is City Hall. If you get off at City hall, it is about a 5-10 minute walk to the hotel. Not a bad walk, and not a big issue. We had 2 full sized luggage bags and carry on wheeled luggage and had no problems. On arrival at the hotel on the 9th of July, we were greeted by a very friendly staff member who was waiting by the door for us, and proceeded to go through the check-in procedures. Welcome drink, Free cocktail voucher, A verbal tour of the room, and more. She was VERY nice and really made us feel welcome into the hotel. Room: We got into the room, and they had given us a free upgrade to a Patio Suite. We stayed in room 403, which was absolutely lovely. The patio is very large, and the room itself is very spacious. The finishes are immaculate and fantastic. The design is “mirrored and PLUSH!” There was a living room, with rotating 50 inch LCD TV, a couch, coffee table, and a kitchen type area with a Nespresso machine, TWG tea, and bar fridge stocked with complimentary softdrinks. All the little things were considered. There is multicountry support for power adapters, a wine fridge, and THE BEST BED I HAVE EVER SLEPT IN! The bed was so beautiful, I never wanted to leave. I have stayed in many hotels, but Naumi has by far the most comfortable bed I have ever slept in. WOW. The room is well maintained, and clean. Minimal signs of significant wear and tear. Room 403 is BIG! Last time we stayed at Naumi we stayed in an even bigger suite (Also an upgrade) and that one was even more impressive – no patio, but the useable indoor area was as big as my own homes living space! Bathroom: All I can say is that it is very spacious. Well designed. Only 1 sink, but the room is more than adequate. They get huge gold stars for already having toothbrushes, ear buds etc provided, which just shows that they are trying to make you comfortable. The shower has both a rain shower and a standard handheld, and is clean and has Molton Brown amenities. Robes are big, fluffy and comfy. And slippers are of a beautiful design and comfortable. Impressed. Restaurant: We only had breakfast in the hotel and it was great. They make custom omelettes which were made to perfection. The standard buffet has all what you would expect from a 5 star hotel, and Naumi did well with this given it is a boutique hotel. They had Cucumber juice, which I’d never had before, and this was one of the most refreshing drinks ever. Nothing to complain about here. It was a perfect start to the day. Service: The one thing that I can say about Naumi to convince anyone to stay there is that I have NEVER had better service in a hotel than we did during our stay. The 2 girls at the desk were fantastic. They were attentive, and very helpful. They listened, and seemed to have genuine interest in our day to day affairs without being nosy. They seemed to really love their job and seemed to really be happy to see us. Even more impressive was that they overheard that it was my girlfriend birthday, and on our return to the hotel that day, they brought a Tiramisu cake out while we were relaxing in the lobby area. It was so thoughtful and absolutely beautiful to taste. We were so touched by this… I am so impressed with this hotel that I can see no reason not to continue staying there every time I stay in Singapore. Both my girlfriend and I put it in our top 3 hotels worldwide, and would highly recommend this to anyone staying in Singapore. It is easy to get around from there. Other hotels that I have stayed in recently: Suba International (India), Westin (Melbourne), W Hotel (Hong Kong), Paramount (NYC), Peabody (Memphis) and in Singapore: Swissotel, Raffles (Crap) and Le Meridien (Kota Kinabalu). In Raffles we paid A$1200 per night, and it wasn’t have as good as Naumi (A$330).

Reviews.Title: “Personalized Luxury- Another Brilliant Experience!”
Reviews.Author: MalanAnuj
Reviews.Content: By another brilliant experience, I mean in Singapore. We decided to stay here as the website looked very personalised, verry nice and also as Naumi at the time of our planning was #1 on this website. It was the to round off our trip, and I must say we weren't disappointed! Naumi is a small boutique hotels and part of the SLH- Small Luxury Hotels, it truly is a gem. From the time of our check in to our check out, we were made to feel truly special and not just paying clients. Let me start with the rooms. We had a junior corporate suite- beautifully appointed. We are a family of two adults and two small children. Although the suite is huge, with a bedroom, a kitchenette, a big bathroom with a bathtub (gorgeous) and a separate shower cubicle and a living/dining area; there was still no room for an extra bed. We were assured that the sofa would be made up as an extra bed and it was true. The sofa is huge and the bed which was made could comfortably sleep an adult as well! The kitchenette was excellent, with a medium size fridge (big enough for a week's provisions), a hot plate, crockery and cutlery and the icing- your very own Nespresso machine with unlimited supply of coffee capsules. There was free hi speed wi-fi all over. There is an infinity pool on the 10th floor and though it's not big, but it's sufficient and with great views to boot. The in room dining was great, prompt and had VEGETARIAN options, which in Singapore mean a huge lot to someone like me (the only vegetarian in the family). The breakfast is an elaborate affair, with someone always looking after your needs. My fussy <two toddler was treated to the sausages he had to have even though they were not part of the menu that morning. We thoroughly enjoyed it. And the people who keep it all going smoothly- the staff who have been excellently trained. The smile goes way beyond the face, the girls at the front desk never hesitating for even a breath before loading our strollers into cabs or stowing them away for later use! They were all very very pleasant and very helpful at all times. It's worth paying a little extra for an establishment which recruits and trains their staff so well. If I forget something, I will surely write again. But Naumi was the perfect end to our Singapore trip.

Reviews.Title: “What a fabulous personal Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Lionelo33
Reviews.Content: The staff are exceptional, the Hotel is way above expectation. The most amazing is that all Staff is hands on, whether it be Front Desk, Bar or Breakfast area. With the smiles assistance when needed, why would you stay any where else.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and will stay again”
Reviews.Author: ChrisJ71
Reviews.Content: Brilliant location, great room, fanastic pool on the roof and really helpful, friendly staff! Would definitely recommend it and definitely stay again.

Reviews.Title: “LOVE IT!”
Reviews.Author: Nasz86
Reviews.Content: had a birthday party at the executive patio suite...the staff was super friendly, willing to give a helping hand and always show care concern and very enthusiastic.... the service is very good!! looking forward for more great moments w naumi...never regret every moment of it...thanks guys!!

Reviews.Title: “Cozy and chic, love it!”
Reviews.Author: LazyGracie
Reviews.Content: The rooms are huge. The bed is the comfiest I have ever slept on! Downsides: bad room fragrance, small pool, limited choice of food in breakfast and room service.

Reviews.Title: “One of the finer hotel rooms in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: cgun85
Reviews.Content: Hotel located in City Hall neighborhood of Singapore. About a 5-10 minute taxi ride to Orchard Road. 5-10 minute walk to City Hall MRT Station. Lots of small but fine restaurants around the immediate hotel vicinity (Great for breakfast, skip the hotel breakfast). The hotel itself is small, 10 floors, around 40 rooms including suites. 10th floor is an infinity pool with a decent view. There is a gym room, cardio room and conference room which we did not get to visit. We arrived Naumi a bit early and our room wasn't ready yet. They gave us the biggest deluxe room available which was surprisingly big. Two flat screen TVs, one in the living area and one in the bed room. Bathroom was not memorable. King sized bed was very comfortable. The carpet and coffee table was a bit dirty and had some stains. The room did show signs of wear, they would do better to touch the place up. Overall, very good experience. The customer service was excellent being such a small hotel. Would probably come back and stay again but definitely feel like we were over paying for the room. Nevertheless, one of the better hotels in Singapore! Would recommend to those who want a stylish hotel with great service in a quiet convenient location away from the bustle of Orchard Rd Singapore at a premium price.

Reviews.Title: “DISAPPOINTED”
Reviews.Author: Momtrifan
Reviews.Content: Sorry but this hotel did not life up to expectations. I arrived on a Friday night to a lobby/bar/restaurant which was jam packed - a private function. Forget it if you wanted a nice dinner in the restaurant. Saturday nights seem to be dominated by functions by the pool. Great pool mind you - with spectacular views. But no service up there - so if you were hoping for a snack and a drink by the pool then this is not the hotel for you. Very noisy. Parties in rooms - staff did nothing to try to quieten the revellers. Menu very limited. The basic rooms are very basic but the deluxe are nice. The receptionist is the porter is the bar attendant etc. Very small boutique hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding, don't even hestitate!”
Reviews.Author: nsxdavid
Reviews.Content: My girlfriend and myself added a few days to our Asia trip to shop and see the sights of Singapore. This time we took her sister along, who had always wanted to visit this great city. I choose Naumi because of the reviews, and let me tell you... they are right! It is a boutique hotel, which means the staff knows your name and you are treated in a warm, inviting, and exceedingly helpful manner. No request was met with anything less than friendly promptness, and half the time they anticipated what I wanted before I could even open my mouth. We got a room with an extra bedroom, perfect for our situation. There's no doubt it's pricey, much like everything in Singapore, but it is definitely worth it if you are in the market for the upscale, modern, boutique experience.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect - size, location, room, service”
Reviews.Author: CLGS_GS
Reviews.Content: What to say about the Naumi? We stayed three nights and found everthing to be perfect: 1. Warm, professional welcome with slick, attentive check-in, local information as required, escorted to the room; 2. Spacious, clean and well-appointed suite with complementary tea, coffee and soft drinks; 3. Quiet location and environment, close to Raffles City, City Hall MRT station, the buses on Beach, Bras Basah and North Bridge Roads, and a taxi past the door every minute; 4. Friendly and helpful staff - always greeted with a smile and a welcome; 5. Delightful roof-top pool with beautiful views over Singapore; 6. Great breakfast with eggs cooked to order in the bright, modern lobby restaurant/bar. 7. Slick check-out and in the taxi to the airport without delay.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Service. Great Location. Quality Accomodation”
Reviews.Author: BotanyBay
Reviews.Content: We stayed 7 nights. I was working for half the stay and the family came along to enjoy Singapore and then our holiday began proper, once my business commitments were over The hotel is in a great location, tucked behind Raffles and a short walk to the Marina Bay area We had taken a suite as it has two bedrooms -perfect for our set up - and I felt the price was reasonable - especially as the room was very modern and superbly equipped. The hotel has a "boutiqy" feel, being modest from the outside, but very smart and welcoming within. The staff are exceptional. Friendly, knowledgeable and helpful at every turn. Breakfast was included in our rate and was excellent I stay in Singapore 3 times a year and have done so for a decade. I have stayed at all the "Brand" hotels and this beats them all in my view. Be aware there is one one bar, one restaurant, one small but delightful pool, a tiny gym. But if you can do without the big hotel facilities and want comfort, style and personal attention -this will do you! Plus wireless fast internet is FREE -something I now look for when booking hotels

Reviews.Title: “Spacious oomfortable luxury rooms in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: ebno
Reviews.Content: I chose the hotel based on its high rating and its location. The location was fine - the only minor issue was that taxi drivers were unfamiliar with the name, but being next to the Raffles made to easy to clarify where we needed to be. The service was excellent - what one would expect from a smaller boutique hotel and restaurant. We had a corporate room - very spacious with two large TVs and plenty of area to lounge around. The only negatives were the ordinary view from the second floor (facing away from the street) and being at a lower level you get a few more of the occasional slamming door noises and street noise. For a better view it was worth going to the rooftop pool where there were never any more than a few other people if anyone. The bed was the most comfortable I have ever slept on - I've slept thousands of nights on beds away from home and this one was the winner. The fridge was reasonable sized unit rather than the usual dodgy tiny bar fridge that struggles to accomodate supermarket bought drinks and snacks. There were some very minor maintenance issues (shower handle that came off in your hand etc) , but there weren't any of the usual things that de-rate a room terribly such as cracked tiles or mysterious carpet stains. The price wasn't cheap but no worse than any other hotels in the the same class in Singapore - we had breakfast included. Room service prices were comparable to any other quality hotel. If you want the somewhat more personalised service and street level ambience you get from a small hotel rather than the larger 20 floor chain hotel, this place fits the bill.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Location, Great Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: DetSam
Reviews.Content: Booked our 3-days stay at Naumi through online due to good reviews. We were not disappointed - our room on the 3rd floor was HUGE and CLEAN; very functional, with 2 large TVs and a Bose sound system, a good sized ref (instead of the small personal refs in other hotels), and came with free Espresso (which my wife absolutely loved). Can also borrow X-Box for free! Loved the hideaway reading light above the bed which allowed me to read without disturbing my wife. Staff were very helpful and courteous. Our thanks to Emmy and Tess, as well as the other staff who were very helpful and patient with our questions. Buffet breakfast was delicious - especially loved having the freshly cooked omelet and fresh orange juice. Esplanade, Raffles Hotel, Funan Mall (for electronics), MRT City Hall, Bus stop, are all just a few minutes walk away. Hippo Bus/Duck Tours are within 10 minute walk. All in all, very good value for the money we paid.

Reviews.Title: “Not worth the price”
Reviews.Author: BloveC
Reviews.Content: The room is spacious and beautiful, however the facilities (gym, yoga, weight room and the infinity pool) are really really small. The services is not that good as i have been to anther boutique hotel that is nicer and more friendly staff. We asked for refill of tea bags and they only allow once a day even though you finished all the teas, and the mini bar are all sodas, no fruit juice or box drinks. No snacks at all for the minibar too. We went for breakfast and requested for room services, however after 1.5hours the room is still left unclean, and we couldn't bother more and cancel the room service. The pillows are superb soft, so you might want to ask for a firmer pillow. Generally my experience with Naumi hotel is pleasant, i juet feel that it's really really not worth the price, go somewhere else.

Reviews.Title: “A regular favourite.”
Reviews.Author: myWei
Reviews.Content: I've stayed at Naumi a few times already, but never really got around to writing a review. My first stay was in 2008, and I'm not surprised that since then the hotel has risen to being #1 in Singapore. The one thing that has been consistent and the best thing about the hotel is the service. The minute you arrive, check-in is seamless and the staff extremely intuitive. I arrived early this trip and our room wasn't ready, which was understandable, but they took the effort and time to reassure us that the room would be available as soon as possible, and was in 45 min. By the time we went to grab a bite and came back to our hotel, our bags where already in the room. Check-out is fast, instead of a paper receipt I asked them to e-mail me my receipt, which was done almost instantly without any hassle. I usually stay in the Premier room, which is very spacious. For the price you pay you get a small living area, desk and kitchenette with a Nespresso machine - great value! Sound insulation is a problem - you can often hear upstairs neighbours showering, the hotel is aware of the issue, and provide you with a pair of earplugs for undisturbed sleep. They use Molton Brown toiletries now as opposed to Kiehl's, which was better. Molton Brown has a very masculine smell to it; not as gender neutral as Kiehl's. The complimentary mini-bar selection is also smaller compared to before, but at least they are progressive enough to make the mini-bar free. The inside of the toilet bowl was a bit stain-y, which is something that should be fixed. Water pressure in the shower is great and the tubs are nice and big. After sampling most of Singapore's boutique offerings, I think I will always return to Naumi. For the comfortable size of their rooms and their outstanding service.

Reviews.Title: “Had a great time in this hotel”
Reviews.Author: dorycook
Reviews.Content: In a city where boutique hotels are a dime a dozen, Naumi hotel stands out as one of the best. Filipino staff in the hotel are the greatest (im being bias here since i am filipino). Roofdeck pool is awesome! Rooms are hip and modern but not cold. Nespresso as part of the in bar is such a cool idea. Lobby is a great place to hang out too. Location of the hotel is another plus. Overall i will stay in this hotel again but others like Quincy, Majestic are giving better tempting deals so Naumi better watch out.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at Naumi Hotel”
Reviews.Author: cmnuman
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel, very good service, very friendly and helpful reception, restaurant exactly all staff were extremely helpful. Great position easy to walk to seaside, culture centre across the road from the back entrance to Raffles Hotel. Great Chinese Restaurant called Ten in the next street up. On recommendation of Hotel staff very good beauty salon with a discount voucher through the Naumi, nail bar and Chinese massages, foot reflexoligie, body massages. All in a 5 min walking distance. We really enjoyed our lunch at the hotel and reasonbly priced as well.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: WAJane
Reviews.Content: We stayed a this hotel for a week and chose this one as it was a small boutique hotel. we stayed in a Deluxe room which was very spacious and very clean. The bed was sooo comfortable and everything was very well maintained. I have to compliment the staff at this hotel as nothing was too much trouble for them. You are made to feel special at this hotel and everything was done with a smile. They work hard to maintain these high standards and we would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “A great base for a longer stay”
Reviews.Author: Currumbin
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful stay at the Naumi recently. It met all our expectations and we look forward to future stays. The spaciousnes of the room with separate sleeping area and well set up kitchen nook was a definite plus as was the intimate nature of the hotel. The staff were most attentive and welcoming. Breakfast was well presented and completely satisfied our particular needs. I complement the chef on his Sunday curry. My husband has put your hotel on the top of his list. I am a little more pragmatic as I missed having a view from the room but I guess you can't have everything!

Reviews.Title: “A rare jewel”
Reviews.Author: tripbunnies
Reviews.Content: I travel a LOT for business, and Naumi was booked for me by my local office; same old same old expected. Was very pleasently surprised from the off, with very attentive staff who didnt mess about - check in, room arranged, free G&T in the bijou lobby bar. The room itself was a great example of how to make a room special without being over the top - auto lighting, great TVs, plenty of space, hard bed (so many hotels think marshmallow beds are good), mini kitchen for cooking. All soft drinks in the fridge free....I could go on Then, there is a great little rooftop pool, a gym, and other essentials at your fingertips. The staff were impressive -rushing between engagements, I could ask the front desk for a sandwich and five minutes after getting in my room to change, there it was. The only minor complaint was no changeroom for guests who have checked out and want somewhere for a quick change at the end of a working day before rushing to the airport. Overall though, a gem, and I will be back

Reviews.Title: “No.1 for good reason!”
Reviews.Author: Riviera9771
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a wonderful 4 night stay at Naumi hotel. I really can't fault it, the service was warm and friendly, the rooms were clean and spacious with plenty of ambience. The location was perfect for walkable dining and shopping and the MRT. Will definitely stay again when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “An excellent place to stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: BAnder1708
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just spent a couple of nights at Naumi Hotel during our first visit to Singapore, which is simply an amazing place. We couldn't have been more pleased with our stay at Naumi Hotel. We both prefer smaller hotels in quieter locations and Naumi Hotel fit the bill in both respects. It has maybe 40-50 rooms in all and is located on a side street (Seah St.) adjacent to the well-known Raffles Hotel in the next block near the City Hall MRT station. The room (small suite) we had on the 8th floor had a good view of downtown Singapore and was very comfortable, especially the bed. We both enjoyed the rooftop pool area on the 10th floor, which had just an incredible view enhanced by the infinity pool there. The full breakfast buffet was just great. Especially enjoyed the fresh squeezed orange juice and other fresh fruit available there. Most of all we loved the service and personal attention provided by the Naumi staff. Extremely courteous and friendly and willing to take the time with you to arrange touring, restaurants, etc. We couldn't rate the hotel more highly and we will definitely return to Naumi Hotel on our next visit to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Good but not Great”
Reviews.Author: Alex_NZD
Reviews.Content: Not sure why the Naumi is ranked #1 on TripAdvisor. 3 of us stayed here each in a different room and we all had a fairly similar experience. The rooms are not sound proof at all. Every 10 minutes it seemed like there was a clunk or crash to wake you up. The entire building is finished relatively poorly, with patches of plaster scattered over the ceiling. We asked reception to order us a table at a specific restaurant which they apparently had, however upon arrival we were told they had no reservation for us at all. Not sure if the hotel was to blame for this but we were certainly unimpressed. FYI we stayed in the luxury suite, deluxe room, and premium room. If you're looking for the best hotel experience in Singapore, this is not it. However if you stick with the cheaper rooms and don't expect anything amazing, you'll be right at home.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience!!”
Reviews.Author: Tazz1577
Reviews.Content: The Naumi Hotel is a lovely welcoming hotel better than any I have stayed in previously. My husband travels a lot and has stayed at The Hyatt and Hilton etc, but this was his favourite hotel by far. The staff cannot do enough for you and you are always greeted with a smile and hello whenever you come in. The room was immaculate and the ambiance of the hotel is great. Breakfast was included in our room rate and it was so good! Waffles made to order, eggs any way you like. All delicious. The service was second to none. Amazing rooftop infintiy pool was a great way to start the day, the view at night is AMAZING!!! I highly recommend The Naumi if you want a small hotel with all the luxury of a big chain. I will most definately stay there again when I return to Singapore. Thank you for making my first trip to Singapore so memorable.

Reviews.Title: “TRULY EXCELLENT”
Reviews.Author: TCSC47
Reviews.Content: We recently had the pleasure of staying for 3 nights at the Naumi Hotel. We had booked this hotel as the result of it being recommended on the Small Luxury Hotels of the World website. Admittedly we were a little hesitant on seeing the facade of the hotel on arrival as it certainly does not have an imposing presence, however any hesitations were immediately forgotten after walking into the foyer. Whilst the internal ambience certainly has that slick hip feel to it, it was the greeting and attention of the staff that won us over. Generally the hotel and room amenities are more than satisfactory. Cleanliness was good. Breakfasts were excellent and varied. Free non-alcoholic drinks and Nespresso coffee were provided in the room. However the overwhelming impression we were left with was the welcoming attention and service of the staff, in particularly Melissa, Paul, Irwin and Zamir. We have no hesitation in recommending the hotel to anyone.

Reviews.Title: “Quiet Retreat in the Heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: afarmandthirsty
Reviews.Content: I have been meaning to write this review for several months because we had such a fantastic experience at the Naumi and wanted to be sure to record it. We spent five nights there in late January as we were in town for a conference, but also to play tourist a bit. The hotel is in a wonderful location--right next to the Raffles Hotel (you sort of overlook it from the rooftop pool, which was a lovely place to retreat after a long day at my conference to read and sip a beer for a bit). More importantly, you can walk to several museums and parks as well as hop on several lines of the impressive Singapore subway system--clean, easy to use, efficient--a lot of cities could learn a lot about public transit from this system. I found the room surprisingly spacious and the bed was so comfortable. The staff at the front desk were kind and courteous. I did find the price of breakfast a little steep--especially since I'm not a big eater and just need some fruit typically. But they provide coffee in the room and we ended up going out and grabbing something quick each morning as there are many restaurants in the neighborhood. I tend to stay at different hotels and stay in different neighborhoods when I travel, but I wouldn't do that in Singapore. If I go back, I'm only staying at the Naumi!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: thitita
Reviews.Content: The room is nice and clean. The simming pool a little bit small. Very friendly staff. The bed is nice and comfortable. The shower had water running out. Overall it is nice hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great for leisure but not set up for business”
Reviews.Author: Charleyquant
Reviews.Content: Roof top bar and pool have great views over the city but service can be hit and miss in the rooms especially if you need to rely on Internet etc... Water also came pouring through the ceiling of the bathroom from te room above which although they fixed it didn't seem to cause much alarm amongst the staff even when the electrics in my room started to flicker.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT”
Reviews.Author: qishmon
Reviews.Content: They have the most comfortable bed EVER ! Peaceful and quiet swimming pool, nice deco, delicious breakfast! Staff were really friendly. Probably the only hotel that I've seen more staff than guests' around. Can I know where do you guys get your sheets from? I want them for my home too!

Reviews.Title: “we loved Naumi”
Reviews.Author: thea1308
Reviews.Content: Singapore as a city was a pleasant surprise, but Naumi was even a better one. Right in the center of town, a relatively small hotel but with outstanding service and luxureous and very comfortable rooms, almost opposite the wellknown Raffles. The staff was friendly and helpful, the wifi was free, the bar and restaurant served excellent food and drinks (lovely breakfast too!), and the infinitypool on the top was "top of the bill". This first visit to Singapore (out of the airport) has been a wonderful experience and I am sure we will be back and will definitely be staying at Naumi again.

Reviews.Title: “The coolest Hotel with the best service in Singapore!”
Reviews.Author: Tux10
Reviews.Content: I cannot reccomend Naumi Hotel in Singapore highly enough. My wife & I went to Singapore for 7 days without our young children as a "pre-relocation mission" to find a house and schools as we are soon moving to Singapore for my work. This was an exciting trip and despite having a lot to do we wanted to have fun as well & Naumi hotel was perfect - great rooms, amazing swimming pool and the most genuine, helpful and friendly staff ever!! It is very centrally located and walking distance to great restaurants and hawker bars as well as China Town. It is a great hotel and would be perfect for business or for a holiday

Reviews.Title: “Extra special staff”
Reviews.Author: gadSydney_
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here a couple of times in the past but our latest stay at the end of May 2011 really brought home how much their service and standards have improved over recent years. The room facilities have been updated and are extremely functional and comfortable while the public area provides excellent amenity. The most important feature of the Naumi however is their staff. There was nothing that was too much trouble for any of them from the front desk to the management. Of particular mention were Melissa, on the reception; Simon, the front office manager; and Daphne, the hotel administrator. They gave us their personal attention at all times and made our stay exceptional.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely delightful!”
Reviews.Author: qwert1234598765
Reviews.Content: I am not prone to singing praises for a firm; after all why should I do their advertising for them; however I am going to make an exception here as our two week stay during the inaugural Youth Olympic Games was absolutely delightful. There was nothing I could fault. Check-in is low key, all the staff very friendly and welcoming, no matter what the time of day you encounter them, our bed very comfortable, although a little to warm for our liking, and the breakfasts always magnificent with local fresh fruit, juices, proper coffee and hot dishes to served to your liking. We found Naumi through Small Luxury Hotels of the World, being a member and having enjoyed a previous stay in another SLH elsewhere. Truly, there was nothing negative to comment on. We had no regrets.

Reviews.Title: “Yes, it really does deserve the excellent reviews”
Reviews.Author: Wendyjosh
Reviews.Content: Fantastic boutique hotel in downtown Singapore. I can't think of one thing I would change. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect stay in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JWG13
Reviews.Content: The Naumi made our trip to Singapore an unforgettable and tremendously comfortable experience. It was the perfect choice in a city full of hotel options. The staff was warm and wonderful all around.

Reviews.Title: “Your Own Personal Luxury Indeed”
Reviews.Author: evaevrina
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner are celebrating our 4th anniversary and again decided to just have a short staycation right in our own country. Our last stay was in a 5 star hotel and we thought this year, we decide upon a boutique hotel. I always looked upon Trip advisor for hotel ratings and I’m split minded between Naumi and Quincy. We decided on Naumi due to its overwhelming good reviews. I want to see what that special gem about Naumi is. (18/05/2011)We reached the hotel at 11.30am. One person that I really feel worth commended for is this lady by the name of Yu-Yan and I will tell you why. She welcomed us warmly upon entering the reception. She swiftly does all the documentation needed. It just caught me by surprise that if we were to use a debit card for our stay in this hotel, we have to put a $200 deposit. I never had that experience before with any other hotels but Yan explained to me carefully with detailed explanation on the deposit required. That was over and done with fast too. She could not checked us in earlier as the hotel is full but offered us to put our luggage at the hotel while we could wander around the streets near the hotel. We went to catch a movie. We went back to the hotel at 3pm again greeted by Yan. We were just about to ask about our luggage, she had informed us that our luggage had already been sent up to our room. Now this is what I call efficiency. During my other hotel stays, checking in will be just getting our room keys and we just going up to our room but Yan escorted us up to our room. We had booked the corporate suite and we were put on the 2nd level of the hotel. Yan brought us in to our room, explaining some of the details of the room and comprehensive details about the complimentary espresso and mini bar. The suite is really big. For the amount we paid for, I think we could only stay in a deluxe room in any 5 or 6 star hotels here. Room is spacious, nice living area, huge bathroom and of course the most complimented for, the great comfortable bed…It’s like you’re being wrapped up in a cocoon once you’re under the sheets. We had our unpacking and rest, 45 minutes later, Yan called us and mentioned that since it’s our anniversary, the hotel is sending us up a complimentary cake and fruit platter and let me tell you the cake is deeeeeeeeeeelicious…wonder what cake it was. Around 5.00 pm, another call was received and this time, the hotel offered complimentary welcome drinks for us. 2 staff brought us a fruit platter again and fruit juice. This hotel just couldn’t surprise us enough. Breakfast on the second day was ok, wished there is one main dish like fried noodle or something. But the staffs that served us during breakfast is fabulous. From the moment you stepped in the breakfast area, they serve you up to you stepped out. There is this one Indian lady who is so attentive to our needs, from coffee, to juices, to how we like our eggs….very impressive… We went to Universal Studios and only reached the hotel back at around 4pm. Our room had been made, just one thing to point out though, the toiletries are not replenished, eg, shower gel, shampoo, conditioner. Hence, we have to use 1 bottle for our 3 day stay. We went to take a dip at the pool later. Small pool but nice with such a fantastic view. When we reached back our room, housekeeping is doing their evening turning down service. The supervisor was with the housekeeping people and told us that we could still come to our room. I guess the housekeeping is a bit stressed that we are there as they left the room, yes, made up, but with the bathroom’s bin in the living area and replenish us with 1 towel instead of 2, but well, that’s just a minor thing. We were also provided with complimentary mineral water from the hotel. We loaned the X box from the hotel and it was sent up to us quickly. The breakfast on the 3rd day was still ok, variety changed a bit but service is still fantastic. We left the hotel at 11.30 am with much hesitant though. Again Yan checked us out smoothly and called us a cab. To future guests of this hotel, this hotel may not be huge or have a ‘wow’ building to start with, but to me, the staff completes the hotel. As I’ve mentioned, Yan was worth commended for as she just really took us under her wings and really treated us being special and took care of our needs with a smile. Mind you, in some hotels once they know that we are locals, service provided to us is much lower than provided for the tourists. However, she equally provide us exceptional service leaving us feeling very homey in this hotel.My partner is also in the hotel industry and had worked with several hotels but he himself found this hotel a gem indeed and the gem is indeed the staff themselves. Peter Wong, the GM of this hotel must had put great effort in training his staff and putting this hotel a standout among the rest of the 5 or 6 star hotels in Singapore. It’s a no wonder you’re Number 1 hotel In Singapore. One thing never changed me and my spouse’s mind when we stepped out of the hotel, if we have the chance, our next staycation will still be here…Naumi…its your own personal luxury indeed :) Guests From Room 202.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little gem n Singapore”
Reviews.Author: JVWDV
Reviews.Content: A very friendly and comfortable hotel, next to Raffles. The staff are friendly, the rooms are a good size, the beds are VERY comfortable, there is a small gym and a rooftop pool (small but perfecly formed) I had fantastic stay

Reviews.Title: “Fantastically friendly & helpful”
Reviews.Author: Paullyb
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading positive reviews about the service. We were treated wonderfully well: the reception was low key, friendly and keen to do everything to make our stay in the city a success. Probably the friendliest service I've ever had in a big city hotel - they went the extra mile (and more). I really enjoyed a morning dip in the roof top pool too. Will definitely return the next time we're in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a fantastic hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Brenno61
Reviews.Content: This is a great botique hotel. The staff couldn't do enough, they were exceptional, every request was met with a smile, and we were made to feel very special, right down to the birthday cake and champagne on the roof. The rooms are beautiful, spacious and very clean. The rooftop pool is a very specail space with amazing views over the city. I've stayed in lots of hotels in asia and this is one of the best. Can't reccomend it too highly.

Reviews.Title: “Naumi Hotel is one of the best hotels I have ever stayed in.”
Reviews.Author: KRS76
Reviews.Content: Naumi is a luxury boutique hotel in a very central location in Singapore, it is an absolute pleasure to stay there, the staff are incredibly helpful, the rooms are very big and decorated in a very stylish way, the hotel is very peaceful (so if you are after a wild time this probably isn't the hotel for you as the bar seems to close quite early) and the rooftop infinity pool is small but very nice with a fantastic view of the city. It is a truly beautiful hotel. I cannot fault it.

Reviews.Title: “A charming trendy place with a twist !”
Reviews.Author: karimyanmar
Reviews.Content: This place puts a smile on your face ! Great rooms nicely decorated and well equipped - little touches here and there are very well thought and fun. Fantastic front staff (reception and breakfast) that really looks after you. Real 5 star service in the attention, care provided to guests.

Reviews.Title: “More than happy to call NAUMI Hotel my home in Singapore.”
Reviews.Author: baozza
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the NAUMI Hotel in Singapore from 1-6 May 2011. There are just 40 rooms in this property so the personal attention from staff was wonderful. Not in least bit intrusive but genuinely warm and pleasant and efficient. The location is stellar and makes it simple to get in and out and about whatever brings you to Singapore, be it work, shopping, or just a nice break. The rooms are superb!

Reviews.Title: “Hidden Gem”
Reviews.Author: ExplorerSwart
Reviews.Content: Location: Excelent.Hotel is basicaly acros from the raffles hotel(the east side, not main entrance). Closest MRT is 2 blocks away. Nearest malls: Rafles city(on your way to the MRT) & Suntec. Rooftop view is amazing. you can see the whole city up to marina bay sands. Note: there are however 2-5 dodgy chinese restaurants/pubs next to the hotel but this does not bother though. Service: "No" is not an option. Staff is very flexible in terms of requests and go through extra trouble to make you feel comfortable and assist you. Reception is also consierge, had better. They were not up to date in terms of tourist attractions and could not manage to make a restaurant booking for us, which we managed to do on our own afterwords. Rooms & amenities. Good attention to detail. Cleanlines was excelent. Turndowns were standard, nothing special. Rooms have iron, ironing board, microwave and 2 plate stove some rooms even have hair straightners. Free mini bar was included in our package, not sure wether this is standard. It did however only include soft drinks and was refiled daily but the variety was limited eg. 1 coke, 1sprite, 1 soda water etc. Rooms are very spacious and beds highest standards of comfort. Food & Breakfast Set menu's are very reasonable at about SD25 for a three course meal including a glass of wine. Quality of the food was First class. Would request dinner to be served on the deck as the view is breathtaking and the communual dining are is basicaly in reception. Breakfast was also of realy good quality,its is basicaly hot breakfast or/and oriental and they provide extras like cereal bars that you can throw in your bag for the day and multivitamins.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous customer care and rooms”
Reviews.Author: rochdel
Reviews.Content: Everything about this hotel is beautiful, especially the staff. Thanks for being so flexible with bag storage and letting us shower and use the pool long after checkout before a long flight. Great attention to detail in the rooms. Loved the yoga room and pool. Perfect.

Reviews.Title: “World Class!”
Reviews.Author: Stefan B
Reviews.Content: Concept, branding and service on world class level! Great breakfast, nice decor in the Lobby, light and modern with an exclusive touch. The Staff team is amazing, friendly, professional and efficient. There will not be any need to look around for other hotels for my next visit to Singapore. Thank you all for a great stay! And a special thank you to Daphne for a nice chat during the breakfast, really much appreciated. Stefan Brunqvist

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding staff”
Reviews.Author: Dioscorea
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a one week stay in Naumi, Singapore. I booked the hotel based on reviews here at Tripadvisor and I was not disappointed. The staff is probably Naumi's best asset. Everyone - from housekeeping to front desk - is professional and genuinely friendly. In terms of staff, this is probably the best hotel I have stayed in ever. Rooms are very clean, bright and modern. I'm quite demanding when it comes to bed quality, but the beds were top notch. Breakfast was OK but not memorable: nice selection of fruits and fresh juices. I especially liked the home made mango yoghurt. Another nice plus is that Naumi offers a lot of extras: Nespresso machine in the room, huge LCD TV, free drinks in the minibar, two free drinks in the hotel bar, free WiFi, free bottled water, free cookies upon arrival, free swimming pool and gym, free iPhone charger, etc. Negative points are few and far between: the airco can be a bit loud, but it wasn't an issue for me. I found an ant or two in the room, but it's just unavoidable in the tropics. Breakfast could be a bit more extensive. Again these are very minor issues that would not keep me from staying there again. If you are looking for a huge hotel with a marble-clad lobby, please look elsewhere. If you are looking for a modern luxury hotel with outstanding service that will make you feel at home from day one, Naumi is the place to stay in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Can I live here please?! Best City Hotel Experience”
Reviews.Author: bellakaye
Reviews.Content: I knew Naumi would be good from the other reviews, but being in the room, experiencing the service, sleeping in the bed, swimming in the pool, enjoying the free complimentary wine, being able to surf the web on my phone, made my trip in Singapore 5 stars. This is the nicest hotel my husband and I have ever stayed in a city. We travel a lot, 10 countries in the last 2 years and stay in a lot of hotels during our travels. Naumi is top notch. All details are not overlooked. And the staff is wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “exquisite and stylish decor with great service - best a traveller can expect!”
Reviews.Author: ezgoing77
Reviews.Content: great room, great service, restaurant serves great food too. only downside was that the bed is bit too soft for my taste - think it's the additional pillow top which can be removed if desired.

Reviews.Title: “Service with a SMILE :-)”
Reviews.Author: lhenriettal
Reviews.Content: We arrived after an overnight flight and were pleasantly welcomed with a morning coffee and warm smiles at the reception. Our room was not available yet for check-in so we opted to wait in the lobby whilst having a coffee. About an hour later, the guest services officer came up to us and offered us an option to change to another room, which was available immediately for check-in. She first showed us the room (a corporate suite) and informed us of the difference in room rate. We were rather tired from the flight and were grateful to be able to check into any room, so we decided to go ahead and take the suite (which wasn't very much more expensive than the deluxe). We truly appreciate this gesture as it shows the staff were constantly thinking about how to make their guests more comfortable. The room was large with separate bedroom and living room, and had a kitchen bar counter with all the necessary appliances (and Nespresso machine!). The bed was extremely cozy and comfortable as well. In short, I have absolutely no complaints about the room. There's an infiinity pool on the 10th floor (rooftop) but we didn't get a chance to use it - looks absolutely stunning though! In summary, the best part of this hotel is the friendliness and excellent service and hospitality of the staff. The room & hotel lobby was also wonderful. It's located beside Raffles Hotel near City Hall so very central and convenient location too. Definitely would recommend friends and family to stay at Naumi when in Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with beautiful rooms & perfect service!”
Reviews.Author: breeze197
Reviews.Content: My mum & I stayed here for 5 nights & we could not fault anything. Very funky hotel with beautifully appointed rooms which were thoroughly cleaned daily. All of the Naumi Aides are very friendly & extremely helpful, upgrading us to a larger room at a great rate when we realised the one we booked was too small. When mum lost her camera memory cards on a zoo tour they called around to find them for us so that we could continue on with our holiday! Brilliant! Breakfast was great with a variety of choice for food & juices & room service was as good as a quality restaurant. No view from the room but the view from the rooftop infinity pool was great, looking out over the rooftops with the top of the Marina Bay Sands in the distance. The location is great with a short walk to train stations, shops & across the road from the Raffles. We've stayed at many 4 & 5 star hotels over the years but Naumi by far stands out from the rest in service, cleanliness & style. We'll definitely stay here again!!

Reviews.Title: “Am in the lobby, just DON'T want to leave from here !!!!”
Reviews.Author: ki33ki Posted by an Accorhotels.com traveler
Reviews.Content: Only one night here, we wish we could stay for 10 ! service discrete and efficient, good location, food correct The big plus is in the little attentions in the room.. quality of beds, nespresso machine, colors, so enjoyable ! Cool swimming pool, actually smaller than some pictures might want to show but the view.. wow ! Taxi drivers don't know the place yet so just tell them "in front of Raffles" or take the hotel phone number with you

Reviews.Title: “warm & welcoming”
Reviews.Author: MrsDeefer
Reviews.Content: I chose the Naumi hotel after reading traveller reviews and it does not disappoint! The staff offer outstanding service and the buffet breakfast is wonderful. The rooms are clean and comfortable. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anyone that likes that more personal touch that big hotels often fail to deliver.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel, try it and see!”
Reviews.Author: GlobalMeerkat
Reviews.Content: Found the Naumi on TA after being booked into Grand Park hotel and checking out after 1 night. The Naumi hotel is fantastic; smart boutique hotel next door to Raffles. Only 40 rooms so not crowded and there seemed to be more staff than guests so always someone around to help. Room was superb, pool was great but only used it early morning before the sun was around. Gym rooms were a bit small but with so few rooms I guess you can always find a time to be the only user. Compared to the big Singapore hotels the Naumi was streets ahead! No queues at breakfast or check-out, I stayed there on business during a stressful trip but the relaxed atmosphere made it a joy to come home at night. Will certainly use this hotel again, it beats the other on all fronts.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic little escape”
Reviews.Author: ABixler
Reviews.Content: My husband and I are from the US via India and went to Singapore for our first time this past weekend. I found Naumi on a boutique hotel website and fell in love with the Naumi website! The bed is like sleeping on a cloud, the deluxe rooms are a wonderful size. The staff were all very helpful and always welcoming us. The location is fantastic, a 2 block walk to city hall station a central hub for getting all around. I look forward to our next stay at Naumi and would highly recommend the hotel for any type of traveler!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel is perfection”
Reviews.Author: wainaam
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautiful. I was placed on a ladies only floor, which made me feel extra secure since I was traveling alone. The hotel is small, but very square inch is well utilized. They have a stunning pool as well as cardio, weight and yoga rooms. My room was very comfortable. Breakfast was delicious. The location is very convenient to many restaurants and shopping opportunities and a 5 minute walk to the MRT station. The staff was friendly and professional. Every single employee that I encountered asked if there was anything they could do for me. When took a taxi to the hotel from the airport - I had only the name and address of the hotel in my purse (phone number was in my luggage in the trunk) and the address did not come up on his GPS system. We drove right past the hotel without seeing it. It is on the north side of Seah St. next to Beach center and can be accessed from either Beach Rd or North Bridge Rd.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: Claire298184
Reviews.Content: Booked in here for 3 nights. Have always liked the sound of this hotel so I thought I would give it a whirl. Location is great. Easy walking to Suntec, various shopping malls, MRT is nearby and taxis are cheap. Raffles in next door. The room was great. Big, well designed and a very comfortable bed. Breakfast was fine. The pool although it had great views was a little small for a swim, fine for a refreshing dip. Little bizarre staff experience whereby I was sent an email to review the hotel before I had even left and also had a 10 pm front desk call, reminding me the check out was at noon and did I want some help with my luggage. Perhaps they saw this as super efficient? If you are looking for a small hotel then this would be the one. I was on the 9th floor and rarely had to wait for the lift for more than a minute.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant.”
Reviews.Author: Siewping17
Reviews.Content: I stayed for 2 nights in a Deluxe Room, as part of the Couples Package with my partner. It was a birthday treat for my partner and the staff were extremely accommodating and helpful, responding promptly via email, when it came to organising a birthday surprise. Upon finding out that we were both ladies, we were given a room on the Ladies Only floor, which was a nice touch. The room was beautiful and spacious and and all the little details (TWG tea, Nespresso coffee maker, microwave, glasses, cutlery, hair iron, etc.) made a world of difference. Additionally, the in-room massage and in-room dinner included in the Couples Package was sheer bliss. We felt pampered and well looked after by staff, who bent over backwards to make sure our stay was a good one, and were all cheerful and efficient. The rooftop pool was stunning, free wifi fast, and 24-hr room service menu was impressive! Seah St, where the hotel is located, has an array of local food stalls, restaurants, and pubs. The only downside was that there was no carpark at the hotel so we paid for parking in the building next to it, which added up to a fair bit for two whole days. The stay was worth every cent though!

Reviews.Title: “Great boutique hotel, great service and location. Lovely room.”
Reviews.Author: rmbeez
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of February. I wanted somewhere a bit different and personal as most hotels of a 5* standard in Singapore are massive. Despite being small & intimate the Naumi is in a great location, just behind Raffles. You can walk through Raffles hotel to Raffles City and the MRT form there takes you everywhere. However taxis in Singapore are so easy and efficient to use in Singapore I recommend them rather than the highly efficient MRT. Our welcome was lovely and we were upgraded to a lovely suite. It was only one floor up but Seah street is so quiet we couldn't hear the traffic at all. The rooms are very well appointed, with coffee maker, i-pod speakers etc. Bathroom and shower facilities are great and the king size bed was soooo comfy. I would recommend this place to anyone, we were made to feel very welcome and were very happy. A pity we could not stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “My standards are very high. This boutique hotel made me more than happy!”
Reviews.Author: Marc0425
Reviews.Content: Nowadays, boutique hotels can be very deceiving. Who cares for a design/boutique hotel if the service and the food experience are deceiving? Well my stay at the Naumi was such a delightful experience. The staff offers an outstanding service. The breakfast is super (shy to say it but try the scrambled eggs: wow!) The design of the suite we had was A-1. The only thing that is not A-1++ is the location. Right it is in the backyard of the legendary Raffles (not too bad). But the action is more or less a 20 minute walk from the hotel. However, Singapore is so safe that one can walk it at anytime. Go for it, you will not regret!

Reviews.Title: “Great location, cool roof pool, comfiest bed....but not "luxury"”
Reviews.Author: MrsSchausi
Reviews.Content: Naumi is in the perfect location. You can walk to most areas of town in about 20 minutes and you are literally across the street from Raffles, which has a lovely complex to walk through, especially in the evening (after a Singapore Sling!). The pool area on the roof is also pretty cool, with great views to the Marina Bay hotel, overlooking raffles, padang square and the twinkling lights of the financial district - a small pool area, but normally you have it to yourself, so no problem. Great to enjoy a cocktail or beer as the sun sets. The hotel is a "design" hotel - so some cool features - but the rooms have a bit of an ikea thing going on - and as it is now a bit bashed about you can see the fittings are not top quality. Some of the surfaces are stained where glasses have sat too, so my first impression was that the room was dirty, which is was not. The bed we had was large and very comfortable, but the aircon was very loud and we were woken on several occasions by a loud noise we attributed to our neighbour's shower. The management did look into this when we complained, and it did not happen again during our stay - so perhaps fixed. The room was a decent size (I'm told quite big for singapore, but I live in Dubai so the room felt small!), but the ceilings being low-ish (style of the building) meant it did not feel spacious - nor the hallways. Spacious is luxury. The breakfast is ok, nothing special. If you have ever stayed in a 5 star hotel in Dubai, breakfast a Naumi looks very thin. Fruit, pastries, omlettes cooked to order, but essentially the same thing everyday, got bored pretty quickly....again, nice, but not "luxury". My husband and I have been spoiled by some amazing hotels around the world, so for us, Naumi comes no where close to a luxury hotel. We thought it was cute, good service, comfortable, great location and cool pool, but we felt it was overpriced and over-promised on the "luxury", which it really is not. In fact, it reminds me of the spanish budget chain NH Hotels - only with a fantasy price tag, that we stupidly paid. I would recommend this hotel if you can get it at a discount, but not if you pay the full price.

Reviews.Title: “Short but very very sweet!”
Reviews.Author: KevANDHayley
Reviews.Content: We only stayed 1 night but it definitely left you wanting more. While it may not be one of the ore obvious choices in Singapore, I’d definitely recommend this to anyone that likes that more personal touch that often big hotel’s fail to deliver. From the moment you walk in through the front door you really feel like you’re in a very modern trendy boutique hotel and decor/furnishing in the rooms carry this feeling on perfectly. The beds are huge, and all the little amenities and touches are perfect. Make sure you find time to go up to the pool on the roof if only to take a few pics. Location is great for getting around as nothing is every that far away in Singapore, and I’ll definitely stay again next time I’m in town

Reviews.Title: “A lovely friendly small hotel and we would stay there again in a flash!”
Reviews.Author: FinChapman
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met up with my cousin from the UK in Singapore so we needed 2 bedroom accommodation and Naumi had it all. My cousin had her own well appointed room and bathroom. Everything looked and was clean, the staff; from Housekeeping to the Concierge, were all very friendly and welcoming. There was huge TV and a DVD player so after a hard day shopping we could put our feet up, have a chat, a drink and watch a bit of tellie. All the touristy districts were within walking distance, or a short taxi ride at most. The taxi drivers had a bit of difficulty finding the Naumi Hotel, but saying Seah St (with the correct accent!!!!) did the trick.

Reviews.Title: “FABULOUS”
Reviews.Author: Tan23
Reviews.Content: The Deluxe Room was very spacious with a separate living room and bedroom. Great amenities provided, TWG teas, Nespresso coffee, Molton Brown toiletries, soft drinks and cookies too. The pillows were a little soft but that is just personal preference. The staffs were simply FABULOUS, and the service is always genuine. They really make you feel welcome. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “most awesome bed”
Reviews.Author: xl8887
Reviews.Content: a hidden gem in the city! have stayed here twice previously and im so in love with the bed. decided to book it as a surprise stay-cation for my boyfriend and although its a wee bit pricey, i think its well worth it. the hotel managed to be stylish and well-designed, aimed at the trendy crowd without being pretentious. the bed is definitely the most comfy ive ever had. room was a good size, immaculately spotless, rain shower was great, loved their complimentary drinks in the mini fridge, the cookies as well as the ipod dock. the room was so serne you wouldnt believe you re in the heart of the city and the rooftop pool offered a great view, although it was a little small. the only thing i wasnt really satisfied with was the poor selection of breakfast, compared tot he other hotels ive stayed. eggs were good though! definitely recommend!

Reviews.Title: “The quiet storm in Singapore envelops you in quality, beauty and ultimate attention to detail.”
Reviews.Author: joseph Swiss
Reviews.Content: Room and facilities: We stayed for 5 nights at the Naumi in one of their deluxe rooms, which in most hotels would be called a suite at 50 sq metres. All amenities are available and all are high quality. We loved the TWG teas, soft drinks, massive fridge and Nespresso…. All complimentary and no fuss. Flowers changed or watered daily….Bath robes, slippers, lovely bath gels, creams and conditioners, spacious walk-in rain shower, freestanding bath in the huge bathroom. And did I say, the most comfortable king-sized bed ever! We tried out the fitness room (three top rated new devices for cardio nuts), the weights room (high quality dumbells, combo-gym and extremely clean) and the yoga room. All three of the rooms are compact, top class, and again with full attention to detail, the Naumi provides bottles of water, fresh towels and changing facilites in situ. The reception/breakfast/foyer/lounge area is discretely scented with jasmine and lemongrass and sounds oh-so-quietly of cool jazz, and 80s soul which plays positively on your mood before you leave for your city visits or business activities. The secret jewel in the crown is the roof top bar/lounge infinity pool. The decked area on the rooftop is a relaxing oasis even at 6.45 in the morning. Great views over the city, never crowded, always sparkling clean, well above any traffic, and whatever the weather they manage to keep the water temperature at the perfect cooling level. Location: The Naumi hotel is centrally located on a quiet road just one side of the famous Raffles hotel, so has the sweet-spot combination of being near everything interesting but without the noise and crowds, and no fights for taxis. Service: P-E-R-F-E-C-T-! I can’t commend the fantastic Naumi aides enough for the service. They are genuinely interested and attentive to every need. They are dedicated listeners and seem to have a sixth sense to know what your desires before you even think of them. Special thanks to Paul… we won’t forget your tips for a real Singaporean breakfast at Suntec city on our first jet-lagged morning. But special thanks to all the staff, you were all great and a credit to the Naumi philosophy of service. Not liked: NOTHING, WE LOVED IT ALL! I can’t think of anything bad at all. Our saddest moment in Singapore was when Paul ordered our last taxi to take us to the airport after 5 days of bliss. We will absolutely be back.

Reviews.Title: “My son wanted to live here!”
Reviews.Author: mishaNYC
Reviews.Content: Chose this hotel based on the ratings here in TripAdvisor... Made the right decision! Great location, great rooms, great staff & the view from the pool was just amazing! Will definitely go back next time we visit Singapore :)

Reviews.Title: “Well Serviced Elegance”
Reviews.Author: Luke_England
Reviews.Content: I have had the opportunity to stay in many highly rated hotels however Naumi has bettered expectations more than any othe hotel visited. The hotel is a design lovers paradise with stylish practical rooms! Apart from a slightly lacking range of tv channels and slightly slow wifi I am very impressed!

Reviews.Title: “Probably One of the Best Small Hotels in the World”
Reviews.Author: sp1953
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel after reading the positive comments on Trip Advisor and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is understated from the outside and very stylish on the inside. We stayed in a deluxe room, with views over the City and it's own kitchenette, complementary soft drinks, a good range of teas and a proper coffee maker. The living space was well appointed as was the bathroom. The bed was heavenly and ensured a great night's sleep. The hotel has a small roof terrace with an infinity pool and good views of the City. The hotel is well located, opposite Raffles Hotel and near to Tourist Buses and MTR (underground) We had an 11.30 pm flight so extended our check out time. What really makes this hotel is the staff who are genuinely friendly and knowledgable about the City. I need to especially mention Jasmine who was just brilliant and looked after us so well. When it was time to leave a taxi had already been called and it's the only hotel where I have stayed where the staff wave you off like old friends. If you like small boutique hotels this one is a must

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally friendly”
Reviews.Author: David039
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Naumi for four nights in January and would certainly stay again. We liked the comfortable suite, with kitchenette and free minibar, the staff who couldn't have been more helpful, and the rooftop pool with views. Breakfast was good but expensive at S$25.00 each, as was laundry (four quid to wash your socks, cheaper to throw them away and buy more!). We weren't troubled by noise in any way. Taxis charge an extra S$2.50 if called to the door, or it's two blocks walk to the taxi stand and MRT. There are some good cheap restaurants next door for lunch and dinner serving chicken rice etc, but no easy breakfast options near the hotel. Free internet was a plus point.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel, great facilities and service, friendly staff.”
Reviews.Author: zenloy
Reviews.Content: The Naumi is a boutique hotel - well located in the CBD across the road from Raffles and close to Suntec convention centre and shopping. Two MRT stations are nearby making travel to Orchard Road, Chinatown etc very easy. The staff were friendly and the service excellent. The room was very well furnished. We especially appreciated the relaxed and quiet atmosphere of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I will stay again”
Reviews.Author: VinceChoo
Reviews.Content: Very well appointed rooms with attentive service. Excellent location and within walking distance to many local sights. Modern, clean furnishings with free in-room WiFi is a big advantage compared with other hotels. Rooms are spacious and decorated with modern furnishin, great workspace, free mini bar and equipped with a kitchenette.

Reviews.Title: “Boutique and personal”
Reviews.Author: sharonbaby
Reviews.Content: I normally travel with my husband and son on our holidays but this time my parents came with us. My father wanted to stay at Raffles Hotel (normally where he stays) but it was well out of our price range. It took some convincing for him to stay at a boutique hotel but he was not disappointed with our choice of Naumi. Upon check in we had a couple of hic ups but they were sorted out quickly. Nothing major. We had booked two rooms, both were on the 5th floor. - perfect. My parents were surprised to find that they had no toilet paper in their room (probably taken by previous guests) but the staff quickly replaced this. Their room was the smallest on the floor but it was still very lovely. My family had booked a two bedroom, which was ideal for us. Allowing my son to have his own room with t.v. and his own bathroom. We enjoyed all the facilities that were on offer - great gym. Relaxing by the pool in the afternoon was also enjoyable. The rooms are modern, staff are extremely friendly and helpful. My father did some business while in Singapore and used the hotel facilities. All parties were impressed with the hotel. Thank you to the chef who cooked the best eggs at breakfast,. We all really enjoyed our stay and wished that it had have been longer. If ever in Singapore again, Naumi will be our home away from home. P.S.- where do I buy those pillows? Loved them.

Reviews.Title: “A very hip hotel in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: lakeroyd
Reviews.Content: I've been staying at the Naumi hotel for work trips to Singapore for the past year and am NEVER disappointed. The place has a really hip vibe and the staff are all sooooo friendly and really can't do enough for you. From the hair straightener in the room, to the free cookies and the breakfast that is A MAZING. I came back this weekend for a fun weekend in Singapore and chilled by the pool that has the most stunning view of the city. STAY HERE!!!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way...”
Reviews.Author: Marvin13_10
Reviews.Content: Ok, I don't write reviews but this I will make an exception for this place. Naumi hotel is in my opinion the best hotel I have ever stayed at. I am in the military and have stayed in some nice places before but this hotel takes the cake and ice cream too. From the minute my girlfriend and I checked in, it was pure heaven. The staff is extra friendly and courteous, they helped with our check in and just made us feel at home. Our room was HUGE, and you won't find a better deal anywhere in Singapore I guarantee. The rooftop pool was romantic, the food was good and healthy. I would personally like to thank the man from Germany for his directions and advice on where to go, the bartender Sugar, he makes a mean mojito:), the Singapore staff ladies who gave me advice on how to treat my lady to the sights and sounds of SIngapore, and to Paul for his guidance and just making us feel like we were wanted there. If you and a loved one want to get away and just enjoy that great country, Naumi is where it's at. I hope they never expand, they provide a very personal feel to your stay there and when I go back, they will get my business every time.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel with impeccable service”
Reviews.Author: LuceliaRodrigues
Reviews.Content: The Naumi staff were great and really made me feel at home. The hotel gives great attention to small details making you feel special. The deluxe room was very large and beautifully decorated. I'll definately be back next year.

Reviews.Title: “Best Looking Hotel Ever!”
Reviews.Author: drpsojpr
Reviews.Content: We spent our Wedding night at Naumi and the experience was great! Staff were friendly, attentive, didn't require us to tell them our names etc. They were also very accommodating to our requests. We loved the design of the spaces, the uniform, the floral motifs, the colours, furniture N the infinity pool! The bed and pillows were a little too soft for us though, so sleep wasn't fantastic. Perhaps there were other options for pillows but guess we were too enthralled by the hotel to ask.

Reviews.Title: “We all just loved the Naumi!”
Reviews.Author: MoochAdelaide
Reviews.Content: It is the fantastic staff that make all the difference at the Naumi. From our initial welcoming greeting to our final checkout, all of the staff went out of their way to be wonderfully accommodating ,helpful and especially friendly. We were looking forward to our stay at the Naumi and were certainly not disappointed. The rooms are spotlessly clean, fresh smelling and very contemporary. The bed is "heavenly", super soft, big and extremely comfortable .The bathroom is large and modern and we loved the great amenities. The Naumi helped to make our trip to Singapore our best ever!!! We would love to come back to Singapore in the near future and will most certainly choose to stay at The Naumi again .A big thank you Naumi.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great service, beatiful decoration”
Reviews.Author: ricardoap
Reviews.Content: For the ones who like small boutique hotels, Naumi is a luxury, very well decorated hotel with a good location and a very personalized service. Rooms are very big and clean and people are very friendly and always very concerned about you. The breakfast is one of the best I ever seen and the pool floor its amazing.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, attentive staff, well appointed rooms”
Reviews.Author: mr6826
Reviews.Content: We were in Singapore for a post Christmas shopping trip. I have been many times for work and would normally stay at a major hotel. The Naumi was in a perfect location and run by thoughtful attentive staff. The suites are wonderfully appointed and apart from the ready transmission of street noise (the suites are on low levels) and TV noise from adjacent rooms, the hotel is without fault. The infinity pool on the roof provides one of the most stunning swimming experiences in the world. The breakfasts were very post-modern (outside of an ashram or a health farm, I have never seen vitamin pills provided at a breakfast buffet, let alone freshly squeezed celery juice)

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel,great staff”
Reviews.Author: Darlingites
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Naumi for 4 nights and would happily have stayed longer.Our suite had no view but that really didn't matter as we were out most of the time,the air-conditioning was fantastic(necessary in Singapore)and the free cold drinks were welcome after a long day of sightseeing.The hotel is close to the metro and several bus stations so transport is easy - there are even motorised rickshaws outside Raffles Hotel.The staff were very friendly and helpful - Emy and Paul were especially attentive - making our stay one to remember.Hopefully we will return one day both to Singapore and to Naumi.

Reviews.Title: “Nirvanah in a country that attempts to be Shangri-La”
Reviews.Author: kid_at_heart17
Reviews.Content: Singapore has got to be one of the best countries to live in - so safe and so clean. With that said, the many choices of hotels, restaurants, and shopping malls will leave you breathless. Which is why I made sure that with my family and partner in tow for the New Year holiday, I wanted it to be really special. And Naumi Hotel was just that. My niece commented that while it was smack right beside the Raffles Hotel, Naumi Hotel (even though unknown to many of the cabbies) was far from the services of other standard hotels. It was personal, so to speak. It did not echo of in-your-face amenities. As you walked into its ordinary looking but pleasantly smelling lobby, you wouldn't think that the bedrooms were to die for. We booked for 3 corporate suites but got one upgraded to a luxury suite and when we (a party of 6) saw our rooms, we were flabbergasted at the size and amenities here. The 10 storey building houses only 40 rooms (which meant about 5 rooms to each floor) so you could imagine how sprawling the rooms were. Even breakfast was not elaborate but a seriously healthy meal. Although the rooftop pool was small, Singapore was not designed for swimming R&R. The Molton Brown toiletries were there to pamper you. The closets were so huge that you probably could move in with all your clothes for the year. There's a Nespresso and TWG tea at your pleasure. And the drinks in the minibar are on the house. With a smiling face and so much personal touch - from the time you check in to the the time they say adieu, I highly recommend that Naumi Hotel be on everyone's list when they come to Singapore. Raffles is just beside if you want luxury goods and Bugis junction is at the back if you need to shop for moderate items. And the whole Seah street (and its surrounding arteries) are surrounded with great food shops that you don't need to go far just to have a great Singaporean meal. Just a friendly advice - ask a card from the front desk so that you can show it to the ignorant cab driver who hasn't heard of Naumi. Can you blame them? They probably have never been close to real Nirvanah even if they live in a country that attempts to be - ShangriLa!

Reviews.Title: “Great end to 2010, great start to 2011”
Reviews.Author: Jeffcech
Reviews.Content: I particularly like the fact that i can do light cooking in the room. Room is spacious with great service from Naumi staff.

Reviews.Title: “Attractive gem exceeded my expectations.”
Reviews.Author: Jill4675
Reviews.Content: Stayed twice in November 2010 at the Naumi Hotel, for several days each time. The small size and intimacy of the hotel appealed to me and I was not disappointed. Staff are young, energetic, friendly, and professional. Restaurant and bar were very good. Breakfast was very well set up and served. Beds are very, very comfortable. The rooms are very large and roomy but have only king-sized beds, so two people have to share or one can sleep in the living room, which has a very long and comfortable sofa, that is so long it could almost sleep two end to end! There is a large kitchen area with microwave, sink, full-sized refrigerator (with complimentary soft drinks), and "pod" coffee maker. Bathroom is modern, large, with large and convenient shower stall. Tubs are free-standing. I made good use of the complimentary Internet access (WiFi or you can plug in). The rooftoop infinity pool is very nice and there is a wonderful view at night. I recommend the Naumi for anyone who prefers a smaller hotel but does not want to sacrifice on luxury. The location, across from Raffles, is walking distance to Metro stops and shopping. I recommend joining (it's free) Small Luxury Hotels of the World, which affords some advantages at the Naumi and other member hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Brilliant hotel - service is amazing”
Reviews.Author: DiscerningSydney2000
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Naumi in Dec/Jan 2010/11 with our 3 kids, we had a two bedroom suite. This hotel is a real gem, it is in a fantastic location, the rooms are very nicely appointed and are a good size. The beds are very comfortable and the rooms have nice furnishings.
