Where the Naumi really comes into it's own is in the little details and the service provided by the staff. Nothing is too much trouble for the staff and they are amazingly responsive - it really shows up the difference between a large and boutique hotel. There are a number of other nice touches like free wi-fi, complimentary soft drinks and decent size towels at the pool and in the rooms (why do so many hotels get this wrong?). I would highly recommend this hotel for people travelling for any reason, leisure, business, single or family - it's great.

Reviews.Title: “excellently run small hotel in great location”
Reviews.Author: expatsam
Reviews.Content: nicely understated chic little hotel tucked right in on a quiet street behind raffles. the ground floor / lobby is functional rather than glamorous, but the staff are really exceptional, the rooms are very good, and the rooftop infinity pool is a nice secluded spot to escape & recharge when you're overwhelmed by the city. if you want vegas glitz and to do battle with a thousand other guests, go stay at the MBS, but if you want to feel like one of the very few staying in a quietly excellent hotel in a perfect location, the naumi hits the mark.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden gem”
Reviews.Author: h10wek
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had a wonderful stay in Singapore and this hotel played a big part of that. What a hidden gem, it was formally known as the Majestic and the locals do not know it as Naumi but I'm sure they will very soon. It's reputation will grow and grow. The rooftop infinity pool was a big selling point for us and it did not disapoint. The view was amazing. The hotel is next door to Raffles and close to lots of good restaurants and shops. The staff were very friendly and welcoming and nothing was too much trouble. They were available at all times of the day for advice and information. The Naumi is a very trendy hotel and the decor is top notch, but we still felt at home and very relaxed. I wouldn't hesitate to recommend the Naumi to anyone, it is a bit pricey but we thought it was well worth it for the quality of the surroundings and the excellent staff.

Reviews.Title: “Cant go wrong with Naumi!”
Reviews.Author: AgeOfAquarius
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Naumi after having read about its style quotient in some travel magazine and our decision was helped further by the many favourable reviews on TripAdvisor. It turned out to be everything we expected, with many more unexpected pleasures. It's a great little hotel, very stylishly designed with an eye to detail to ensure their guests' comfort, in a very quiet but convenient location next to shopping malls, food courts and restaurants, backed up with very friendly and personalised service. The biggest plus for us was the very large Deluxe room in a 'suite' format with separate living and sleeping areas that can be curtained off, giving one the right balance between space and privacy. The very comfortable king-size bed have a range of pillow options and they ensured we got only hypo allergenic pillows and comforters as I'm allergic to down. The kitchenette area comes fitted with tea/coffee makers, microwave oven, toaster, a large fridge, and a range of stylish crockery and cutlery; there's an ironing board with iron, yoga mat and umbrella; plenty of wardrobe space; a bathroom the size of a small bedroom with separate shower stall and free-standing bathtub, with slippers, robes, hair dryer and Molton Brown toiletries. The higher floor rooms have fantastic views of the Singapore skyline, and an evening spent by the poolside overlooking the dazzling Singapore night lights can be as exciting or as romantic as one wants. The hotel has a lobby level bar and coffee shop, and a small gym and yoga room. No huge lobby, no glitzy shops and restaurants, just quiet and cozy luxury. And all this at a price that's cheaper than suite rooms in 5* luxury hotels in Singapore. We couldn't have asked for a better deal and look forward to our next say at the Naumi.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!!”
Reviews.Author: Candylicious10
Reviews.Content: Me n partner celebrated our 1st Anniversary n had a great time..Rm was upgraded to a luxury suite upon arrival..nice surprise!!Very spacious n we enjoy e infinity pool except that we waited so long to be able to swim at night but e private function is like taking forever till we fell asleep.haha...neverthless its a highly recommended boutique hotel for those seeking quiet n privacy:)

Reviews.Title: “Skyline view superb as with everything”
Reviews.Author: double07
Reviews.Content: Ideal location with Raffles round the corner & Orchard road a short walk away. Super comfy bed with pillow menu. Lots of good toiletries, bathrobes & slippers. Breakfast to suit all tastes. Such friendly & helpful staff. definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Something different”
Reviews.Author: Halimbalo
Reviews.Content: The formerly Metropol Hotel has completly been rebuild and is now a boutique hotel. It is stylish and unique in a new and modern sort of style which you either like or you dont. The service is good but all in all the last bit is missing by whatever reason. The pool is overlooking the Raffels and more then just nice.

Reviews.Title: “Blame my self for too much to expect”
Reviews.Author: JoeS2608
Reviews.Content: Almost countless traveling to Singapore and staying at many hotels in Singapore : Four Seasons, Fullerton, Ritz Carlton, Grand Hyatt, Sheraton, Mandarin, Pan Pacific, Hilton, and newly opened St Regis etc, well to be honest I never heard Naumi Hotel before. Reading the reviews about the hotel has made me decided to try it. Beside, it also close to Raffles Hospital so it will only take few minutes getting there from the hotel. When I told my wife that I'll be staying at Naumi this time around, she kind of puzzle : What ? Where is it?. Telling her that it near Raffles Hotel and Raffles Hospital make my choice sensible to her. I made online booking, and checked in on Friday, November 19, 2010 for 2 nights at Premium Room. Well, nothing much I can say about this 32 m2 room (the area mostly taken up by the bathroom with standing shower) and the hotel facilities, except that the people serving me are quite friendly. Of course it is very quite. It's a very small hotel and there are only 40 rooms. I supposed to check out on November 21, 2010, but something came up so I have to extend my stay in Singapore for another two nights. Because of my first impression about the hotel, actually at first I decided to move and look for another hotel for my next stay. But somehow, while looking for another hotels, I happened to visit Naumi website and when I checked the room availability for November 21-23, I can get Corporate Suite (60-70 m2) at a cheaper rate that I have paid for my previous room. Well, thinking of the troublesome of moving to another hotel that I might have, then I cancelled my previous plan to check in to other hotel and decided to stay for another two nights at Naumi. I got no complain about the room. My complain is when I am about to check out on November 23, 2010, since I had an evening flight on the way back to Jakarta from Singapore. Therefore, I asked the lady in charge if I can get late check-out until say 3 o'clock. Of course I know that the standard checking out time is 12.00. But hey, its been also countless of time not only in Singapore but also in the other part of the world, the hotels allow us - the guests - to have late check-out whenever it is possible. 1 o'clock is the standard, 3 o'clock is something that you can thanks for the gratitude and 5 o'clock is not something that I never had as late-time check out. Once again, provided there is no guests coming in and will be using your room. Of course the lady told me that Naumi's standard check-out time is 12.00, and there will be new guest coming in and using my room, so I have to leave the room at 12.00. I told her that I know that is the standard check-out time, so I ask "What is the best you can do for me to have a late check-out as my flight is in the evening". The same answer she gave me: "Sorry, there will be a new guest coming in and will be using your room. So the best I can do is for you to have late check-out at 12.30, and you can leave the luggage with us and you can use shower room at the Pool". Of course nothing much I can say, except that I have to check out at 12.30 at the latest. And that is what I did, exactly at 12.30 I checked out and left the hotel. However, I might have to tell you that before I left the hotel, I checked again the hotel website and when I tried to make online reservation for checking-in on November 23, 2010 at the hotel, hey...there is Corporate Suite available if you would like to check-in on that day. It might or might not be the same Corporate Suite that I stayed for 2 nights, as I don't know exactly how many Corporate Suite the hotel has. But why shall I care? They don't even care to give me another 60 minutes or 90 minutes for the room which I still need, especially when no one is going to stay at the room on that day. I blame myself for too much to expect, but don't blame me if that is the only thing that I remember after my 4 nights staying at this hotel

Reviews.Title: “unique and contemporary, fantastic service”
Reviews.Author: missydio
Reviews.Content: Naumi Hotel is a beautiful, hip boutique hotel in Singapore. It is in a great location with local restaurants within surrounding streets and the lovely Raffles Hotel next door. Naumi have created beautiful, functional rooms with personal flair. The decor is divine and having a living room and mini kitchenette in even the standard rooms is brilliant. When travelling with children you sometimes need to unwind at your hotel and at Naumi this is very pleasurable. We even were able to borrow a DVD and swing the huge TV screen around so it was facing the bed, all snuggled up with some nibbles we bought in Orchard Street with a lovely glass of wine. The fridge in the room was a great advantage, as was the Nespresso coffee machine and complimentary drinks. Unfortunately the day we put aside to lie by the rooftop pool it rained so we didn't get to use it but hope we will be back again to Singapore to do it another time. The breakfast was delicious and loads of choices. The TWG tea was lovely, as was the coffees. The only slight downside was the seats and tables aren't geared for groups so we were all spread out for breakfast. More set up for couples and business travellers. The staff were fantastic. The service we had was very attentive and they went out of their way to help and advise. Thank you to all. Hope we are back to visit again soon.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent luxurious Boutique hotel with top design”
Reviews.Author: kitzcharly
Reviews.Content: We booked the Naumi hotel by searching a small , centrally located hotel in Singapore in the internet.Our expectations were topped, finding an excellent designed luxurious Boutique hotel with a lot of remarkable extras nearby the Raffles hotel.Our deluxe room on the ninth floor had a sleep and living room,a fine bath room with a massageshower and a tub,a kitchen with nespresso machine etc., big flatsreen tv , ipod docking station and a fine view to Singapore.Best of all is the pool on top of the building in the 10th floor overlooking the Raffles,where you can regenerate after a hot day in Singapore sipping a drink or having a snack served by the pool service.Staff is friendly and competent,an excellent breakfast is served in the lobby where you can get also drinks at night.Even the Naumi is not cheap it is good value for the money,should we ever come back to Singapore the Naumi will see us again.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulously quirky, charming hotel.”
Reviews.Author: pgtv
Reviews.Content: It is just a different experience. From the cool reception area to all the charming and helpful people all round. Felt so different from the usual impersonal posh hotels.

Reviews.Title: “What a slice of heaven this hotel is!”
Reviews.Author: pialba
Reviews.Content: Wonderful stay in the Naumi - just behind Raffles where we wandered for a Singapore Sling in the Long Bar. The room, bed and staff were amazing. Just made us feel pampered! It is close to a fantastic modern and traditional shopping and eating mall. Great Singapre location. We are first time visitors and will be back for our Europe stopover next year.

Reviews.Title: “Very luxe and trendy”
Reviews.Author: SRAROUNDTHEWORLD
Reviews.Content: Sumptuous and luxurious and impecabble attention to detail. Great bed and fantastic shower with Molton Brown amenities. Mini bar soft drinks are complimentary and replenished daily with as much bottled water as required. Nice although fairly small affinity pool. Staff extremely attentive and service was fantastic. Located opposite Raffles hotel and quite close to Bugis metro station. All in all a lovely, trendy and highly stylish hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great rooms. Brilliant Service!”
Reviews.Author: genecrowe
Reviews.Content: The hype around the Naumi had given us very high expectations. I am pleased to say that this fantastic hotel exceeded them all. The Corporate Suite was spacious, spotless and very cool. The service from the friendly staff was outstanding. Nothing was too much trouble, and they went out of their way to help us. The central location is great, the rooftop pool is stunning and the decor throughout is funky. Great hotel. Can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome stay i ever had!”
Reviews.Author: dianna_nhm
Reviews.Content: Hubby and myself have enjoyed our 1 night stay at Naumi Hotel, Singapore. Naumi is very accessible from places that you wanna go and visit. A very quiet, sophisticated and lavish hotel that i have ever stayed in Singapore. Definitely thumbs up! Staff service bring alot of joy and laughter to us as well. Even my hubby says that this is the first time he feel so cosy in a hotel that he's gonna plan again for our next hotel stay with Naumi again. yay! ^_^

Reviews.Title: “Boutique Hotel with in key location with Great Rooftop Pool”
Reviews.Author: TWBuddy
Reviews.Content: The Naumi felt like a small personal hotel with all the benefits of a major hotel. The staff were more than friendly, and helped us book tours, taxis, and provided directions and were always available, even late at night. It's located close to the historic Raffles hotel and a short walk to the waterfront areas. We really enjoyed our stay in this hotel, and always felt like we had personal attention. We paid a little extra for a corporate suite and this gives you a very generous one bedroom apartment, so plenty of space to spread out and a good coffee machine to come back to. Check out the view from the pool, and especially at night!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel”
Reviews.Author: chrisplusros
Reviews.Content: After a 5 night visit to the Naumi hotel in October I can easily understand why this hotel has received constant praise and 5 star reviews. I completely agree that the service is outstanding, friendly and personal, the hotel is in a perfect location with modern well equipped rooms and has a great infinity roof top swimming pool. I would like to give special thanks to the barman ‘Suga’ who produces Michelin star standard cocktails, his Mojitos are world class, and if it is too early in the day for cocktails don’t miss trying their ‘Nuwara Eliya Op’ black tea said to be the champagne of teas. I look forward to making The Naumi my home away from home on any future visits to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Homey,nice hotel, you feel at home in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dani1971
Reviews.Content: good 4 star hotel, sometimes lacking details, could score better if offered a better bar/food selection.

Reviews.Title: “Feels at home! Only Better!”
Reviews.Author: Aneehcuy
Reviews.Content: The hotel was fantastic, tho it's tucked right at the corner of Seah Street, quiet and cozy. Each of the staff were friendly and nice. Having the corporate suite for a small gathering was the right choice made. The suite was fully equipped, great amenities, spacious room and especially the wide kitchenette was more than overwhelming. The complimentary internet wifi access definitely come in handy when in need. The view and ambience we get from the infinity pool was pleasant and serene. My friends and I definitely loved the room and we will definitely go back for future short getaway from the hustle and bustle of the city. The hotel really give in to your privacy, we weren't disturbed by any of the staff as long as we maintain our noise level. Overall, a great hotel and good value for money!

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique hotel experience!”
Reviews.Author: Zhiling
Reviews.Content: The moment I entered Naumi hotel, I was greated by an atmosphere of serenity, friendly staff and soft trendy music. The hotel counter was simple and modern, equipped with an Ipad that hotel guests can use, there is no need to wait long for check-in. The room that we stayed in was a deluxe room which really went beyond our expectations! There was a fully furnished kitchenette with a Nespresso machine, wine and champagne glasses lined up neatly, toaster and a wonderful complimentary mini bar that made the experience even sweeter. The room decoration was tasteful, simple and trendy with lush carpets, a comfortable sofa couch and a revolving TV that gives you a choice of TV watching in the comforts of the bedroom or in the living area. The staff in Naumi also pays great attention to detail. Music was being played before we checked in and it was refreshing to be greeted with chill-out tunes. The bathroom was another surprise as it was huge with a roomy bathtub and beautiful counter stocked by Molton Brown. I also have to mention that Naumi has great facilities too. The gym, yoga room, weights room and the beautiful rooftop pool deck with the infinity pool and view of raffles city, marina bay etc. Naumi definitely sets the bar higher for boutique hotel experience. It's a home away from home, an amazing getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Simply the best!!”
Reviews.Author: Australian-Nomad
Reviews.Content: I've travelled all my life and over the last 25 years or so I've spent well over 1,000 nights in hotels around the world ~ mainly on business. My recommendation is based upon experience and I am not easily impressed. That said however, I'm delighted to state that every aspect of our stay at the NAUMI was brilliant! My wife was treated like a Princess and every single staff member we met became true friends. The Naumi is a boutique hotel and as such they have the opportunity of gettng to know each of their clients on a personal basis. It's a real pleasure to be remembered by name and to have small matters like the breakfast wait staff remember whether you prefer coffee, tea or fresh juice ~ by the way you MUST try the Singapore Breakfast Tea they serve. It's absolutely superb! If you are looking for a small luxury hotel in Singapore, somewhere special, with staff that really do care and excellent rooms that have been extremely well thought out then we absolutely, unreservedly recommend the Naumi. It was brilliant! As a very well seasoned and blase traveller I can honestly say that I was completely blown away by firstly the excellent staff with thier positive, friendly attitudes and then secondly by the style, presentation and finish of the hotel and rooms. Whoever designed the rooms really does understand the needs and preferences of the regular traveller. Very well thought out.. Our final view of the Naumi as we were driven back to the airport was to see three staff waving us off as old friends do. We'd like to pass our special thanks on to Emmie, Nicko, Mohan, Rahul and of course Peter Wong, who all made us feel so welcome. It should be noted that I am usually very cynical and quite critical about hotels. After so many years of travelling I often feel that many of the "big named" hotels under-perfom very badly ~ this is not the case with the Naumi. I've never written or commented so highly about any other hotel that I've stayed at, but then again we've never been treated as well as we were at the Naumi. We will return and we will be telling all our friends and business associates. Thanks to all Naumi..!!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Boutique Hotel - My hotel of Choice in Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Nomadfre
Reviews.Content: Usually where I stay for business, but turns out it was perfect for a family stay. They have a two bedroom suite option with a full-size refrigerator. Customer service was excellent as usual and the included breakfast was limited but good. The property is near shopping, good food and a decent base for seeing the sights or a short taxi ride to the business district. Small Luxury Hotels is definitely the way to go as they provide you with most of the same benefits as Starwood with a lot more diversity and properties around the world.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent services”
Reviews.Author: misty068
Reviews.Content: We had our event organized at Naumi infinity rooftop pool, the event went well we received good feedback from our guests (i.e. Delicious Food, friendly & good customer services, cosy setup & good atmosphere) We wish to thank Naumi (esp. Mr Mohan ) for excellent services. We felt that we are well taken to every detail during our stay at Naumi and during the entire event. We are impressed of the customer services & all staff without fail greeting us & always have big smile on their face. The spacious deluxe room give us space to breath in, relax & enjoy soaking in the deep long bathtub. The room is clean & very comfortable. Lastly Congrats & Well done for your achievement!

Reviews.Title: “The prettiest hotel I've ever stayed in...”
Reviews.Author: Kateroddy
Reviews.Content: The prettiest hotel I've ever stayed in, this hotel has all you need to relax after a long day in the city after work or play. Staff are very helpful, food is good and the decor is beautiful. I'd highly recommend this hotel - it's a real change from the corporate hotels around town.

Reviews.Title: “The best of both worlds: like staying with friends, but with luxury boutique treats thrown in.”
Reviews.Author: dirkdewilde
Reviews.Content: The best of both worlds: like staying with friends, but with luxury boutique treats thrown in. Not cheap, but it's hard to find better personalised service (you get to know the staff by name and they know you by name), excellent location (next to Raffles) and style (contemporary luxury) for your money than here.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury in a convenient location”
Reviews.Author: irina154
Reviews.Content: fantastic boutique hotel very close to Raffles , Marina Bay Square and the architecturally amazing Marina Sands complex.. This intimate design hotel has it all!

Reviews.Title: “An absolutely first class hotel”
Reviews.Author: DavidpH
Reviews.Content: All staff amazingly helpful and polite. Located within walking distance of main city attractions. Free wi-fi in room and throughout hotel. I have no negative comments to make.

Reviews.Title: “Absolute Perfect Hotel, with amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: Michael188057
Reviews.Content: I can only highly recommend this hotel! The staff is extremely friendly and helpful and anticipate the wishes of their guests!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: SINWENG
Reviews.Content: Located right in the heart of Singapore, every single thing was convenient. be it transport, food, shopping, it was all within a 5 minutes walk. with the location being such an advantage, we would expect the service and quality to be on par. feeling hot and exasperated from the humid weather and carrying bags of luggage and cakes for my party, the service staff greeted me with a smile that brighten up my mood. they brought me to the room. the staff were very friendly and volunteered to carry our stuffs. we went "WOW" after entering the room. it was HUGE, COMFY and it was equivalent to a house instead of a room. we had specially requested for a wii and it was being set up for us with 2 games to choose! it was really fantastic! and since the purpose of us booking a luxury suite was to hold a birthday party, we were pretty much worried that the staffs/receptionist would be rather hostile and denied our guests into the room. but we were wrong! in fact, rather than being petty about having more than 2 guests in the room at any one time of point, the staffs even brought our friends to our room delightedly! of course, with such a meticulous group of service staffs, and fantastic room. everything in the room were complimentary and not to mention the shampoo and bath were BRANDED! the lighting could also be set to your perfect atmosphere. be in dark or bright. what more can i say. the party ended with a HUGE BANG!!! =)

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Place”
Reviews.Author: benscan
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a month while i was working in Singapore and couldn't endorse this place highly enough. The staff at The Naumi try so hard to make you feel at home and are really flexible on policies and protocols to ensure that your stay is the best it can be. I LOVED: The bed. The Shower The pool. The inroom coffee maker. The TV channels and DVD player. iPod Dock. The Gym. Inroom yoga mat. Staff. The location. I HATED: Downstairs bar (but plenty of places to hang out around the hotel in the Raffles district). Breakfasts (but this can be common in boutique Asian hotels). Laundry was a bit expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Service, comfort & location”
Reviews.Author: jeanette001
Reviews.Content: Service was excellent, Comfort was first class and location was central to all places of interest

Reviews.Title: “Mother”
Reviews.Author: sandgroperdownunder
Reviews.Content: Perfect Mother daughter getaway. Attention to detail in every way. The staff were so attentive and helpful and made our stay very relaxing and enjoyable. We stayed the first 4 nights in the executive suite which had everything you need except lighting a little dark. The last night we enjoyed the ladies floor which was lighter and brighter with extra amenities such as cleanser and toner to add to the special touches this small luxury hotel offers. Great location behind the Raffles and behind the Naumi recomended spa and spa.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden treasure offering an understated luxury experience”
Reviews.Author: Beamer23
Reviews.Content: This is not your mainstream boring hotel and no wonder not many taxi drivers know where it is. Of all the hotels we have stayed in over the world, this has got to be our best experience. The level of luxury offered is just right, the staff are very friendly, helpful and most importantly discrete. It is a good idea to find out where the hotel is before you arrive as you will most likely have to explain to the taxi driver - the taxis don't generally have a GPS, so even if you give them a street address, they don't know where it is. It is however very close to very known landmarks. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “City Breeze at Naumi”
Reviews.Author: coverzed
Reviews.Content: As in the past, i've stayed at a lot of chain hotels. Many Ritz, JW, Hilton etc. But now, i really found the great experience to be more exciting and amazing place. My flight directly flied from Singapore and just stayed 3 nights at this hotel. The room was absolutely amazing. The pool, food and service were good experience in itself. I am honestly to say that this hotel is the superb I've ever been before.

Reviews.Title: “That Increasingly Rare Combo”
Reviews.Author: kfastuff
Reviews.Content: The proliferation of boutique hotels over the past decade has produced mixed results. Those who are suckers for aesthetics (present company included) gravitate to these experiments in accommodation, and often times that's exactly what they are: exercises in form over function. You so badly want to like the place, but flaws in design render the place less than ideal. A bathroom out of Wallpaper Magazine is alluring to the eye...until you find that the shower is such that water spills out onto the main bathroom floor. Or the bed, whose linens you want to smuggle home in your luggage, offers all the comfort of a rec room beanbag. Or the front desk/concierge personnel -- decked out in fabulous ensembles -- have zero inclination to be of help, and lack the courtesy to offer so much as a smile. There are hotels -- many of them of the old guard -- that offer great service. And there are quite a few who give great attention to design. Naumi is the rare place that accomplishes both beautifully. Naumi has only 40 some-odd rooms, which allows the staff to give you personalized attention. Singapore is a foodie's paradise and the front desk was enthusiastic to recommend their favorite local, off-the-beaten-path food hawker centers. Public transportation in Singapore is world-class, but bus maps are difficult to find. No worries: a concierge will give you not one -- but two convenient routes -- to the Botanical Gardens in the more remote/expat area of town. The rooms are, in a word, sexy. Amber back lighting behind the headboard gives the room an attractive hue. The bathroom, even in the smaller Deluxe/standard 52sqm rooms, offers plenty of space (and Kiehl's products...yar!). iPod deck, LCD TV, DVD player, work desk, power A/C, etc. Naumi's rooftop pool is every bit as inviting as it appears on the website. And the location is an easy 3-minute walk to the City Hall MRT stop. ...and Naumi knows all of this. I secured a reasonable "early bird rate" in the spring for my 3-night September visit back when Naumi was a relatively unknown quantity. When I contacted the sales manager about securing the same rate on my return trip a couple of weeks later, my request was met with incredulity. She suggested that she had no idea how I got that initial rate to begin with and couldn't come close -- and you can't really blame her. As the 40-room Naumi continues to establish its reputation as the only 5-star quality boutique accommodation in an expensive hotel market, I suspect the days of locking in anything under $315 SG are over. Still, given the exorbitant rates you'll pay elsewhere, the Naumi might still be your best bet -- even at the higher rates.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel - comfortable, friendly, professional with nice little touches to make the stay very pleasant.”
Reviews.Author: SVLT_London
Reviews.Content: A lovely boutique hotel - rooms are 'contemporary chic', location is good, staff are friendly. It's refreshing to have complimentary elements like free wi-fi internet, soft drinks, Nespresso coffees in a day and age where hotels seem to charge for every small additional exttra. The Kiehls shower gels and shampoos are also fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Great venue, friendly staff, wonderful service and superb ambience”
Reviews.Author: CreditcardWorry
Reviews.Content: Highly recommend this superb boutique hotel in Singapore. Just wish it was a little more affordable to be able to stay personally. Its in a great location and while the rooftop pool isn't very big its got fab views and is lovely to relax in after a day's work :-)

Reviews.Title: “Definately coming back! :D”
Reviews.Author: Devon87
Reviews.Content: Where should I start about Naumi...? The impeccable hospitable service? Or the designer furniture & room decor? Or the well-equipped kitchenettes? Oh wait, there's the fluffy comfy king-sized bed where your body just sinks in as you doze off to a good night's slumber... And I could go on and on about Naumi for ages.. Let this exclusive luxury boutique take you through an un-forgetable journey full of lovely delightful surprises! Special thanks to Melissa, the patient guest relation officer for taking special attention of my requests and the guy (didn't catch your name

Reviews.Title: “Great location.............”
Reviews.Author: Purplepanda17
Reviews.Content: My partner and I stayed at Naumi hotel in April of 2010 for two nights. The room was very big with a separate living area and lovely decor. It was next to Raffles so a great location but none of the taxi drivers knew the hotel so we had to keep telling them to go to Raffles and then walk round the corner. The website says that the mini bar is complementary and it is but beware the only has a limited number of soft drinks (with refills at a cost) in it and not alcohol, juice or food. There is however a Nescafe pod coffee machine in the room that was complementary. The pool and deck had a lovely view but limited service for drinks etc. All in all a great experience although it wasn't cheap and don't be tricked by the mini bar

Reviews.Title: “Ninth day of happiness”
Reviews.Author: t-puk
Reviews.Content: Had the corporate suite over a weekend for party, turned out to be a good choice as the living area has a long sofa to accommodate everyone. TV console has only 2 sockets so it was a hassle to switch between the bose dvd player and X-Box. Had to get staff to help out with the connecting of equipment a few times but was done very quickly. Not sure why there's no LAN cable for internet, only wi-fi connection so can be slow at times. Noticed certain "hidden" areas ie underneath furniture were quite dusty. The wooden lever panels that separate bedroom from living area is a functional feature. Front desk was reluctant to issue 2nd key card, do not understand why. Still a nice place to stay, but personally I prefer the deluxe suite which feels more spacious even though it's slightly smaller.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely”
Reviews.Author: sarah.farnan
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel this month and loved it and it felt like a second home. We were warmly welcomed to the hotel and were checked in very early considering we were 6 hours early for check in. The room was nice and trendy with everything you could need. It does need a little spruce up but because everything else was so perfect i totally overlook this. The staff are lovely and so friendly and helpful. The breakfast was lovely and a perfect start to the day, The bed was so comfortable probably the better than my own bed. The pool area is amazing and we will always remember the views. We will so be staying there again if we are ever lucky enough to go back to singapore

Reviews.Title: “A little charmer”
Reviews.Author: exprimer
Reviews.Content: The best part about this hotel has got to be the lovely rooftop infinity pool, where we got a sneak preview of the breathtaking sight to be anticipated on 9 August, Singapore's National Day. It was an extraordinary complement to our weekend 'staycation' at the beautiful boutique hotel. That said, there're so many other parts that we fell in love with - the nespresso machine, premium TWG tea, fluffy pillows and sheets, awesome bathtub and rainshower... Definiteiy an experience to be had in person. :)

Reviews.Title: “I loved it! I want to go back.”
Reviews.Author: tziambra
Reviews.Content: I booked the Naumi from splendia.com for one night in Singapore on our way to Phuket and I could not have been happier with the choice. The hotel is centrally located - close to the Raffles, in a little side street. It is definitely a boutique hotel and not a big chain hotel. The lobby is very nice, it also serves as the breakfast room and/or bar. I really liked the white sofas and turquoise decor. The check-in was very easy and the staff was friendly, as expected. I believe we got an upgrade so the room was almost a suite, very nicely designed. There is a little lounge with a flat screen tv that swivels around and faces the bed. There was a little kitchenette in the closet, we did not really need it but I assume it would be useful for a business traveler. There was also a nespresso machine in the room with complimentary capsules, a nice touch. The best part was the bed, it was by far the most comfortable bed I have slept on in a hotel. The bathroom had a shower and a large bathtub and it was full of Kiehls products. The breakfast was cute, but certainly not the type of buffer fair you get in another hotels in Singapore, i.e. Mandarin Oriental etc. Nonetheless, everything was freshly prepared and did not miss anything but it was more in the "Western" style, eggs, muffins, cereal etc. Another plus to the hotel is the really cool rooftop pool that they have. We did not manage to go during the day but it was a nice spot to have a drink at night with a view of the skyline, we were lucky because it was not unbearably hot that night. Lastly, I filled out the feedback card before leaving, complimenting the hotel and their staff and a few weeks later, I received a personal thank you email. I found it thoughtful. Overall, I enjoyed the feel of the boutique hotel and it felt like a sanctuary in a busy city.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury amenities, but not a luxury hotel”
Reviews.Author: smk78
Reviews.Content: Stayed here recently and had a nice enough experience. The location is great and the amenities are indeed luxury (Nespresso in-room, TWG teas, Kiehl's bath products). However, I agree with the other reviewers who have commented on the hotel's wear and tear. While Naumi splurges on amenities, it skimped on construction - poor quality and cheap materials. The stone floors are stained, damp spots and patches on the ceilings, scuffs on the walls and lobby furniture, and IKEA-like cabinets in the room. It exuded a "this won't stand the test of time" feeling which shouldn't be the case in a place charging US$300/night for a room. If it were half the price, I'd have no complaints, but for this price I expect higher quality and attention to all the details, not just the ones that can be replenished on a daily basis.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: annajustine
Reviews.Content: I stayed one night at this hotel on my way from London to Sydney. I arrived at 9 30 am. The deluxe room I had booked was not free until 2pm. I asked for anything they had available, and they offered me a huge suite for 150 Singapore dollars more, which i jumped at. The suite was huge and comfy. The staff friendly and excellent and the roof top pool beautiful. I thought the price and area were just right too. Breakfast good and included.Excellent!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing haven in the city”
Reviews.Author: JanetEMc
Reviews.Content: After a busy holiday in Europe we arrived at Naumi jetlagged and weary. We were immediately greeted at the door, promptly checked in and escorted up to our Deluxe room by the friendly staff member. The room was extremely comfortable and stylish, and had a lot of attention to detail that made it a cut above other hotels we had stayed in previously: Nespresso machine, free wifi, mood lighting including a floor-lit night light, free (soft drink) minibar. From the infinity lap pool on the roof there is a great view over Singapore. The location is also very good - right across the road from Raffles Hotel. On the next street (Purvis Street) there are lots of restaurants, the Chijmes complex is also very close by. Staff were also very helpful and friendly throughout. My only - very minor - complaint was that a speaker playing piped music in the hallway outside our room could be heard from the bed overnight when we turned the air con off. We had a fantastic time and plan to stay at Naumi for any future Singapore visits.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Nice rooms and beatiful infinity pool! Disappointing Bar.”
Reviews.Author: stephenblevins
Reviews.Content: Hotel is close to everything you need, rooms are very nice and beds comfy. Infinity pool has amazing views of the sity and the best quality of this hotel is their great service. Really Really Impressed!!! Only thing that I didn't like was the bar was in fact their lobby where the front desk was. It has no ambiance and no full time bar man (you just ask for a drink and they will happily make it). The drinks are decent but expensive and with the ambiance you wouldn't want to stay there. They are so attentive with a genuine smile that says "we know that you're paying a lot for this hotel so we want to give you the best treatment possible". And they do. Amazing Service. When I checked out at 1pm, my flight back to france was'nt until 1030pm that night so I kept my stuff with them and walked around town for a few hours. When I got back they asked me if I wanted a shower and recommended that I take a swim in the infinity pool while waiting for my flight later that night (This is AFTER I checked out!!!) I was so impressed by the level of service even AFTER I paid the bill I couldn't believe it. They prepared a shower for me with everything I needed (shampoo/soap/towell etc) and told me to enjoy the pool until I was ready to catch my flight. Unbelievable. I will definitely come back to this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “I was upset when I left because this hotel is just the BEST”
Reviews.Author: MrAndMrsFoodie
Reviews.Content: I fell in love with this hotel. I was upset when I left after staying 3 nights with my wife a couple of weeks back. Naumi is a lovely boutique hotel just behind the Raffles hotel so is very centrally located and about 5 mins walk to the City Hall MRT. I love the hotels' facade and its quirky interior design. When we arrived early morning, my wife was not feeling too well, and the hotel did everything they could to get us a room quickly so she could rest. We were made to feel so welcome by the staff especially by Lizette, Paul and Shuga (not sure if I have spelt his name right) and a couple of others who were on the night shift. We had the bottom of the range room, but it was great. The bed was huge and so comfortable, large wide screen tv, free soft drinks in the mini bar (yes FREE), free local calls, a nespresso coffee machine, good quality teas, a great and powerful rain shower, a yoga mat and much much more in the room. I particularly loved the infinity pool at the top which offers great views of the singapore city skyline in all directions. Breakfast was really nice too and everyday is a champagne breakfast day which is included. They'd even made arrangements to show the world cup games. Just up the road from the hotel when you turn right out of the hotel are some good local restaurants where you can eat some really good Chicken Rice for SGD 3.50 or Mee Goreng for SGD 1.20. We'll definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “stylish luxury and great service”
Reviews.Author: neilsonparc
Reviews.Content: My wife and I LOVED our stay in Naumi. We stayed in a Luxury Suite - the room was large and stylish and the deep soak bath and personal steam room were awesome! The pool was a little small, but had great views over the Marina area of Singapore. For a more complete review go to www.neilsonparc.com

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: cindersw01
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for 2 nights with my husband on a recent trip to Singapore. We booked a standard room and to our delight were upgraded to a 2-bedroom suite upon arrival. The room was well designed and spacious (probably thanks to the upgrade). The in-room office setup and free wi-fi were very convenient given that my husband needed to do a bit of work during our trip. I found the rooftop infinity pool a great place to wait out the hot afternoon sun; the views were lovely and the circular lounge chairs perfect for curling up with a good book. One of the features we most appreciated about the hotel was its location -- it was very centrally located and walking distance to many of the tourist sites around the city. When not walking, cab rides were short and we also had the option of taking the metro, the nearest station being only 2 blocks away. I would definitely recommend this hotel to anybody looking for a boutique hotel experience while visiting Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Delightful Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: broomsmelbourne
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the hotel for 4 nights and found the hotel to be an excellent personal hotel with impecabble service. We requested a deluxe room and found the room to be spacious and clean, the only downfall was a problem with the airconditioning. The staff attempted to rectify the problem and another room was offered. The staff were attentive, friendly and extremely helpful in all respects. we would not hesitate in recommending this hotel, it is centrally located and in a quiet street. Breakfast was very good and a reasonable variety was offered.

Reviews.Title: “A hidden surprise...!”
Reviews.Author: B_Earl56
Reviews.Content: We had never been to Singapore before and were on a bit of a budget as we were heading up to Phuket after the 3 days we spent in here. So we were wanting a simple, not over the top, and central location. Right across the road from the Raffles Hotel and walking distance into town...it was perfect. We got in on the Jetstar Perth - Singapore 5.30am flight, we got the early check in which was money well spent as we just went up to the room and crashed for 3 hours. The delux rooms are amazing! Highly recommend for couples. We had a look at some of the other room categories as I'm in the travel industry, and there is something here for everyone. From the 2 bed suite for families to the luxury suite for people not on a budget. If you are expecting a huge Balinese spread for breakfast with hundreds of different foods, you will be disappointed. But it is all you need - cereal, fruit, pastries, eggs, and specialty foods each morning. The roof top infinity pool view is amazing - look out to the city. Stunning.

Reviews.Title: “Weekend paradise with best service!”
Reviews.Author: Ameripean
Reviews.Content: The staff at Naumi don't know the word "no". I organized a surprise birthday party for my husband with 15 of our closest friends. We held it at the roof top infinity pool (with an incredible view of downtown Singapore). The staff were only too happy to attend to every request we had related to the party. Unlike a lot of other hotels in Singapore, this one really delivers top notch service that is genuine and with a smile. We stayed in an executive patio suite which was amazing! The bed is heavenly and we had the best night sleep in weeks. The patio is huge and is relatively private. Bathroom is massive with a standing shower, full tub and wonderful amenities (the lotion and soaps were lovely). The room comes with a mini bar (complementary soft drinks), microwave and Nespresso machine (with free capsules). You could definitely host a party in the patio suite. We had actually planned on doing that but being at the pool was so much fun that our group never came downstairs. Naumi is an oasis in the middle of Singapore. We cannot recommend this hotel strongly enough. The service is exemplary and is genuine (not forced like so many other hotels).

Reviews.Title: “break coming back from europe”
Reviews.Author: lucy255100
Reviews.Content: Great welcome,booked a suite so both had our own room.Loved the excellent toiletries,linen,coffee machine.Infinity pool to die for,great bartender,Suga. Breakfast amazing never seen champagne before on the buffet for the start of the day.Staff just helpfull and happy. Close to the train for whizzing into Orchard road. Would go back and recommend this place to anyone,oh yeah very quiet. Elizabeth and Katya edwards

Reviews.Title: “Naumi: Not perfect but pretty darn good”
Reviews.Author: jeff415
Reviews.Content: Having grown tired of corporate hotels in Singapore, I decided to try a boutique hotel this time. Naumi is in a fanstastic location, which along with the general design of the place is why I picked it. I wasn't disappointed, and I can't imagine going back to the Grand Hyatt again after such a nice experience - albeit not perfect. Pros: Design concept, rendered consistently throughout the hotel, is lovely. Rooms are exquisite, both luxurious and practical for the most part. Staff is attentive, cordial, and helpful for the most part. Checkin and Checkout were both at strange hours (typical Singapore!), and it was very nice to have a great customer experience at the start and at the end of my stay. I loved the room. It was large, the amenities by Kiehls were quite nice, and the audio/video system had been well thought out. An ingenious 360-degree extra large flat panel Philips screen enables entertainment in both the living area and the bedroom. Another nice touch: you can pull the curtains around to separate the living from the sleeping areas, including a 90-degree, rounded corner. Effect: luxurious. The rooftop pool and lounge area has a stunning view onto metro Singapore. Glass infinity pool with a view - what's not to like? Cons: Food was unimpressive. I had several meals delivered to the room, and was consistently nonplussed. A shame considering the location of the hotel is in an epicenter of good, inexpensive local food. Instead of eating in, simply go out into the neighborhood for great local food at very reasonable prices.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: logesoz
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed this hotel, the small touches were wonderful, good location near Raffles City and literally across the road from the famous Raffles Hotel - went for an overrated, overpriced Singapore Sling there, which could have been avoided, probably been better to stay at Naumi Bar which looked delightful. The staff are lovely and the attention to detail in the rooms added to the lovely experience. (bath robes, coffee machine, free wi fi, free bottled water and soft drinks, bedside radio with Ipod dock etc) While the standard breakfast was OK ( a bit pricey for what it is), I would recommend going out for brekky or as we did - go to Market Place downstairs at the Raffles City Center, an excellent little supermarket with fresh food etc and pick up some yogurt, fresh fruit, muesli etc. You won't go wrong at this hotel I highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fab Fab Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: PCWee
Reviews.Content: I sprung the surprise on my wife that we were going for a short holiday in Singapore. She sounded a little sceptical when I told her that we were going to be staying at Seah Street... Our initial impression was positive... a lovely scent wafted through the lobby when we arrived. The airconditioning was a lovely respite from the searing heat outside. Because we were early, we were told that we needed to wait for an hour while the service staff got the room ready. The person helping us offered to send our luggage to our room while we went out for lunch. Once the hour was up, and when we returned, we were whisked to our room... It was fabulous! Wifey was impressed with the size of the room, and with the decor. I had mentioned in my booking that we were there to celebrate 13 years of marriage... and then thought nothing of it. Within 30 minutes of checking in, we heard the doorbell go off.. and were presented with a warm chocolate cake! Well presented, warm plate and went fantastically with a Nespresso-brewed coffee and TWG Singapore-spice tea.. Yums! The service was consistently good through the duration of our stay. Other than the mandatory shopping trips, we also chose to hide in our room, going through 3 VCDs of the movies we'd been meaning to catch.... All in, it was a lovely experience... a wonderful 'staycation'! We truely felt like we were in a different world from our everyday Singapore lives. One thing I reallly need to mention is the wonderful mattress and pillows in the room... we found sleep to be easy, and of exceptional quality (perhaps it's because our kids weren't around to bounce in them while we were sleeping? :) lol) I would encourage a stay at the Naumi... it's going to surprise you!

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Hotel in Singapore - Without a Doubt”
Reviews.Author: Shawn_Zoe
Reviews.Content: This place is awesome. Location is just opposite Raffles Hotel and Mall, and also very close to the City Hall MRT station (underground train). Although centrally located, the hotel is on a very small side street that does not get much traffic at all so it is very quiet. Walking into this hotel, I knew I had made the right choice - classy modern decor, great vibe, friendly staff. I stayed in the Corporate Suite room. Never have I stayed in a room so large (and I believe it is unusual for Singapore hotels to have big rooms). The room had two large plasma screen tvs, automatic controls for everything, modern clean decor, king size bed etc. As I was staying here for a romantic getaway with my wife for our one year wedding anniversary I was very picky about a number of things and had organised a limo service, large bouquet of flowers for the room, bottle of wine, massage, and seafood on arrival for my wife (she deserves it all!). The staff at Naumi organised this efficiently and without any problems. I consider this to be one of the best hotel experiences I have had - in a nutshell, I would describe it as a 5 star luxury boutique hotel experience, but at a reasonably affordable price (i.e. thousands less than the well known luxury hotels). I booked through Trip Advisor & Expedia and saved lots. Other brief comments: the gym is small, which means enough stuff for cardio but if you use weights, don't bother. The water pipes banged and made some noise but not enough to wake us up - they are apparently fixing this. There is a toy museum just up the road. Shopping centres everywhere. The rooftop infinity pool is cool.

Reviews.Title: “Gem in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: MMF3759
Reviews.Content: I could not have been more pleased with the Naumi Hotel. The service was fabulous. I had left 2 oil paintings that I purchased in Vietnam near the passport control area. I realized that I had forgotten the tube that held the paintings AFTER I got to the hotel. They called all over the Singapore Airport trying to help me find the paintings. They went above and beyond the call of duty. I did not find the paintings (very sad, still!) but we were upgraded to the one bedroom suite which was decorated like a sophisticated New York apartment, but BETTER. The complimentary water, internet and beverages were appreciated. The bathroom was simply fabulous. The huge white soaking tub was something I did not expect in this hotel. I loved it so much I took photos. I already told two of my clients who travel to Singapore all the time all about the hotel! Can't wait to come back.

Reviews.Title: “Trendy Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Orbiton
Reviews.Content: My husband and I travelled to Singapore for a business/leisure trip. We thought we would try staying in a boutique hotel for a change. We tend to always stay in the big hotels. It was a very nice change. We spent a week at Naumi. The service was very personal and the staff could not have been more helpful. Naumi is an old building refurbished and it has been very tastefully decorated. The rooms are very comfortable and furniture, bathrooms trendy. Location is ideal. It is away from the hustle and bustle of Orchard Rd, but the train is only a minutes walk. Raffles is just across the road. The reception area is very welcoming and doubles as the breakfast room and is also the bar at night. Very well done. Breakfast selection is great, with all juices freshly squeezed and gourmet selection of food. Once again, nothing is too much trouble. Special requests for breakfast are gladly accommodated. For the down side. Because it is an old building, there is quite a lot of noise that obvioiusly comes from shakey water pipes or whatever. Also, the room was spoiled when we opened the blinds. We looked onto the grotty back lane and all the garbage from the restaurants. That was a bit of a turnoff. Hence, we didn't open the blinds for the rest of the week. I would strongly advise requesting a room on Seah St side if you are going to stay there. The view isn't great, but it is better.

Reviews.Title: “Best service in Singapore where staff are so warm, friendly and cheerful”
Reviews.Author: bambino96
Reviews.Content: We had heard so much about this small luxury hotel, we wanted to experience it. we were so pleased we stayed there as we found the staff were so nice we felt very sorry to leave them behind. The rooms are very spacious too and the pool on the top floor, though small is very special.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: JoanAnthony
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Naumi Hotel in Apr of 2010 for one night. My stay here was truly memorable. The service was fantastic, courteous,polite friendly true Asian hospitality. The rooms were amazing and very spacious with modern fittings.The gym was at down but this truly is a five star plus hotel that I highly recommend. As a frequent traveller this is the type of place that I need for business as well as for leisure. A fine property. One of the best in Singapore and very nice buffet breakfast. The staff is the best!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “naumi... your personal luxury hotel at its best”
Reviews.Author: LizNmArK
Reviews.Content: We were on our way home from Japan to Perth and thought... hmm a few days in Singapore would be nice, besides we've never been there and we like to splurge once in a while... ...And there's Naumi! Do you remember when you search for that perfect accommodation on the net and you find all the pretty pictures but when you get there, the hotel looks nothing like the pictures. Well Im happy to tell you, with Naumi, what you see on the website is what you get in real life... and more! Located smack bang in the middle of the city, next to the Raffles in fact, lies the perfect oasis for travellers yearns for that personal touch. A quick 20 mins taxi ride from the airport (take East Coast Parkway) and you'll get to this funky hotel where you'll be treated like kings and queens. The staff are friendly, the hotel has funky, simple, modern decor. there's only 5 suites on 1 floor so you'll be guaranteed peace and quite. The deluxe room's size is MASSIVE, with 'oh so comfortable-it feels like you're sleeping on cloud nine' king size bed, living room with flat screen tv, fridge, nespresso coffee machine kitchenette. The bathroom is also massive in size, with bath tub, shower, robes and slipper. My favourite is the roof top infinity edge swimming pool, where you can lounge about and gaze at the city skyscrapers, also you can bring your portable room phone up there to order some drinks and nibbles. Breakfast is a wonderful affair in the morning as they have everything your heard desire... Across the street, you can go to the Raffles hotel's shopping arcades as well as having singapore slings and throw the peanut shells on the floor at the Long Bar. If you walk to Suntec you can buy ticket for Hippo Bus tour or the duck tour. The Hippo Bus tour is the best, its a hop off hop on bus with 2 major lines: herritage (red) and city (yellow). and dont forget to board the singapore flyer.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: kiwicrusader
Reviews.Content: After trusting Mr and Mrs Smith about Naumi, we are so glad we did. Fantastic hotel with great service, rooms and roof top pool. The only -ve would be the pool bar was not open, would be great if it was. Overall very impressed with the hotel and will be going back to stay again in 2010. Thanks for a great stay

Reviews.Title: “A great, centrally located small hotel choice”
Reviews.Author: IPGHK
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 3 nights in a Deluxe room on the 6th floor, facing the quiet main street. We were looking for a centrally located, small hotel with some character at a reasonable price, & the hotel delivered superbly on all of these. I would definitely stay here again; it's a great choice if you're an independent traveler & staying for a few days or more. The hotel has a terrific location, within walking distance to major museums, good bars/restaurants & shops. It's on a quiet street right around the corner from the Raffles Hotel. It never took more than 5 minutes for a cab to arrive (easiest if you ask the hotel to call you one, especially during rush hour or rain). It is not a particularly cool or hip place - I wouldn't expect to be hanging out in the lounge here - but it is a quiet place with some character & good service. The rooftop pool is not huge but is nice, with a big open view & great relaxing chairs to hang out on. The front desk staff were friendly & relatively efficient. However, we did have one problem which irked us - we asked for a cab to be called 30 minutes in advance for us, but when we arrived downstairs expecting the cab to be there, it hadn't been called, so we had to wait another 10 minutes for the cab to be called & arrive, which made us late for our appointment. The major positive for us - & the reason why we'd stay again - was our room. It was really spacious, with a comfortable living area separated from the bedroom by a large flat panel TV that swiveled to either side, a large separate work area with professional multi-line phone, & a good-sized bathroom with separate shower stall & very nice, huge new soaking tub. There was plenty of light, & the a/c was easily controlled. There was a nice bar area with sink, Nespresso machine, very nice tea selection, hot water kettle, toaster, burner & even a microwave oven & large refrigerator/freezer! All hidden nicely in the closet. My only gripe is that there was no minibar - only a few sodas in the fridge. We would have preferred the fridge be stocked with more usual items (water, fruit juices, crackers, wine, etc). There was also a yoga mat in the closet, which seemed brand new when I used it. I wouldn't have minded if I had had to stay in this room for a few days or more. The doors are a bit thin so you can hear people talking in the hall, as well as people talking loudly from within their rooms, but I suppose you could just ask for a room farther away from the lift. In general, our room was very quiet, & we slept really well with the curtains drawn. The bed was really comfortable, & it was nice to have a full down body pillow as well! Plus the plentiful Khiel's toiletries were really nice. I should also mention that the complimentary wifi as well as the high-speed internet connection I used through the phone worked perfectly. Overall, a pretty good experience at a decent price.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GippslanderTraralgon
Reviews.Content: A friend, who had formerly stayed at the Ritz-Carlton, recommended this hotel for the great service, rooms and location. He certainly wasn't wrong! From a location point of view, this hotel is only a short walk from City Hall MRT, Bugis Village, Esplanade Theatre and Arab Street and consequently,heaps of good restaurants. The attention afforded to us at check-in was excellent and the rooms were sensational- very roomy with all facilities including a kitchenette, ipod docking station and 2-way large screen television. This hotel certainly doesn't "nickel and dime" its guests with free soft-drinks and Nespresso coffee. The breakfast was oriented towards "healthy alternative" with lots of fruit, eggs and even "scrambled tofu". The fitness centre was on 3 levels and, while only small, I had no difficulty with access to the treadmill twice per day. The infinity pool was absolutely sensational with great views of the city from a rooftop location. A late checkout on my final day was provided without difficulty. One real point of difference with this Hotel was it was not impersonal and staff wanted to help!! Because it is only about 40 rooms, staff wished to engage in conversation and provide assistance.

Reviews.Title: “Our 2 nights”
Reviews.Author: Pitty17
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the fabulous Naumi Hotel on the way home from malaysia. It is indeed the best place we have ever stayed in and the staff relly looked after us. Definatel will be back

Reviews.Title: “Bookmark Naumi Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Christopher R
Reviews.Content: Researching for a new hotel in Singapore on Tripadviser I discoved Hotel Naumi.Sadly I was only able to stay overnight but it was memorable and I will return.The rooms are excellant - large,modern,clean,fresh + enjoyable.Internet is complimentary - Yeah! Breakfast in the lobby is cool and fun.The pool is small but a great view accross the city to the Casino development.No boutique hotel there though.Naumi is a sophisticated small hotel that will suite those with an eye for detail and comfort.Terrific staff who helped me find several locally made full size flags at short notice.Located close to the back of Raffles its a great location for shopping,transport,restaurants,bars etc.I wish I had found this lettle gem 20 plus hotels earlier.Can hardly wait to return.

Reviews.Title: “Stay at the Naumi!”
Reviews.Author: LondonHotelAddict
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Naumi hotel for three nights in March and it's brilliant. Our room (a deluxe) was nearly a suite - with a separate living area, mini kitchen and large bathroom (with Kiehls products- lush!) The decor of the hotel is fabulous. Really cute floral designs in the bar/reception area and the rooms. The rooftop infinity pool is definitely worth a visit - what a view! And a great way to cool down after a busy day.  The location of the hotel is great - 10 min walk to the nearest MRT station and an easy walk to Clarke Quay for loads of bars and resturants. It's right behind Raffles too, so you can pop in there for an (overpriced) Singapore Sling.  If you want a cool un-touristy bar nearby, go to Loof on North Bridge Road - just round the corner from the Naumi. It's a rooftop bar with comfy seats and laid back music playing. Nearby Chijmes is great for a drink or dinner - lots of restaurants and bars and v pretty to sit in. The only bad thing I have to say about the hotel (and it really is small) is the terrible sickly perfume they pump out into the reception area/bar/outside the entrance. It was so strong that I had to hold my breath every time we entered/left the hotel to avoid feeling queasy! But that aside, I'd heartily recommend this hotel to visitors to Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: tecknobili
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 3 days in February what a lovely hotel only 40 rooms but very modern ,we were room only so cannot comment on the food but the staff cannot do enough to make your stay a pleasant experience. We were invited to cocktails by the management on our 2nd night and this took place on the rooftop veranda round the infinity pool with canapes and choice of drinks free of charge for 1 hour to meet the management and staff. Location opp Raffles Hotel and near all public transport .

Reviews.Title: “Excellent boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: Yasmina9
Reviews.Content: Words fail me in my description of this hotel!!!!!!!!! The rooms were beautiful, the bathroom was heavenly! I always got up earlier than expected so i could enjoy my time in the bathroom. The staff were excellent! Very friendly! It was a nice surprise in the Singapore CBD and am looking forward to going back!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: MikeyMikeAus
Reviews.Content: Probably one of the most comfortable beds I've ever stayed in, friendly staff, good location and one of the nicest pools in Singapore - an infinity pool on the 10th floor looking over Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: SaraRoberts
Reviews.Content: On arrival we were upraded to a luxury suite, which was n amazing last few nights to our holiday. The night before we had treated ourselves to a night in the Shangri-La hotel, which was nice, but Naumi just suited us so much more. Our luxury suite was beautifully lighted and so big, with great ammenities. The pool on the roof is perfectly sized for a quick cool down, and the view from up there is out of this world, especially at night (photo attached). The staff were always on hand, and delivered lovely cocktails to us by the pool. We checked out by noon, but our flight was not until 11pm. We were given he luxury suite again to freshen up before our long trip home. I have stayed in a few of the best hotels in the world, and this is high up as one of the best I have stayed in yet. The hotel is right beside Raffles Hotel and close the boat and clarke quay, and Bugis. Perfect for shoping, sight seeing, eating and drinking. Oh and definetely the best bed I have ever slept in.

Reviews.Title: “Computer says no”
Reviews.Author: Pattyhewes
Reviews.Content: Big disappointment- what I am sure was a funky hotel a few years ago now seems a bit shoddy and neglected. Our room looked like it had been given a very superficial servicing (e.g. clearly a child had stayed there at some stage and the menu/hotel information was covered in scribbles), the doors and walls were battered and looked like they could do with a re-paint and the food served by room service was horrible. But the real "winner" probably came when we discovered suspicious brown stains on a 'clean' towel and were told by blank-faced management that it wasn't anything to do with them as the towels are serviced by a contractor. An unbelievable approach to customer service.

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel...”
Reviews.Author: Santonle
Reviews.Content: Naumi is a great choice for those who like modern hotels. It's clean, well designed, and provides great amenities. The rooms are so comfortable with all the thoughtful touches, such as nespresso machines, plates, and cutlery. The internet is free! The only downside is the breakfast which was extremely lame in comparison to other 5 star hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: TheGrimesReview
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 6 nights after spending a week in Langkawi (check Casa del Mar review). The hotel is in a great location close to Raffles, shopping, metro, quay's etc etc. We stayed in a deluxe room and this was excellent more like a suite with separate bedroom, bathroom, lounge and kitchen area. Liked the espresso machine touch and the free soft drinks in the fridge. Two great flat screen tv's and a lovely bathroom. The hotel also has a rooftop pool which although small is perfect for a late afternoon dip with sun loungers and what a view across the city skyline. Singapore is easy to get around with metro taking you to most areas buy the three day tourist ticket well worth it. Taxi's are pretty cheap and very easy to find and worth using at night. Also used the tourist bus one day which was worthwhile. Visit Robertson quay rather than Clarke quay better places to eat and drink and not as expensive as clarke quay which is tourist central. Also try the City Space bar 70th floor of Swissotel which is 2 mins from Naumi what a view. Overall a great time in Singapore and the hotel is a great base to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Very Memorable”
Reviews.Author: Pao_888
Reviews.Content: My cousin booked a room at this hotel as a wedding gift last October 2009. Upon hearing the good news my wife and I decided why not hold our solemnization rites on our hotel room, thankfully the staff of Naumi were very accommodating on my request to rearrange the living room for solemnization, because I’ve heard that they cater for such kind or requests. On the wedding day upon arriving at the hotel, the Naumi aide immediately handed over the key cards and escorted us directly to our room. When we entered the room the staff asked me to check what they have prepared on the living room area. They rearranged the area and placed the table on the middle and scattered rose petals all over the place. They have arranged the place in a manner that it is simple, romantic yet sophisticated. I will give them “Two Thumbs Up for that” The room is spacious and has a modern feeling, and the king size bed is very soft indeed. The bathroom is so elegant and the shower area has a built in sauna, and the tub is big enough to fit two people sitting on each side. The mini bar has a microwave oven, nespresso, fully equipped with wine glasses to spoon and forks, at the bottom part of the bar is a wine chiller that I think can hold around 9 bottles of wine. When our guests entered the room, all that I can hear is “Oh My God” “WOW” “AMAZING” which made me feel good. After our solemnization we went to the rooftop for a picture taking. We were so amazed and I have no doubt that it has the best view of Singapore. It has an infinity pool and lounge chairs where you can relax while looking at the fantastic view of the city skyline. It is very irresistible to take photos on the rooftop. After a very long day we have accommodated more than 20 guests on our suite, I’m very thankful to the very spacious living room. My wife and I were very thankful to my cousin for sponsoring this luxury suite, and as well as the very accommodating staff of Naumi for adding your personal touch of luxury which have exceeded our expectations.

Reviews.Title: “hotel with a twist”
Reviews.Author: meringo
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a nite in Sep 2009. I arrived in Singapore very early, something like 8am and they kindly provided me the room right away, I have to give two thumbs up for that. Check In process was fast and painless, which was good for me because I was still so sleepy from the overnite flight. Room size was good, the room price was inclusive of mini bar and coffee (which was from espresso machine by Nespresso) and some welcome cookies. Wifi access is also inclusive, which makes everything seems more convenient. Hotel toiletries are from Kiehl, which was pretty good. However, the hotel's towels are pretty rough, which I found it strange, they should put attention to this detail as well. They do have a very very tiny gym room and yoga room, at most 2 people can work out in each room comfortably. More than that will be quite cramp. The pool is located on the top of the building, since this is a boutique hotel, don't expect a lap pool. Nonetheless, the pool length is not too shabby, you can't exercise in it, but you definitely can swim few strokes inside. Or alternatively, go up to the pool area in the nite time just to have a drink and lie down on the lounge chair, the view from the top at nite is pretty fab! Check out process again was also very efficient.

Reviews.Title: “Nice but not a luxury hotel as they claim.”
Reviews.Author: arkom
Reviews.Content: Arriving at the hotel there is no entrance for taxis to drop you off, so they drop you off across the street and there no bell boy to with your luggage. The lobby of the hotel seemed to be bare and uninviting but overall check in was fast, but when brought up to our room it was not ready, not really a big problem but waiting for about 30 minutes can be a bit frustrating. When we got into the our room, we found out that the extra bed we paid for was just a bed sheet and blanket on the in room sofa, which it self is hard. The other chair in the room although looks comfortable is surprisingly hard. The room seemed outdated wood floor was worn but overall decent size and bathroom was big, the bed is probably the best thing about it, very comfortable. Complimentary mini bar is drinks only, no alcohol or snacks as one previous person said, and even tough we paid for 3 persons we were only given 2 bottles of water. If you do use extra glass cups be sure to rinse it cause I don't think they wash them. On our first night there there was a party on the roof top pool, not a big deal but the music was so so loud we could her it from the our room until about 1 AM, our TV was also broken, we called the front desk about 7 PM to tell them, it wasn't until about 10 PM until they got replacement that they put on the coffee table. Some of the the towels in the bathroom had holes in them which I was not expecting considering the "luxury" status they claim. Amenities in the bathroom was good but they did not refill them, we had used half of the shampoo and bath gel and did not get replacements. Breakfast was very minimal and on the last day ended up eating outside. The really nice thing about the hotel are the staff, very helpful and always smiling especially one of the waiters. Forgot his name but think he is of Indian decent and wears glasses, always has a smile on his face. They did offer to waive the extra $100/night for the extra person, but not until we complained. Location is nice, not to far from the MRT and next to Raffles, but because Singapore can be hot, we ended up taking the taxi most of the time. Because its a fairly new hotel, not all the taxi's know the location, so just tell them the street. In the end not at bad hotel, but definitely not "luxury" as they say and because of this stay we would not be back and probably wouldn't recommend it. Be sure to check out the rooftop pool, amazing views at night.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: GarethDouglas1979
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here on the first few nights of our honeymoon. It's not a traditional honeymoon hotel but we opted for it because of the reviews on this site. When we arrived the whole check-in process was very slick and pretty quick. The room itself was superb with absolutely tons of gadgets and accessories. And spotless too. Our room (a deluxe room) had loads of space. Would have been great to have a balcony on reflection but that's where the pool comes in. The rooftop pool is amazing. Great views over the city and a perfect place to take a dip. All in all a great hotel for a short stay in Singapore!

Reviews.Title: “Loved it !!!”
Reviews.Author: bigteddy
Reviews.Content: From the moment we walked in the front door we were made to feel special -- personally shown to our room -- Front desk staff went out of their way to help with any questions, directions and suggestions etc-- room was fabulous -- we had a patio suite -- which was certainly worth the expense -- loved the rooftop pool - only ever saw one other person up there-- I;ll be back again, but longer next time

Reviews.Title: “A few faults let this hotel down”
Reviews.Author: Angel2001
Reviews.Content: I wish I could unreservedly recommend the Naumi. First, the good parts: the bed, shower, and size of rooms are excellent. The in-room facilities (we were in a deluxe room), and complimentary soft drinks are great, and the rates are pretty reasonable. The rooftop pool is just wonderful. However, on the first night of our stay (when my boyfriend had just got off a 12 hour flight - he was spending 36 hours in Singapore before getting the same flight back) - we were woken up at 11pm by a staff member turning on the light and ushering another couple into our room. We were totally surprised, particularly as the staff just said 'Oh, sorry!' and slammed the door! When I sweetly mentioned what had happened the next morning at reception, I was met with blank, disbelieving looks and 'We will look into that.' We hoped for some kind of apology at some point during our stay but one never came. Breakfast can be served either in the bar/lobby (which smells a bit hospital-like), so we ordered to the room. This cost $70. After 45 minutes, tiny portions of stone-cold eggs, dry cold toast and cold coffee arrived. They had completely forgotten the main part of the set breakfast, some chicken concoction. It was the kind of breakfast one might expect in a 2* Ibis, with butter in tiny tabs. When we sent it back, we got a suspicious chap who actually tested the coffee to make sure we were telling the truth. Very out-of-sorts, we got dressed and went next door to the Empire Cafe at Raffles where breakfast for both of us was $25. After that, we had breakfast in the bar/lobby every morning, which was far more decent and they even considerately put out asprins and vitamins.
