To cut a long story short, in our experience, this is a good hotel for the business traveler looking for something less corporate in Singapore. It's smack bang in the business district which is central but there's nothing really around it (except Raffles, which just made me wish I was staying there). Nuami is not set up for food at all, and doesn't quite live up to its proported luxury credentials. I'd spend a little bit more and go somewhere else if you want the real deal.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond service and comfort”
Reviews.Author: Annac64
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Naumi on our stopovers to and from Europe. We found the personalised service to be of an extremely high standard. Our late flights meant that we were well outside of the normal check out times but the hotel was happy to let us stay as long as we needed as our room was not being used. I have never come across this flexibility before, especially in the larger more corporate hotels. The pool has a great view and although small was never crowded. Both the Deluxe and Corporate rooms are very comfortable and quiet, with huge beds and large sofas. The location was fine, a quick taxi or MRT ride to Orchard Road if needed.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel but lack of attention to detail make me question its 'luxury' rating”
Reviews.Author: junebug75
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for three nights with my husband. The positives: Check in was quick and efficient and the reception staff was nice without being over-friendly. The room was large (got a deluxe room), the bed was very comfortable and the rooftop pool is excellent with an amazing view of Raffles Hotel and the city - definitely the highlight of the hotel. Wifi was fast and free, and the everything in the mini bar (a few softdrinks) were complimentary. The location was excellent, just right beside the Raffles Hotel and there are a lot of small restaurants nearby and walking distance to several malls. But it's the little details that make a hotel truly a 'luxury' hotel, and unfortunately Naumi doesn't come up to standard. Firstly, some areas of the hotel are starting to look a bit worn, such as the furniture in the lobby/dining area (it's white so shows wear quite quickly), there were a lot of stains on the stone floor of the 4/F hallway (where we stayed, can't say if it's the same for all floors) when you step off the elevator. I notice these things quickly but even my husband who's quite relaxed about everything noticed it too! Secondly, the door to the staff room beside the elevator was kept open all the time, so basically you see cleaning supplies, etc and the staff hanging out there everytime you go to the elevator. It's not too bad but just a bit disconcerting, like seeing a visible pantyline on an otherwise gorgeously dressed woman. Thirdly, our bathroom, although design wise was great, had black mold on the corners of the shower! The area rug in the room also had a few stains and was starting to look worn. Lastly, given that the hotel is not that well known and empty cabs don't usually pass the street, I called the front desk in advance for them to call a cab for me so it arrives at a certain time. I got down to the lobby and the front desk staff only called for a taxi right then! So I was late for the event I had to go to. So if you just need to stay in a 'nice' hotel that's in a good location in Singapore, I would recommend Naumi, but just don't expect "luxury" details one would see in a usual SLH rated hotel. If you want a real luxury boutique hotel, I recommend you stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “gd stay”
Reviews.Author: eaglepie
Reviews.Content: Nice contemporary hotel with friendly staff. The view from the rooftop pool is great, overlooking the city skyline and Formula One track

Reviews.Title: “Nice, Chic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: jambu583
Reviews.Content: Decided to stay here as it was recommended by Mr and Mrs Smith and I love boutique hotels. The hotel is in the business district which is good for business travellers but I assume that people who generally stay in such a hotel would not be business travellers. Thus, it is a bit out of the way from Orchard Road etc. Checked in early so I had the breakfast buffet in the lobby. A bit odd as the check-in desks and lounge are there too. Nevertheless, the lobby is not dissimlar to lobbies in other, more famous boutique hotels like the Metropolitan in London. I had the two-bedroom suite as a friend was joining me as well. Fairly chic room but I must say, slightly small for two-bedroom suite. The second room was very small. However, it was more cosy than cramped. Good amenities such as a large tv, nespresso machines and very comfy beds. The pool on the top floor has a fantsatic view and a drink at night there was fantastic. The night time atmosphere was lively as lounge music was played in the lobby which set the mood for a good night out. Overall, a chic hotel and I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Die, Die, must not Try”
Reviews.Author: DiBruccolino
Reviews.Content: This place is listed as a small luxury hotel, it is not: The location of the hotel is in the business area next to the City Link Mall. After spending a couple of days it seems to me that this is not the most lively area of Singapore. The hotel lobby has this artificial ambient scent that is quite annoying since breakfast is served in this area. I have to say I'm very picky about smells so I may be exaggerating. The room was not luxurious at all. I had room 705 with a view of the Raffles Hotel. There is no separation between bed area and bathroom -shower and toilet- so if you are looking for privacy this may not be the room for you. There was a problem with the cleanliness of the mattress, you could see through the sheets that it had plenty of spots of dubious aspect. On the upside, free wireless and an espresso coffee maker. Also, a big TV if you are into it. In summary, for the price I rather stay in one of the hotel chains around the block.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: warren_tw
Reviews.Content: I stayed at 3 different hotels in Singapore during my visit and this is without a doubt the best one. Here are some reasons why I like it so much. * Trendy atmosphere - The overall look of the hotel is very fashionable. The lobby looks like a very cool bar (and it is!) and the rooms are also beautifully decorated. * Kiehl's toiletries - I am a big fan for Kiehl's. Imagine how pleasantly surprised I was when I walked into the clean bathroom and noticed that they serve Kiehl's toiletries! * Technology friendly - All the amenities in my room are very easy to use. I was particularly happy with the wireless Internet access Naumi provided (because the other two hotels that I stayed at didn’t offer the same service). Also, the universal power socket also made my life a lot easier. * Comfortable Bed - I didn’t even know why I bothered to borrow a DVD from the Reception. The minute I laid myself on that bed, I just felt like sinking in. I fell asleep within a couple of minutes and missed the entire movie. * Infinity pool - Despite that I only stayed at Naumi for 1 day, I managed to visit their pool 3 times. It was THAT lovely. If you are after a good swimming session, I am not sure this is the pool for you because of its size. However, it is perfect for a dip and what a view! I think this hotel delivers everything its website mentions. I would strongly recommend it to all travelers to the Civic District of Singapore. My only advice is to go for the Deluxe Rooms or better room types. I personally got a Deluxe Room and was fortunate enough to have a peek at their Premium Room. The Deluxe Room is a lot more spacious and therefore gets your money’s worth.

Reviews.Title: “A little gem in a modern city”
Reviews.Author: docmanEngland
Reviews.Content: My husband, 23 year old daughter and I have just spent 8 nights at the Naumi. Check in was seamless, we were on the 7th floor (10 in total) in a 2 bedroom suite. Best accommodation we have ever had. All amenities - superb beds and high quality linen. Large bathroom. Full size fridge + freezer with complimentary drinks - refilled daily. High speed free internet access. Staff unobtrusive but very helpful. Small infinity pool only enough beds for 7 guests - but not a problem during our stay. One evening the pool area had been booked for a wedding - there was no prior notice of this given to the guests which was a bit of a nuisance. Breakfast excellent - replenished immediately - freshly cooked eggs on request. Location - could not be better - walking distance of Esplanade, Singapore River, Singapore Flyer. Raffles next door and MRT one block away. Lot of local restaurants nearby - Would recommend Chin Chin's. Hotel only has 40 rooms - very personal and would definietely stay there again. The large business type sky rises do not compare. Great not to be surrounded by business men on their mobile phones. Hotel would not be that suitable for very young children but then again I would not expect many families with young children would spend time on a city break.

Reviews.Title: “Minimal boutique hotel with atmospheric view from the roof top pool”
Reviews.Author: PurdeyHJ
Reviews.Content: My fiance was staying here for business and i joined him for the last 2 nights. The staff were incredibly friendly and welcoming. The hotel has modern, minimalist decor and the rooms are spacious and well designed. The bed was wonderfully comfortable and we had a floor to ceiling window with a view across the Singapore skyline. The bathroom was stocked with Kiehl's products. The toilet was surrounded by frosted glass, which might not be enough privacy for some couples! The breakfast was delicious and the location was really convenient - just a couple of minutes from Raffles. This hotel's a great alternative to the somewhat impersonal 5 star hotels that abound in Singapore. The roof top pool is fab - lovely decking and a wonderful view across the Singapore skyline. The hotel was rather quiet when we were there - but great for relaxing.

Reviews.Title: “Quite, Personal, Technology Friendly”
Reviews.Author: Chakshu_Roy
Reviews.Content: Check in: Efficient. A member of the staff escorted us to our room and explained about the various in room amenities and the various facilities that the hotel provided. Room: Clean. An uncluttered work desk. A thoughtfully designed kitchenette. Microwave, Coffee Maker, Iron and all cutlery/dishes were provided. The in room safe has a power point for laptops and mobile phones. Tech in the room: Cisco VoIP phones. DVD Player, Large Flat screen TV which can be turned around completely, so that you can either view it sitting on the couch or on the bed. The hotel gives free of charge gaming stations [x box, wii]. Tip: The gaming stations are quite in demand, so make sure you ask for one soon after checking in. To actually get one, you might have to follow up with the front office staff deligently. I stayed 3D/4N

Reviews.Title: “Excellent base to work and play Singapore”
Reviews.Author: dutchkiwi
Reviews.Content: After having booked a large hotel, my colleague suggested we try the Naumi. He had read about Naumi in Conde Naste. The Naumi is a great find. Tucked away in Seah Street, it is surrounded by small Singaporean restaurants, close to the CBD and next to the Raffles Hotel. My colleague is a smoker, so he booked the patio suite, whereby I took an executive. 56 sq meters, a superbly outlayed room. All important amenties at hand. Who does not love having a nespresso machine in the room? A nice touch would be to have small cups of coffee cream rather than powder cream. The bathroom has a bath tub (freestanding) and a standing rain shower. Fantastic! The work desk is convenient. Also handy is the wireless phone. Wireless internet was included in the rate (yes hospitality colleagues, take note!) and so was breakfast. The breakfast offering was adequate, just what is needed to start a day of work. The pool deck is on the 10th floor, overlooking the Raffles Hotel and the CBD skyline. The bed is amazingly comfortable. I wish I could take it home. Naumi comes highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Smooth, highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Vitaly70
Reviews.Content: Superb location and really nice bed! Great rooftop pool with city view. Ideally positioned Siah street in Tanjong Pagar District offers easy access to the best of Singapore's fine dinning.

Reviews.Title: “Best Boutique Ever”
Reviews.Author: Overseez
Reviews.Content: The cab driver from the airport didn’t know where it was and had to phone a friend to find out, but in fact it’s across the street from Raffles; central, well-located and discrete. Check-in was hassle free. Room (suite) elegant and appealing: spacious hallway, counter-top/kitchenette, work area with striking stem of ginger on the buffet, huge lounge area with an enormous flat screen and a Bose sound system (they really are as good as the advertisements say!), and a wood paneled wall abutting the bedroom. That wall pivots, like a Venetian, vertically slatted, and can electronically open onto the bedroom slightly or entirely. Nice touch! There is, BTW, another flat screen in the bedroom. Fault-free bathroom: White marble floors, black marble vanity, shower with hand-held or rain head, separate bath, nice sink, shaving mirror, Kiehl’s amenities (no joking, Kiehl’s amenities! How great is that?), and a sliding door that has, on both sides, a full-length mirror: Other hotels should take note! The room design, with its ample storage, generous flow and attention to detail was the epitome of a pied-a-terre; I’ve seen larger condos with less thoughtful space considerations. Decent expanded continental breakfast, truly lovely little pool area on the roof (although six guests and it’s packed), very helpful staff. Little freebies, such as water and soda daily, a very nice touch. Endless lighting and ambiance options: Virtually every switch was on a dimmer and a master was next to the bed. Really impressive. Excellent AC although a tad noisy. Absolutely no complaints. Would stay here again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: “Chic, classy and individual in the heart of Singapore”
Reviews.Author: Blue021
Reviews.Content: Naumi is a stylish boutique hotel in the heart of bustling Singapore right next to Raffles. Modern and stylish and a complete one off - stunning rooms with lots of space and a rooftop infinity swimming pool overlooking the city. Staff were friendly and helpful and every bit of this hotel oozes style and sophistication whilst being laid back and informal at the same time.

Reviews.Title: “Stunning boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: TO_traveller69
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved this hotel. Everything from the location, the service, rooms, lobby, rooftop terrace / infinity pool were amazing. One of the best hotels we have stayed in

Reviews.Title: “Pretty good”
Reviews.Author: Kingseat
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights at this hotel en route to Perth. I booked one of the courtyard suite rooms as we have a young baby and we wanted to have our own space when he was sleeping. This room did exactly that. The bedroom although not a separate room is contained by heavy curtains from the livingroom area. The courtyard although enclosed was a good enough space to sit and have a glass of wine in the evening. As mentioned by previous reviwers the bathroom is excellent as are the room facilities. If I had one small gripe it would be the lack of washing up liquid and a cloth to dry the dishes provided by the hotel for your use. Perhpas a bit anal of me but I did question the cleanliness of the crockery etc due to the absence of these items but I would have washed them again if they were provided. Our room rate included a complimentary mini bar however you should note that this is only 4 cans of soda/fizzy drink and 2 bottles of water so if you are expecting alcohol then you will be disappointed. The staff were fantastic with us and they loved our little boy. We advised them that we needed an early check-in of 9 am and they said they would try their best to accommodate us and they did. We arrived just before 9 am and we were greeted by our names. We were shown within a few minutes to our room after being offered breakfast. I don't travel with my laptop but the hotel are happy to let you borrow one of their laptops to use in the main reception area for as long as needed. The breakfast was more than adequate for us although when on holiday I do like the big buffet spreads but we were happy with what the limited space for breakfast provided plus you can have eggs cooked your way. The roof top pool is a good chill out area too. During our 5 nights we visited everyday and never saw another soul up there! The hotel is just minutes walk from the Raffles Mall where we found a supermarket that stocked all the baby stuff such as nappies, wipes etc that we needed. We were also able to pick up some wine and nibbles to have on the patio in the evening. This hotel was perfect for us as a family. Within good walking distance of everything we wanted to see/do over our 5 days.

Reviews.Title: “Most Horrible Experience”
Reviews.Author: Kartell
Reviews.Content: Booked a Patio Suite for a night to celebrate a friend's birthday and had the most horrible experience ever! Despite 3 repeated confirmations and a site visit, there were horrific let downs... Lack of cutlery, wrong room reserved for us, wrong check-in time assigned, a hot wine cooler-yes, hot!, no wine glasses-yes they ran out! Having to beg for ice and plates.... and the ultimate in hotel luxury, bed linen with holes in them! Boy, did we scamper off first thing in the morning! Here's the story; I had guests flying in for the surprise party and had confirmed with the hotel upon booking on my requirements for a specific room and our need for wine glasses and basic cutlery. I called again 2 days before the booking date and even paid a visit to view the room and make sure the arrangements were made, I was given the assurance all details were being seen to and taken care of. Mistakes and hiccups are are inevitable but the way we were treated by the staff was atrocious! Upon arrival, we were smugly told the 12pm check in time we had confirmed repeatedly was 'subject to availability' and that the room we had specifically booked and confirmed thrice was also 'subject to availability'. After the hassle, we finally check in at 2pm into another room as our confirmed room was not available and still "subject to availability' At 3pm,4pm and 5pm, our 'confirmed room' was still not available, all this time I had guests arriving and arrangements flying out of the window for the 'surprise' party. Finally at close to 6pm, the 'confirmed' room was finally available and we proceeded to prepare for the party, only to find that the hotel had 'ran out' of cutlery, wine glasses and plates. Upon our complaint, the hotel decided to provide a complimentary tiramisu cake for the guest whom we had booked the suite for. The cherry on the cake had to be the very hot and oven-like wine cooler. Despite several requests for it to be replaced, nothing was done, we then had to beg for ice to chill our wine and beverages. The party started and we called for the cake to be sent to the room, when the cake arrived, we were terribly embarassed as the 'cake' turned out to be a deflated piece of tiramisu measuring 4 by 4 inches! I would have rather not have the 'cake' as it was a source of embarassment! Having spent the entire day trying to put the event together despite the hiccups, we were spent and were trying to settle in for the night the night when we lifted the bed cover and there it was right in the centre of the bed, 4 holes in the bed linen.... By then we were too tired to even complain, we just wanted to leave the hotel first thing in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Funky and Fabulous!!”
Reviews.Author: SS2
Reviews.Content: Funky: Hotel interiors ... super cool lobby, awesome king size bed, huge flat screen tv, kiehl toiletries, open style type bathroom. Fabulous: Awesome rain shower head plus hand held shower, complimentary bottles of water at turndown, amazing rooftop infinity pool and toilet with a view! Service: Exceptional! Location: Brilliant! - easy walking distance to Raffles City Shopping and amazing food court on the 3rd floor, around the corner from the famous 'Yet' .. Hainanese Chicken Rice shop in Purvis Street, walk to Suntec City Shopping and another great food court - line up for some Prata, also walking distance to Chijmes, Bugis St and Bugis Junction shopping mall. Roughly SGD11 cab fare ride to local hawker stall hangout at East Coast Lagoon Hawker stalls - clean and super cheap! Bit hard to catch a cab back tho .. best to go with a local! SGD7 cabfare ride to Vivocity shopping mall down near Sentosa. Even cheaper by MRT! Closest MRT is Raffles City ... Orchard Rd shopping is roughly 4 stops away!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel in perfect location”
Reviews.Author: Hazzles78
Reviews.Content: Loved the Naumi. Great location, beautiful room. Infinity pool fantastic both day and night. Didn't have breakfast so can't comment on that (too many great places to eat in Singapore to waste time/money on a hotel breakfast!). Would return in a heartbeat. Tip: If you visit the Aquarium on Sentosa Island be sure to have Fish Reflexology...amazing experience!

Reviews.Title: “Loved this boutique hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Grgeous
Reviews.Content: Had a xmas party in one of their corporate suites. This hotel was about 1 year old and I simply loved the design of the room. Room facilities was beyond expectation and the only drawback of this hotel is the poor view from the room. For couples looking for romantic gateaway or business people organising a meeting, this hotel is indeed a good choice. I liked the infinity pool at night and overlooking the skyscapers of Singapore! Imaging booking a night there during New Year Eve. It has the best view of the fireworks from the pool. The money spent on its service and standard are well worth it!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Boutique Hotel.....No faults”
Reviews.Author: icecreamlady0
Reviews.Content: Stylish boutique hotel sitauted next to the famous Raffles Hotel. Rooms immaculate and very stylish. The bed was made for sleeping in, amazing bedding. Roof terrace with pool overlooking Singapore breath taking. Take in the Whiskey buffet which gives you a variety of blends at a lower cost that the nearby bars. I would totally recommend a stay here its.....Heaven!!! Also lots of nice products in the room for the ladies. Lots af extra finishing touches the make they stay more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Small, stylish hotel and nice staff”
Reviews.Author: Fandango'ne
Reviews.Content: This is a small stylish hotel, located near Raffles, and, as other reviewers have noted, the rooms certainly have the wow factor - very smartly furnished, fab lighting, very large room with a kitchen and living room. Lots of technology, two massive TV's (one in lounge and one in bedroom) and our bed was also the most comfortable we've ever had. Bathroom was large and immaculate with a huge separate shower area. The lobby area is very modern, it's a bright and airy space with colourful furniture and interesting lighting. Breakfast is in the lobby which some might not like too much and space constraints mean the breakfast selection was short of the typical extensive offering at the Pan or InterCont, but what is there was well considered and the quality of every item was excellent. Also, not having hundreds of guests at breakfast is a very pleasant change, staff are attentive and, significantly, there is none of the usual hussle and bussle around the 'buffet'. Possibly the service isn't quite as polished as at the major 5*s (reception desk is hidden, so they didn't see us arrive to help with our bags) but their personality and enthusiasm MORE than makes up for this Eg. we asked for all our bedding to be changed from feather when we arrived (due to allergies). The housekeeping staff were extremely accommodating and really could not have been more helpful. The rooftop infinity pool pool has a great view over the city and Raffles hotel. The pool area is small but visually attractive with good rattan furniture. The leaf shape loungers are very comfy!

Reviews.Title: “Very good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mlddrss
Reviews.Content: The Naumi is a relatively new boutique hotel in Singapore. The rooms are sleek a nd immaculate. The rooftop pool is absolutely gorgeous and has a great view of the financial district skyline. Especially at night the view is superb. The only downside is that the breakfast is a little boring. But in Singapore, where there is so much good food always just around the corner, this is not a major problem. And, if you are a party animal, they provide a lot of hangover remedies at breakfast. We had a room with a balcony that I can definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific New Hotel”
Reviews.Author: JNY22
Reviews.Content: This newer property really stands our from the typical business hotel rooms that so many places in this city offer. The very sleek rooms include flat screen TV's, DVD players, and free wireless internet. The lobby is great, and the breakfast includes some very unique dishes. Staff is great, and attentive - I highly recommend staying here, the same price gets you a very standard room at most other hotels here.

Reviews.Title: “A very comfortable stay but the inexperience of the hotel staff showed through”
Reviews.Author: Juclesia
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the naumi for four nights and overall, it was a fairly pleasant experience. We had a deluxe suite which was extremely comfortable and spacious. The bed was very comfortable and I got better sleep there than I have at any other hotel I've stayed in. The bathroom had a separate shower and large bath tub which was great especially after a long day of shopping/sight seeing. The views from the infinity pool on the rooftop were fantastic and the pool area was a great spot to laze around for a bit. The hotel is located in a nice central spot - it's within walking distance to Arab street, Chjimes, the merlion, Raffles Hotel and the City Hall MRT station. One of the things that I noticed pretty quickly about the hotel is the fact that their staff are pretty young and their inexperience did show through at times. An example of this would be the fact that I had called the hotel prior to our arrival to ask if we could get an early check in (as our flight was arriving in the early hours of the morning) and I was assured that it would be arranged, however, when we did get there, we had found that our room had not yet been cleaned up by housekeeping. Another example would have been when my partner had the unfortunate luck of developing appendicitis during our stay. I found when I called reception to find out what we could do about seeing a doctor, they were (at best) unsure of how we needed to proceed to get help. I was rather unimpressed with how they handled the situation until the shift manager stepped in. It wasn't all bad with the hotel staff though, they were very friendly and warm at all times which can be a refreshing change from many of the larger hotels.

Reviews.Title: “Best Birthday Celebration!”
Reviews.Author: Irinaloo
Reviews.Content: Naumi Hotel is one great place! Fantastic service! The room is huge! The bed is so comfy it feels so good to sleep in.. the bathtub is huge! Infinity pool upstairs is a great place to chill and watch the sun set... They mostly have everything you need in the room.. my boyfriend booked the executive suite and invited my family and friends over for a surprise birthday party for me... I had a very good time there. The only thing which I find annoying is the toilet door. It doesnt come with a lock (which means whenever we need to go, we need to shout out if there's anyone using it at that moment... also, you need to slide it with care as it bangs onto the marbel wall and creates a loud bang which can be annoying.. this went on throughout the nite from other rooms and for light sleepers, it may be a deal breaker.... Overall, I simply loooove Naumi.. I will MOST DEFINITELY come back again (my friends were so impressed by this hotel they are planning a X'Mas Party to be held there!!)

Reviews.Title: “Amazinh Hotel”
Reviews.Author: acfdny
Reviews.Content: Just wanted to echo the other reviews of this hotel. This really is a fabulous place to stay in Singapore, Great location, amazing infinity pool with views of Raffles & CBD. We stayed here for 5 days which is about the right amount of time to see Singapore. Loads of attractions to see Sentosa (Fort Silosa was very interesting), Orchard Road, Fort Canning Park, Changi Prison, Singapore Art Museum & National musem are all worth exploring. We also found the cutest bar & dessert cafe called Cafe Doumas at 124 Owen Road (just behind Farrer Park MRT). They had great cocktails and desserts to die for. Can also reccomend Cafe Salivation at 75 Syed Alwi Road which offers chic vegetarian food at bargain prices. Drinks at Loof and New Asia Bar (top of Swissotel) also recommended for the views. Beware drinks are so expensive in Singapore. Do also eat at the hawker centres (like the locals) we found the food to be as good if not better than the restaurants and wonderfully cheap!

Reviews.Title: “Wow - a fabulous hotel”
Reviews.Author: Sandie002
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. As a wheelchair user - it was almost perfect - however 2 steps at the front was a downer. However they have assured me they are going to address that issue. They did appear from inside to assist each time we returned to the hotel. Beds were incredibly comfortable. Breakfast excellent. Staff very helpful and always on hand to assist. Excellent location - walking distance to some of Singapores attractions or a cheap taxi ride to Orchard Rd. Mini bar included as well!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the room - great bed”
Reviews.Author: PhilandViv
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed in a corporate suite for the last weekend in October - with Hallowen being celebrated at the locl bars. The hotel is in a great location, just a short stroll to the Raffels centre and the City Hall MRT. Nearby Chijmes has great nightlife - although the price of drinks can be eye watering so take advatgae of the free beers in the room and don't forget to bring some duty free wine to start the evening. The room that we had (303) didn't have the best views but was large and well furnished. The bed was really comfortable and the shuttered wall interesting (one of the walls can be opened and closed like a large set of vertical blinds!). The staff are young and enthusiastic - perhaps too much, but nobody gets hurt by staff being overly attentive. They will remember your name after the first introduction. Great infinity pool too.

Reviews.Title: “Singapore's best kept secret !”
Reviews.Author: Diptesh
Reviews.Content: After receiving strong recommendation from a dear friend who stayed at Naumi, choose to book myself here for 5 days when I went to see the Singapore F1 race (despite the rates being increased more than three fold due to the event). Being a new place, cabbies are not aware of the hotel, but the memorable experience started the moment we reached the premises from the airport. There was a light shower in progress & the proactive staff, spotting us from the lobby, rushed out with umbrellas to take us & luggage dry inside. The second surprise was when they upgraded us from an Executive Suite to a Corporate Suite. The room was fabulous - very well done up, extremely large, awesome bathroom, etc. They even had a storeroom for keeping bags (makes the room very neat) and having an ironing board & iron. The wide corridor had on one side the kitchen platform having the Nespresso machine, stove, fridge, oven, all critical cutlery & a wine humidor ! The living area had a comfortabl sofa & a HUGE plasma TV. The bedroom had its own plasma with enough storage cupboards. Good taste in decor, extremely comfortable king bed. But what takes the cake is the excellent service we experienced in the five days - all staff knew us by name, gave important guidance for travel, etc. Small things like a smiling welcome & escort to the lifts every time you entered the place, "have a nice time / day" every time you stepped out - made the hotel stand out from the usual mechanical 5 stars. House keeping was very good - expensive, good quality toiletries in the bathroom. Very simple F&B - the lobby serves as a buffet breakfast lounge (the variety / quality's just right / enough) and at night the same place turned into a whiskey bar with a minimalistic food menu. No pretentions that F&B is not the driver but a support. Place is quite small - believe 40 odd rooms, all suites - hence space allocation is towards room backed by excellent service. The focus is on a quality stay & that makes the price (at par with normal 5 star) all the more worthwhile. Very well located - just behind Raffles Hotel, hop skip & jump from Raflfes City shopping complex & MRT. Have certainly decided to stay here when on business.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Little Hideaway”
Reviews.Author: fromthehorsesmouth
Reviews.Content: Wow! Greeted at reception with champagne for the start of our honeymoon! ...and then the attentive staff whisked us up to our patio room which was immaculate. This had a sofa, bar area, plasma screen which could be turned to either living area or bedroom, which had a king size bed and an i pod deck. The bathroom was also immaculate with 'his' n 'her' sink and walk in shower for two. The patio area was nice although ours did not have a view. The location was great, being opposite Raffles and walkable to many attractions such as Boat Quay and the Merlion. We were fortunate to have use of many complimentary hotel items such as internet access, DVD hire and free drinks in our mini bar! The only downsides were; on returning from an evening out we found the bar shut (11pm), and breakfast was served in the foyer. Overall we had a really enjoyable stay at Naumi and would recommend it to other couples on holiday.

Reviews.Title: “Great for extended stay”
Reviews.Author: lsoffer
Reviews.Content: Stayed in a suite for a week while in Singapore. Less expensive than regular rooms at many other hotels. Had a frig, work area, couch in living area and 2 HD TVs, free wireless internet. Very comfortable for an extended stay. Service is outstanding. Very nice breakfast available. Two workout rooms, one for cardio and one with weights, are both small and cramped, but otherwise this hotel is perfect.

Reviews.Title: “Diamond in the rough”
Reviews.Author: sloh
Reviews.Content: Just spent 3 nights at the Naumi in September 2008. I agree with most of the comments already expressed here in the reviews. As a regular to Singapore and know the hotels and area well, this is my first time at the Naumi and will probably go back. It’s a small hotel not meant to be a resort (aka NO spa facility) but a city (business) hotel. It leans towards being hip & trendy without being over the top pretentious. (Rooms and public spaces are stylish but still very comfortable). The place is efficient but still have some warmth to it and a nice vibe. I also considered the Majestic but in the end am glad that I went to the Naumi (mostly for the convenient location). The location is ideal near the Marina area and just behind THE Raffles Hotel. I didn't have trouble finding a taxi and the hotel staff was always ready to call for one. The location is a short walk to Suntec City (convention area), Esplanade (“durian” theatre) and Raffles City to catch the MRT underground train. The rooms are nicely appointed, clean, modern and spacious (we were in 902). The all inclusive price was convenient. The room felt like home! NICE TOUCHES: - Large refrigerator - Mini bar included (but mostly soft drinks, water and beer) - Nespresso Coffee Machine - iPod/Clock Radio (plug in your own iPod music!) - Fresh flowers in room/bathroom - FREE wireless internet connection (included with my rate) - Super large flat screen TV and DVD player - Bed was comfortable! - Spacious shower with separate stand alone tub (in Room 902) - Dramatic lighting (too bad they didn’t have a dimmer switch to control the mood) The mysterious “plumbing” noise: Just like someone else mentioned here, we did encounter that strange noise on the first night. We first heard it late afternoon on the day we arrived. It sounded like a jack hammer in the distance. However, the noise persisted periodically through the night. It woke me up 2 – 3 times. At that point, I assumed it was the filter pumps for the swimming pool? We were on the 9th floor just below the pool deck! I mentioned the noise to the staff the next morning, they made a note of it but did not explain the noise? The noise went away! Somehow they took care of it? The following day, the staff asked me about the noise again which led me to believe that the hotel staff is aware of the noise problem?! About the service: Someone else also mentioned the attentiveness being annoying… We had the same experience. Though I give them credit for the effort and everyone seem pleasant. But most times, it seem “forced”. For example, when you come down to the lobby on your way out, the staff would “run” ahead of you just to open the door for you?! It seem so unnecessary?! Same thing, when you return, they would run ahead just to press the elevator button for you?! At those prices, I would like to see more confidence in the staff (a couple of people did stand out as being more professional?!). But in general, when you ask them a question or talk to them, they seem tentative and nervous… When they greet you, it felt contrived. It should be more authentic instead of just “checking off the box” of things to do when you see a guest! Finally: Being on the 9th floor, our room actually had a nice city view (same as from the pool) since we are just below the pool deck. The night time city lights view is great. However, we had our blinds closed most of the time. The building façade is lit up at night and we have a bright light fixture just outside our window. Again, all this is minor, minor, minor stuff! It’s such a nice hotel, I just want them to be PERFECT!!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: DC7
Reviews.Content: have just returned from Honeymoon and after 9 nights in Maldives, we certainly enjoyed 3 days in Singapore. Naumi is one of the best Hotels I have stayed in, anywhere in the World. While aimed at the Business traveller, we both enjoyed the facilities. Just around the corner (5 minute walk) from Suntech (Shopping) and literally right next door to Raffles. We arrived in Singapore at 7am and the Team at Naumi bent over backwards to just us an earlier check-in, which they did, so our room was ready at 10am. Excellent and we both highly recomend the experience.

Reviews.Title: “Naumi for class and style”
Reviews.Author: Emilia4
Reviews.Content: The hotel is beautifully designed and everything ran extremely efficicently whilst we were there. Our room was super stylish, toiletries were lovely, the free mini bar was a treat and the coffee making machine in the room was a morning must-have. Staff are helpful and professional and breakfast is simply divine. This is one slick hotel and although I loved it, Naumi, for me, could just be a little too super-cool to be a really comfortable place from which to hang out and explore the wonderful city of Singapore.

Reviews.Title: “oh dear”
Reviews.Author: LaurenceKualaLumpur
Reviews.Content: It started fine with an upgrade and the room was great. Location excellent, easy to move around with a mix of restaurants nearby and the metro within easy walking distance. But disaster, and not at all noticeable on arrival, there is a serious problem with the plumbing. At times during the night we could hear water from all four corners of the room, and this wasn't the flow of water to bathrooms this was an enormous noise, like someone tipping a bath full of water on your ceiling, regularly. so the property has been refurbished but someone forgot the plumbing, the management are aware I was told and you will be if you stay here, sorry cause it is special, but what a problem they have.

Reviews.Title: “Stylish hotel with amazing rooftop pool!”
Reviews.Author: Summerpalace
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel, modern and stylish, amazing rooftop pool - absolutely stunning with amazing views over Singapore. Great location, easy to get around every where. Rooms are modern, spacious, lovely and stylish. Staff very attentive (overly so a times!). Definitely recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “For women”
Reviews.Author: rcoimbra
Reviews.Content: This is a great hotel for people how are traveling to Singapora in work. The room is the best (corporate suite), big, great bed, 2 big plasmas. The breakfast is medium. The hotel has nothing like SPA or that kind of stuf. But if you are going to work this hotel is the best since the bedroom is great. Staff is very friendly. Swiming pool on top is very small, but the view...The space that the breakfast is serve is the same space to have dinner, the food is good and not expensive, but go out for dinner :-)

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: mitchmu
Reviews.Content: A fantastic stylish new hotel in Singapore. Great location. Incredible lap pool on roof. Nice style. Great breakfast. Wish it was possible to open the windows and get fresh air. Staff needs to be trained in hotel basics, very helpful but quite inefficient. I would stay again. Really enjoyed the style and cleanliness.

HotelInfo.Name: Naumi Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 41 Seah Street | (was previously Metropole Hotel), Singapore 188396, Singapore
